ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for choosing AVANI Kalutara Resort to spend your valuable time and taking the time to share your valuable experience with us. Your invaluable feedback and rating will help us continually improve the standard and level of our service offered to all of our AVANI guests.

Once again I apologize for the shortfalls experienced, and please be assured your constructive feedback is well taken. Warm Regards,

Avani Kalutara Resort.
placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
When I arrived, I seemed to be the only guest. I asked where the other guests were, and they replied that the resort had lost power so the guests were out for the day. When the power returned, the wifi still didn’t work.

Avani boasts that they are “located on a peninsula all our own,” but they fail to mention that they allow garbage to pile up on their peninsula. I sat at a table in the bar area and had a stunning view of an inlet heaped with trash and filth. The trashy atmosphere was complimented with an apparently all-subwoofer sound system that pulsed through the whole place.

When I finally went to pay, their system wasn’t working, so the guy behind the counter did the math by hand on a scrap of paper and input the total into a little handheld device. Instead of giving it to me to sign for my credit card, he simply forged my signature without my consent. How convenient!
title: Resort on a striking trash-lined peninsula

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Déçus par cet hotel, on s'attendait à beaucoup mieux!  
Impossible de se baigner dans la mer à cause des vagues, la plage n'est pas terrible, peu de transats et très en pente. Elle pourrait être mieux aménagée. Du coup on est resté à la piscine.
Piscine colonisée par les corbeaux et leurs fiantes, c'est plutôt bruyant. Douches pas pratiques...

Très grande chambre, mais pas très cosy, pas assez de place dans l'armoire pour 2 personnes, un petit canapé ou au moins 2 chaises pour pouvoir s'asseoir manquent... mais belle salle de bain. Merci à Limal qui s'en est tres bien occupé et qui était toujours très dévoué!!

Buffet du restaurant avec du choix, mais nourriture pas terrible,  plutôt internationale que Sri Lankaise! Manquent des bons plats locaux épicés.
title: Déçus, on s'attendait à beaucoup mieux

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Никогда не писал отзывы, но тут сами понимае��е:

Забронировали отель с 29ноября по 8 декабря.
Встретили как полагается,выдали влажные полотенца и напоили соком со входа.
Местный шведский стол опротивел на третий день, 99% еды- острая.
В любое время дня - их фирменное блюдо салат с макаронами)))

Вроде можно закрыть глаза, не в гастротур летели.
6 декабря при выходе из номера дорогу преграждает управляющий,мол видите-ли у них приехала индусская свадьба и выкупила всю гостиницу, мы вас сейчас переселим.

Говорю,что у меня назначена экскурсия, не канает- поехали показывать мне старый корпус отеля с видом на речку-вонючку... Отказываюсь, предложил компенсировать мне неудобства в купе с неиспользованными днями чтобы я переехал в другую гостиницу,которую забронирую сам - управляющий ушел думать....подождали его час-другой,нету...(Экскурсия и вообще планы на день естественно коту под хвост)

Выходим из отеля-бежит тянет руку и все по новой,вот мол переезжайте давайте...
Кстати, водитель тук-тука рассказал,что такой случай в данной гостинице далеко не первый.
Возвращаемся в номер,для справки у  меня был оплачен завтрак и ужин, приходит-долбится в дверь-открываю: опять тот же управляющий,говорит что ужин принесет сам и не надо выходить из номера 🤣🤣🤣 вы серьезно?!

roomTip: Use the Anantara restaurants next door. The Avani restaurant is poor quality for a resort.
text:
Booked on an app which doesn't show options other than B&B so assumed we could eat a la carte at the restaurant. First night we ate in the room as the kids were tired. Room service menu is unappetitsing and limited. 2nd night was the shocker. Kids were hungry so we went to the restaurant to order from a la carte menu. 10 minutes after sitting and about to order, a server comes to us to say that unless we order a buffet, we can't sit in the restaurant. Further we need to sit by the non-aircondirioned and mosquito overrun lobby area by the BAR (with 2 kids!) and eat a la carte there! We were appalled and walked up to our room to order some rubbish from the awful room service menu. You'd think A RESORT would have better restaurant options and that the hotel's only restaurant would allow 
guests to sit and eat from the restaurant menu! We have traveled all around the world but never seen such nonsense like this. When you sit down at a restaurant to eat, you don't insult guests by asking them to leave the restaurant and eat some place else! When a complaint was made to the manager, he says we can go back in...I said No. You don't insult guests and move them in and out of a restaurant. Who does that?!
title: Hotel restaurant is guest-unfriendly

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
did not initially intend to write a review, but I feel compelled to share our disappointing experience during our recent stay. We booked a three-night stay on a half-board basis and received a confirmation email stating that the total cost would be approximately LKR 100,000. We paid a 50% deposit in advance.

Before our arrival, the Front Manager contacted us two or three times, and we confirmed that we would be coming for dinner. Upon arrival, however, we were greeted rudely by the security personnel, who disrespectfully spoke to my husband. When we questioned his attitude, he replied, “Because you are wearing shorts and a t-shirt. I thought you were a driver.” This was incredibly embarrassing and left us feeling humiliated. We were shocked by such behaviour and disappointed that staff would judge and treat guests based on their attire or presumed occupation.

We were then directed to Anantara Kalutara for dinner, where we were informed that our booking was only for bed and breakfast, not half-board as we had booked and received no prior communication regarding this change. The Front Manager from Avani called us and insisted that we either pay for our dinner or accept sandwiches delivered to our room. This was highly disappointing, especially as we were traveling with our three-year-old son. As a result, we did not enjoy our dinner and returned to our room, which was also quite small and uncomfortable.
They should figure out their internal management issues and should not embarrass their guests based on their mistakes.

Given the circumstances, we decided to transfer to Anantara Kalutara the next morning. The staff at Anantara Kalutara were exceptional, completely transforming our mood and providing a pleasant environment to enjoy the remainder of our vacation in Sri Lanka. I would like to extend my gratitude to Anantara Kalutara for their outstanding service, which made a significant difference in our stay.
title: Bad experience

text:
Very poor service, from the time we checked in, front office was only concerned about if we would check-out on time. Not even a smile from the staff who we think were in the supervisor level. The front office were not able to give a late check out for one room despite having booked 2 double rooms and a triple room. Systems were not updated and front office person named either ashan wanted his staff to bring my phone to check the payment instead of him reaching out to us who were the guest.
The do not disturb tag wasn’t available and despite requesting for both days it was not made available. Iron board in the room was so old that i had ti hold the board with one hand and iron with the other. The tripl room which there were 2 adults and 2 kids had only 3 500ml water bottles for a day.
Extremely poor entertainment during the xmas night. The solo guitarist was playing songs with great difficulty and hard to listen to. Coffee which we pay a premium price was just nescafe. As a hotel from the minor group we expected more luxury standards and friendlier staff.
the hotel had not got the headcount properly for the xmas dinner and we needed and extra chair, when we requested for one the staff’s reaction was as if were were trying to get someone from outside to eat free and was trying to get clarification from various persons if they should give the extra chair or not.
Overall the hotel was very poor in all the departments.
Only positive was the food. Executive chef was quite interactive and seemed interested in his guests unlike the fromt office staff.
Wouldn’t recommend avani kalutara to anyone.
title: Poor service

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at the Avani Kalutara Resort with my family, checking in on the 18th of December 2023 and checking out on the 19th. We booked two rooms with a double full board meal plan.

Unfortunately, our experience with the food left much to be desired. The quality was mediocre and fell short of the standards we expected. The main restaurant's service was particularly disappointing; the staff was slow, and there was a lack of attentiveness. This aspect significantly impacted our overall enjoyment of the stay.

One specific incident that stood out was the pool attendant's attitude when providing us with towels. It's unclear whether the unpleasant interaction was due to our status as locals, but it certainly left a sour taste in our mouths.

However, it's crucial to mention the positive aspects of our stay as well. Ashan from the reservations team deserves special recognition for his outstanding service. He was understanding and went above and beyond to enhance our experience.

Regrettably, the shortcomings in dining quality and service overshadowed the positive interactions we had. In light of these issues, I would rate our overall experience at Avani Kalutara Resort a 2 out of 5. I hope the management takes this feedback constructively to improve the overall guest experience.
title: Disappointing Dining and Service Experience

roomTip: not very vegetarian friendly property
text:
We stayed 3 Nights on half board basis ( Breakfast & Dinner).. 

We were taken aback that the buffet for breakfast as well as dinner .. had little to no options for vegetarians.. even the breads & buns contained egg..

Ultimately we had to escalate to the manager.. who arranged for some vegetarian option separately for our last dinner & breakfast.. 

Air Conditioning system in the room was not functioning properly.. because when we switch on ,, it gets extremely cold even on increased temperature and if we switch off ,, the flooring and walls get moist & wet..

Overall it was very disappointing stay.

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Well to be honest I would avoid this hotel as a traveller until it raises its service.
text: We traveled with Luxtripper who arranged a 10 day tour of Sri Lanka. We went to a number of hotels during the tour and each was of a good standard and we have no complaints. However when we arrived at this hotel we immediately felt it was not up to standard. It was an expensive holiday and this hotel labelled as 4 star most certainly was not. The staff were all very nice and helpful. However the hotel felt run down. The worst experience was the restaurant which was more like a factory canteen. It was noisy with loud music, the guests were scruffy and there seemed to be no evening dress code. We both chose chicken Tika massage which turned out to be large chunks of bone and grissel with very little chicken. We saw cockroaches on the floor, parts of the hotel carpet was stained and was dirty. We had a broken glass by our room door as we entered it. We complained to the manager. To his credit he apologized and welcomed our feedback. The end result was that we were moved to a sister hotel, the Anantara,  3 minutes walk away at no extra charge to ourselves. This was a 5 star hotel and was excellent.  I think lux tripper should use this hotel if the first hotel does not raise its standards. We will feedback to lux tripper when back home.
title: A poor hotel that felt 2 to 3 star. Most definitely not 4.

text:
We requested a ocean view room which is in 1st floor. but we were checked in to a different room, the team who checked us in didn't inform us on anything. I had to go back to the reception and tell my concern that I requested a ocean view room which is in the 1st floor afterwards they informed me that all room are booked and they are unable to provided the requested room. 

I feel I was charged more, since when I made the booking I was told ground floor room for 2 nights with FB the cost would be 60k and ocean view rooms which are in the 1st floor for 2 night FB would be 80k 

Finally I ended up paying 80k for 2 night with FB
title: Didn't receive the room we requested.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sarah C,

Thank you very much for choosing AVANI Kalutara Resort and taking the time to share your recent experience with us. Your invaluable feedback extremely helping us to improve our standard and level of our service offered to all of our AVANI guests.
Please do accept my sincere apology and I extremely disappointed to read that we were not able to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. All points mentioned have been reviewed with our Resort Management, also we ensure that further action and required training will be initiated, so such occurrence is not be repeated in the future. 

Once again I apologize for the shortfalls experienced, and please be assured your constructive feedback is well taken and will be shared with the related departments. Our overriding goal is always to provide all our guests with a pleasant and relaxing stay, as I am sure you will be able to see on your next visit and therefore we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and improve on your experience in the near future.
Warm regards,
Jude Silva,
Hotel Manager,
Avani Kalutara Resort.
placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
There were multiple challenges we encountered at the hotel. The first being the reservation line which didn't answer calls or emails. This was a repeated problem and despite wanting to stay at Anantara (sister brand as well we never managed to get a reservation! 

It's clear staff are not empowered to do anything (in fact it was clear the service was bad as they were following the corporate rules versus exhibiting the Sri Lankan hospitality we experienced everywhere else on the trip). The front desk staff couldn't provide the most competitive rate *(we had to call the reservation line and sit on hold-- I spent over an hour on hold cumulatively with the Minor brand line on our trip). Staff couldn't provide/recommend affordable transport (they had to offer the hotel rate which was $140 versus $45 which was the airport rate). I chose this hotel as a GHA platinum member and was eventually upgraded to an adequate room but our initial room was of very poor quality and clearly should have been $50 a night not $200.

I feel bad leaving such a negative review as staff were kind but the restrictions they had in providing services and the poor quality of facilities would not make me recommend this hotel to anyone. Quite disappointed as I had been looking forward to trying the Avani brand.
title: Only if paying $50 or less- poor value for money

text:
Negatives
Restaurant service was very bad. Stewards did not attend to our needs. Glasses and tables were not cleaned properly and timely. Dishes were not refilled on time, and were empty sometimes. No adequate Variety of food available, specially for vegetarians. Thoroughly disappointed on the restaurant service.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nordicgod,                                         

Thank you for sharing such detailed feedback. We’re happy to hear that you enjoyed the ambiance of our hotel, the food, the smooth check-in process, and the exceptional service from our team. It’s also great to know your partner had a relaxing experience with our hot stone massage.

However, we’re truly sorry about the difficulties you encountered, particularly with the mosquitoes and room maintenance issues. We’d like to assure you that we already use fish, such as tilapia, in the ponds to help naturally control the mosquito population. Additionally, the concerns with the shower, sink, and screen have already been addressed promptly by our maintenance team.

Your comments are invaluable in helping us further refine our services, and we are committed to continuously improving. We hope to welcome you back soon for an even better experience.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t sit outside in hotel bar in evening
text:
Stayed here for two nights whilst on a group tour of Sri Lanka with mercury holidays from the uk .

Plus points 

It’s a Lovely looking hotel
Food was great in restaurant for breakfast,lunch and dinner - plenty of choice
The staff cannot do enough for you .
Check in and out very smooth 
Bags delivered quickly 
A large room 
Lovely pool
Partner had a great hour long hot stone massage and very reasonably priced 

Bad points

This is a mosquito haven and you will be feasted on, cover up head to toe , the hotel light some citronella  candles at night but there is so so much stagnant water around in ponds that it’s a breeding ground and like a mosquito hotel .

The hotel should supply a plug in mosquito repellent device in every room instead of a plug in air freshener to mask smell of drains.

Room 137 shower leaked all over floor as sealant was not doing its job.

Shower suddenly went to freezing then normal again but you never knew when it was gonna happen .

Mosquito screen coming off from behind wooden shutter above toilet 

Pop up plug in sink popped up 2mm so water took and age to drain 

All reported on feedback form so hopefully fixed soon . 

Overall great food and service but you will be bitten all over if you venture out in grounds any time of day . 

Feedback given to travel company aswell
title: It’s mosquito heaven

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Gihani, 

Thank you for sharing your recent experience at Chaarya Resort and Spa. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the spacious rooms, delicious food, and attentive service from our restaurant staff. It’s heartening to know that our team made efforts to ensure your stay with your infant was comfortable and enjoyable.

However, we are deeply sorry to hear about your experience with the parking arrangements and security team. The inconvenience and frustration caused by these incidents are unacceptable and do not reflect the high standards of hospitality we aim to provide. Please accept our sincere apologies for the discomfort and lack of courtesy you encountered.

Your feedback regarding the behavior of the security team has been taken very seriously. We will be conducting a thorough review and providing additional training to ensure that all guests are treated with respect and that parking arrangements are managed efficiently without causing undue stress.

text:
The rooms are really nice
Food spread and taste and quality was really good too
The restaurant staff are very nice and helpful
I’m traveling with an infant and they were very considerate and kind to ensure our stay was at best

The only issue here was the security at the parking area

During the stay they kept calling us requesting to move vehicles as some tractor or other requirement

Also the security is so rude and they think they are the boss

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations. We take all feedback seriously and are always striving to improve.

Regarding the room, we regret to hear about the issues you encountered with the odor and bed arrangement. We will address this with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to ensure such inconveniences do not happen in the future. Additionally, we will review our bedding standards to ensure more comfort for our guests.

We are also sorry to hear that the buffet and meal selections did not meet your expectations. Your comments about the variety and quality of the food, especially regarding pork options and dessert variety, will be passed along to our culinary team for immediate review and improvement.

As for your concerns about customer service, we deeply regret any perception of unequal treatment. Our goal is to provide all guests, regardless of origin, with an exceptional experience. Your feedback will be discussed with the team to ensure every guest receives the high level of service we strive for.

We appreciate your input and hope you will consider giving us another chance to offer you a much-improved stay in the future.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Based on the inside photos that were posted on the website, we reserved a Deluxe Room for this long weekend. Upon arrival, it was observed that they are traditional, straight structures with no view. Though there isn't much of a difference between them, it is acceptable that chalets have a nice view. It cost an extra five thousand dollars to reserve a chalet.

Buffet/Main Meal Course: Despite it being a busy long weekend, only chicken and fish products are included for the first three buffets. The three buffets had not a single dish made with pork (wretched for this price). There's only sausages and fried fish in the evening barbecue. I'm not sure we were pleased with the meal. Both taste and variety are lacking.

Dessart items: Same items were repeatedly consisted in dessart carts, which just showed a lot of varieties there. Mainly, a lot of cakery items were included and not consisted of any standard type item (i.e., chocolate pudding); there are 03 banana-flavored category items were there, and they are not favorable for the majority.

Room: Bad odor comes from bathrooms. Even though it's a double, they had two twin mattresses coupled together; it is imperative to mention matrasses were not comfortable at all, and I have to suffer for back pain. 

The buffet is not satisfactory at all compared to the prices charged for the package. You may have enjoyed an international buffet at hotels like Turya Kalutara for the same prices. 

Customer service is satisfactory. However, it is noticed that they prioritize foreighers on extra ordinary service in order to maintain the ratings. Not recommended for the locals at all.
title: Not recommend for locals

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Our tour guide booked Chaarya Resort as one of the hotels for our Sri Lanka tour during our Yala Safari experience. Unfortunately, after staying at the previous two hotels, this one was a disappointment. The service felt more pretentious than genuinely welcoming, and they were not very accommodating. While the hotel offered a variety of food, the quality was subpar – tired salads, stale bread, sugary desserts – which might be acceptable if you're expecting something cheap and cheerful. For example, our margarita pizza was made with ketchup instead of proper tomato sauce.

On a positive note, the room was clean, but the leaking toilet raised hygiene concerns, making us question what other maintenance issues might be lurking unnoticed..
title: "Disappointing Experience with Subpar Service and Facilities at Chaarya Resort"

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your patience and understanding during this difficult situation. We sincerely regret the distress you have experienced regarding the missing money from the safes in your rooms.

As you are aware, the safety and security of our guests' belongings are of utmost importance to us. We have conducted an internal investigation and, as previously communicated by Mr. Dan Anthony Wattawana, our Operations Manager, we found no evidence of unauthorized access to the safes. Given the seriousness of your allegations, we believe it is essential to wait for the tourism police to complete their investigation. Their independent assessment will be crucial in determining the facts and ensuring that the situation is handled appropriately. We are fully cooperating with their investigation and will provide them with any information they require.
We understand your frustration and the urgency of resolving this matter. We assure you that we are committed to assisting the authorities in every possible way to expedite the investigation. We apologize for the inconvenience and distress this has caused you and your group. We hope that the authorities' findings will bring clarity to the situation. Please rest assured that we are doing everything in our power to address this matter and to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future. Thank you for your patience and understanding. We will keep you updated on any developments as soon as we receive more information from the tourism police.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Please be careful with your money and belongings at this hotel
text:
We were three couples from India who stayed at the Chaarya Resort and Spa from 10th June till 12th June,2024. All of us are senior citizens aged between 65 and 70 years. We were allotted room numbers 130,131 and 132.
On the 11th June we informed the hotel that we were going on a safari at the Yala National Park and we would require packed lunch as we would be away from 12.30 pm to 6.30pm.
Just before checking out on 12 June morning we found that 400 US dollars and 60 Singapore dollars were missing from the locked sale in room number 132 and 100 US dollars was missing from the safe in Room 131. Nothing was missing from room 130 as the occupants did not use the safe.
We are 100% sure that the money was stolen while we were away on the Safari as we had counted the money before putting it in the safe and locking it just before we left for the Safari.
We made a written complaint to the hotel management. Initially they told us in writing that they would compensate us by giving us half the amount that was stolen until such time as their internal investigation was done.
We then found that they kept on making some stupid excuses not to pay us even that.
On reaching Colombo we made a complaint to the tourism department and police on the 16th of June but we are still to hear from them.
After this the General Manager and the Operations manager spoke to me over the phone and said that since I had reported to the police they would not pay us any thing.
This review is to warn anyone staying at this hotel to be very careful with their belongings and not to leave anything in the room safe as they have some means to open it and steal from it.
title: Theft from room safes

roomTip:
Don't fall for the rosy pictures, please stay well clear of this property!!
Run down, unhygienic, filthy property, and unprofessional staff.
text:
Rooms are infested with cockroaches, bugs, and mosquitoes. Rooms are smelly, moist, and unhygienic to say the least!
No exhaust system is available in the bathroom. 
Impolite, rude, unfriendly, and uncourteous staff, specially in the dining hall.
I fail to understand how these people are even running such a run down hotel, and providing such 3rd class hospitality services, without any proper maintenance.
Don't fall for the rosy pictures uploaded of the property. Reality is far far away from the pictures posted. 
No proper lighting at the pool and garden after dark, almost missed a slip and fall. We were informed by the reception, that the globe lights are not switched on at night.
The pool was unclean and smelt disgusting.
No changing room was available at the pool area, and the pool towels provided seemed musty and smelly. 
We stayed at 5 other properties all over Sri Lanka, and none of the others was as bad as this. The management deserves a special prize for the horrible services provided! 
Please avoid this property by a wide margin. It was a nightmare for us to stay here, and we were more than glad to check out!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and disappointment you experienced during your stay at our resort. It is truly disheartening to hear about the condition and cleanliness of your allocated room.

We understand that a comfortable and clean environment is essential for a pleasant stay, and we regret that we failed to meet your expectations in this regard. Rest assured, we take your feedback seriously, and we are committed to addressing these issues promptly.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Don’t book
Online photos out of date
Food poor
Rooms dirty
Bug ridden
text:
We were allocated in the lower room, last block on the resort, furthest from the main building. I don’t think from the condition and cleanliness of the room that it had recently been occupied or cleaned.
The floors throughout were dirty, the bathroom was as hot as a steam room due to the windows only being louvered wood with a mesh over. Therefore the air con didn’t have any impact in the bathroom. There were black round beetles which emerged from under the furniture and bed, plus a large spider on the second night, together with some winged creature, which “exploded” when I stamped on it. The bed linen was discolours and the pillows ancient and lumpy.
The shower leaked from all corners and the drain was smelly.

There were building works at the back of our room, sand, cement mixer, ladders, wood and the perimeter fencing had been removed too. This was quite disconcerting as this gave direct access to the resort and the groups of stray dogs were able to raid the bins, these were stored outside our door. They tore all the food and rubbish out, which only added to the fly and beetle problems.

The restaurant was overrun with flies, crawling over the tables and cutlery and the food was very average, variety poor too.

I certainly wouldn’t recommend and the online photographs must be when the hotel first opened as the condition now certainly isn’t the same as online, hotel overall very tired.

We had toured the island and stayed at 5 hotels and non of the others were run down like this one.

Sadly it wasn’t a pleasant two day stay, was glad to check out.
title: Builders, bugs and spiders

roomTip: Check the room before checking in
text: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel with my wife and 1.5 year old child. The staff are courteous and accomodating. Food is good. However, the hotel is a bit run down. The bathroom is very worn out. I gave the hotel a bad review because they said the room would be ready in 20 minutes but it took hours. I understand that the regular check in is 2pm and we arrived a bit early but they should have not said the room.would be ready soon. The main reason I gave a bad review was that the room and bathroom had a hundred mosquitoes when we entered. I understand that its near a jungle but it doesn't absolve them from the fact that it had that many mosquitoes. I killed 20 mosquitoes in the first 5 minutes of being in the room. The hotel explained that maybe there was a window left open but that wasn't our fault as the mosquitoes were there the moment we entered. We left the hotel immediately for activities and requested that they deal with the mosquitoes. The probably did but they didn't do a good job as there were still about 50 mosquitoes in the room and bathroom. I requested some mosquito spray and killed a bunch more. If I could kill that much mosquitoes I don't see why the staff couldn't. They had 4 hours to do so while we were out. The hotel should have just apologized instead of justifying why the room had that much mosquitoes. Other than the run down rooms and bathrooms and the mosquitoes, the stay was decent.
title: Plenty of mosquitoes inside the room and bathroom 🦟

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is  lying piece of you know what. I had previously written a perfectly honest review, but deleted it due to the reply they gave, which I will also be posting. 

The management sucks. I can’t believe the attitude of this hotel! They can’t even own up to their faults and instead shift the blame on the guests! 

1. We did not leave the door open. The swarms of mosquitoes were there when we arrived. We asked you to fix this issue. When we came back 4 hours later, at 6pm, there were still 50 mosquitoes! We complained again and we were given a spray bottle! Note, we have an infant! We killed the mosquitoes ourselves! I’m from a tropical country and I’ve never seen this many mosquitoes, as in hundreds! 
2. At 9pm, you offered a room change! We were all sleeping already, you even disturbed our sleep! The next morning, at breakfast, that’s when you offered the upgrade. You said for our next stay, as if we will ever go back to your horrible hotel. It was a fake offer! 
3. The toilet is not just 1 stall, it’s all the stalls that are that dirty. It “might” be your fault? Who else’s could it be? It’s all 3 stalls! I checked all. 
4. I understand standard check-in is 2pm. I’m not stupid. I’ve been to 60 countries and even more hotels. But your front desk said it will be ready by 12:30pm. So we waited! At 1:45pm, still no room! You shouldn’t have lied about that. 
5. We kept begging for food but you wouldn’t feed us! We wanted to order but you said no food until chef is done preparing! 
6. Hotel is also very run down. The refrigerator door fell down when we opened. I wasn’t able to take a photo. Sheets really itchy! 
You are the worst hotel in entire Sri Lanka and the attitude. I will report this to the travel agency with matching photos and tell them to blacklist you. Sadly TripAdvisor only allows 10 photos. You can’t even take criticisms! Why are you even in the service industry?

Aren’t they Buddhists who are afraid of karma, Hope they get reincarnated as mosquitoes for lying straight to guests faces!
title: Worst Liars!

The room was fine but wasnt overly clean, it was very spacious and I think once upon a time this hotel was probably fantastic but it seems that is has gone down (maybe covid related) It was only a 1 night stay and I was up early for safari so it wasnt so bad however if I had been staying here for a week I wouldnt be happy.

The food was pretty basic, I had some creamy pasta and it was literally dry pasta with half a kilo of parmesan poured on top which I had to send back because it was like eating a section of the sahara desert.

All in all, will not be back. They only got an extra star because the breakfast pack up was pretty good and the room was really spacious.

roomTip: Make sure that you establish that the room does not reek of chemicals before moving in.
text:
Stayed here for two nights as part of a longer tour with a larger group.

Room was physically OK but was permeated by a chemical smell akin to diesel, got better on second night but was still there. We both ended up feeling sick on both nights.

Food choice and in some cases, quality, poor. Rooms, grounds and layout pretty tired. Nice staff but surly and unresponsive management. Not well organised as an institution. Could be a nice hotel but needs work. The only hotel in Sri Lanka we would positively not use again and would not recommend to friends. 

The main advantage is closeness to the Safari Park – however, I did notice a signpost to a Cinnamon Hotel actually on the Park and that might be a better option.
title: Not the best .....

text:
Very toxic staff, in booking listing they offered free airport shuttle and bikes, didnt provide this and manager quoted "If you dont pay for shuttle you can miss your flight, we dont care". They offered shuttle 30€ for 15min drive, because "no other taxi goes there", i declined and ordered from Pickme with 3x cheaper price.

There was no hot water in the beginning so we had to pack all our stuff and move to another room, phone was not working and overall too much trouble for one night stay.

We had to pay extra to get cappuccino for breakfast and food was overall not great not terrible. Menus there is 10% service fee but they took 25-30% when i payed.

I can see why there was only one more person in the huge resort.

If you do stay, eat in Galle.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear TheRainDiary

Thank you for your review and we do apologise that you did not enjoy your stay with us. We have reviewed all your concerns and please see our feedback below:

The hotel is in ruin - Tamarind Hill is a 250 year old manor house with interior decor to match this era. Maintaining the old world charm may at times seem dated to select guests. 

Tamarind Hill is located away from the hustle and bustle of the town and is as such more serene - though we do understand that the location and having to wait for tuk tuks has inconvenienced you.

The Telecom Tower is actually not within our premises but rather on the neighbouring premises.
 
With regard to your remarks on the rabbits - we have already moved the cage and thank you for your feedback. Additionally staff language skills are continually addressed in our ongoing trainings.

We are very concerned about your feedback on the missing ring and have completed a thorough investigation and feel this was not stolen by the hotel staff. Further, please do understand we have safe deposit boxes placed in each room to store guest valuables.

At Asia Leisure we greatly value your feedback and have made improvements where relevant.
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
#tamarindhill #slh #smallluxuryhotels 

Terrible experience: way out of town, sloppy service and thieving staff 

We booked a 3-night stay over the Christmas holiday after reading raving reviews. What a disappointment! Tamarind Hill is one of the most expensive hotels in Galle and not worth the money. There are better options in town. 

If you have seen the "Grand Budapest Hotel" movie, this place is reminiscent of the hotel as an old ruin, definitely past its heydays. Snapshots can look great but do not let them deceive you: this hotel is a disappointment.  

A few facts worth mentioning. Tamarind Hill hotel is:

- 4 km away from Galle historical fort. It's a lonely compound next to swamp and no man's land. There is a stadium under construction next door that will be finished in 2-3 years. Hotel staff has to call every time a tuktuk (rickshaw) that takes 10-15 min to arrive

- spoilt by a telecom tower installed right in the middle of the premises. If you like strong radiations, you will be served

- plain derelict, once you start paying attention to details. The fish pond in the courtyard didn't have enough water and  fishes were dying. There's a rabbit hutch which is great for kids (our baby boy loved it) but stinks and is terrible for hygiene as located right next to the kitchen 

- service ranges from nonchalant to terrible. Staff speaks poor English. Expect to wait for everything and repeat a lot. 

Now for the worst part: hotel staff stole my wedding ring which I had left in the room. I never misplace it. The hotel manager proved inflexible and even rude. He refused to pay us back when we asked to leave (entire stay was prepaid) and service quality deteriorated even further. I filed a complaint with the local police who came to interrogate hotel staff. 

Overall, a terrible experience that completely spoiled an otherwise fantastic holiday in Sri Lanka.
title: Tamarind Hell

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Lyne D
Thank you very much for your review. We are very sorry that you didn't enjoy your stay with us.  Sri Lanka being a tropical country we do have a few ants and other insects around.  We have made changes and more fumigation efforts are being made around the hotel to avoid a repetition of this.
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We visited Tamarind Hill by Asia Leisure in December 2016, and based on the images/location/reviews, we were looking for a wonderful experience. Needless to say this wasn't the case. Each room has an open space in the bathroom (that you can't close) and since the hotel is in the jungle side, ALL kind of insects/animals invite themselves in : cockroaches, lizards, mosquitoes, centipedes...etc they were all over the floor, wall and on the towels. The bathroom was a banned territory for us. But this isn't all... the bed was full of yellow ants, and they were so many we could't get rid of all of them. The bed sheets were changed, and still at night ants again.. needless to say it's impossible to sleep. Moreover, the AC was barely working, keeping in mind that there is no AC in the bathroom which means it's always hot in there. It was a horrible experience, thank god we were in Galle during the day to get away from the hotel.
title: Worst hotel

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you very much for your review and please do accept our sincere apologies for your experience. text: After reading good reviews,we were really excited to go to Tamarind Hill on Easter Sunday as we read there may be bunnies running around the garden. ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

Sorry for the late reply as I have had to do some fact finding on my own before responding to this. We are extremely sorry that you had to go through this. 

The tuk tuk prices are very unregulated in Sri Lanka specially when you are away from Colombo the price disparities becomes much worse as most of the tuk tuk have no meters.. 
 
I am surprised and glad that  you were able to obtain the rate of Rs 100/-  for an almost 5 km trip as even me as a local would not be able to obtain a rate like this. 

The reason the rate you pay at the hotel is higher is because we provide drivers who are reliable and driver who are known to us. By hopping into a tuk tuk by the side of the road we may not be able to give you this guarantee and as a tourist you may be charged much more.
placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here during our honeymoon. We loved the decor, the building, the garden and the pool especially. They are all done beautifully. Cleaning was done to a high level, the toiletries in the bathroom were all high quality and we loved how the shady back of the pool looked at trees with great wildlife.

We disliked being quoted extortionate prices. For a ride to Galle Fort, which would have cost around a 100 Rupies, we were consistently quoted 300. When my raised eyebrow didn't even register with him, I explained that I understand how much it should be, to which he blatantly lied, telling me that it was what it was. Whenever we felt comfortable and left the hotel using the services provided by them, we routinely paid 2-3* as much as we did when we came back from the city to the hotel. The same with the 2 hour trip they scheduled to the mangrove lagoon. They charged us an exorbitant sum (locally speaking) for a dingy little boat with a guide who hardly spoke any English. He was nice enough, but for this much money, I would have expected a luxury cruise with some extras like a buffet. It's not the money that annoys me, it's that they don't treat you as guests, but as targets for their schemes.

I'm sure you'll also be told by them that the prices are what they are. Do yourself a favour. Walk down to the main road and catch a tuktuk from there, See what happens.
title: Beautiful place with big shortcomings

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I had read so many glowing reviews that I was really looking forward to getting there and instead I found that I couldn't wait to leave

The Good
- Beautiful hotel, very relaxing atmosphere nice furniture and layout
- Having a choice of restaurants so we could get out of the heat of the evening
- Response email booking. Very polite

The Bad
- The food was average at best. We were forced to choose from a set menu. None of the food was really Sri Lankan
- When it arrived the food it was in general tasteless and just not what were expecting from a place of this calibre. 
- Service was terribly slow. Took almost 2.5 hours to complete the meal
- The debacle came at the end of the meal when we came to split the bill. Tip: if you eat here pay in cash and definitely don't use AMEX as they have to phone through each card to get an approval. The waiters complete inability to split a bill despite us asking him. Then they couldn't reverse the charges eventhough they had made a mistake and finally them arguing about it amongst themselves for so long that it took 45 minutes from the time we ordered the bill to leaving

With so many good choices in Galle you don't need to come here
title: over-rated food, terrible service. Avoid

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
After being transferred from Colombo Airport to Galle, we spent our first two nights in Sri Lanka at Tamarind Hill.

The property is a nice place with an excellent swimming pool, although too far from the Fort. As previous reviews mentioned, the location shown on their website is not right. We were greeted by the Manager (on this position for the last 3 months), who asked us about how we had come to know the Tamarind Hill and ended up talking about the latest reviews on Tripadvisor, some of them not too positive, which he considered as "misunderstandings" and seemed not too worried about.

We were given Room number 8 (kindly upgraded to a deluxe), very well appointed and with nice colonial furniture. The room had a/c, but not the bathroom, which had decorated and opened windows, without mosquito screen. This meant that all the time the bathroom was full of mosquitoes and kind of a sauna. Please take into account that the Hotel is next to a swamp, which involves wet land around, and breeding zone.

We had two dinners at Tamarind, and the food was very good. As a surprise we were offered a chocolate anniversary cake. All in all, nice, but not genuine, compared to the sincere smiles you get all around Sri Lanka. 

The worst surprise was still to come...we were bitten by BED BUGS, unbelievable at a place like this. We got plenty of painful bites during the night which lasted for the whole of our trip. Stay away, at least, from Room 8.

Last but not least, and as previous reviews, we had problems with the transport. On our arrival, we asked them to arrange a tuk tuk for us to Town, and we were charged 400 RP, on our way back, we paid 150 RP. We also made arrangements with them for a van transfer from Galle to our next destination in Yala. We forgot something in the car (handicraft), and we didn't get much assistance from them. We never recovered the package.

The property is very nice, but there is a serious lack of management. Make another choice as Fort Bliss or Fort Galle, right in the center, and don't let Tamarind Hill spoil your holidays.
title: Nice property but...too many problems

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked this hotel through Agoda in April 2011 and paid in full. We confirmed the booking 1 week before arriving and all was good. We then turned up on 29/12 to be confronted by an extremely rude manager saying "Who are you?"

We explained that we had a booking and showed our voucher and he said "We don't have any rooms, you've been moved to a place in Hikaduwa" (25km away). We asked why we weren't contacted and he just said "Not our problem, speak to Agoda". I told him his attitude stunk and we were hustled out onto the street to avoid upsetting the other guests.

We spoke to the Managing Director who explained that his manager seemed rude because he'd been living in Dubai (??????) and he explained he couldn't help but wanted to apologize "on behalf of Sri Lanka". I explained that Sri Lanka was not the problem, his hotel was.

They proceeded to lie to us, first stating that they'd never heard of us. I replied "how do you know where our booking has been transferred to?". They then changed the story to the booking being changed 3 months ago. I asked why they confirmed our booking a week ago and they changed their story again to it was changed that morning.

A wedding party had taken over the hotel and it was obvious that a couple of extra guests had turned up so we were bumped. Entirely unacceptable.

Luckily there had been 2 cancellations at the Lighthouse next door otherwise we'd have been stuck out on the street with no accommodation. Essentially we paid for 2 rooms we never recieved and are still to get our money back.

This was an outrageously bad experience and I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. The manager in particular is a complete and utter scumbag.
title: Disaster

placeInfo/address: No 288, Galle Road, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
this Hotel is amazing boutique hotel next to a beautiful Colonial City (Galle). The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms / Bathrooms are spacious.
However this hotel is completely ruined by the attitude of the manager who is completely blaze, and who manages his hotel only with the aim of making money and by tricking the customer. They force you to use the hotel transport deals or facilities. First we took a rickshaw to come back from Galle and asked the driver to come back the next day to pick us up at the hotel. The next day noone was there. Once in Galle we met our driver , who explained to us he had been threatened by people at the hotel if he stayed. Then I ve asked a driver from Galle to drive me to Tamarind Hotel and then drive me to the airport. During the 10 mins while i was picking my suit case again they put pressure on my driver to leave, to force me to use the car organized by the hotel. Fortunately I saw the scene, and made a scandal. 
I can t believe this kind of scene could happen in this hotel, and i find it a pity that this manager destroys the potential of this hotel!!
title: An Amazing Boutique hotel ruined by a blaze hotel manager

placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not come here. Save your mind and money.
text:
I am compelled to write this review due to the appalling experience I had at Jetwig Hotel Colombo 7. This establishment has set a new low for false advertising and customer service. I booked my stay based on the promise of a room with a balcony, as clearly advertised. To my utter dismay, upon arrival, I found that there was no balcony. This outright lie was the first of many disappointments.

When I raised this issue with the hotel staff, they had the audacity to blame booking.com, claiming it was an error on their part. This excuse is not only unacceptable but insulting. It is not my responsibility to deal with their advertising mistakes. The hotel had ample time—over a month, in fact—to inform me of this error, but chose not to. Their lack of communication and accountability is inexcusable.

The situation worsened when I realized the implications of their deceit. As a smoker, I was forced into the highly inconvenient position of having to travel from my room to the ground floor every time I wanted to smoke. The hotel's so-called solution was laughable and insulting. They suggested that they open the room window instead and then had the nerve to ask me to sign a waiver stating that opening the window was my request, absolving them of any responsibility. When I insisted they amend the waiver to truthfully reflect that this was their suggestion, not my request, they flatly refused. 

The level of unprofessionalism and sheer lack of empathy displayed by the staff was staggering. There was not a hint of an apology or genuine attempt to rectify the situation. Instead, they were dismissive and uncooperative, leaving me to deal with the consequences of their false advertising and poor service.

This experience was, without a doubt, the worst I have ever had at any hotel. The deceptive practices, lack of accountability, and dreadful customer service at Jetwig Hotel Colombo 7 are beyond unacceptable. I strongly urge potential guests to steer clear of this establishment. Save yourself the frustration, inconvenience, and sheer disappointment I endured. Jetwig Hotel Colombo 7 is a prime example of how not to run a hospitality business, and their actions should serve as a warning to anyone considering a stay here.
title: Appalling Experience at Jetwig Hotel Colombo 7- Deceptive Advertising and Terrible Service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 
Firstly, please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused at checkout regarding the payment. This is not the Sri Lankan hospitality experience we would want our guests to experience at check out. 

As mentioned at time of check in, we had not received any payment from MakeMy Trip for your reservation. As MakeMy Trip is a third-party website located in India, we were following up desperately with MakeMy Trip regarding your reservation and payment, daily with no response from the third-party online agent. As mentioned to you on arrival, we would be charging direct from you at time of check out, if MakeMyTrip had not made the payment, and once the third-party online agent makes payment to the hotel, we will immediately refund your payment. We have been cautioned by all online agents regarding compromised credit cards and asked to follow strict procedures as stipulated by them with regards to payments. 

After your checked out, we have constantly followed up with MakeMy Trip regarding your payment. As we have written to you, we will immediately refund your payment once MakeMy Trip makes payment. Once again, we sincerely apologize for this inconvenience which was beyond our control due to the reservation been made by a third-party website located out of Sri Lanka.    

I would also like to apologize regarding the room and my engineering team has taken immediate action to rectify the issue. Further while we have only received positive comments on our breakfast buffet spread and quality of items and service, I would really like to hear your feedback in detail, so that I could understand what further items we need to have on the buffet that will suit your palate. I would appreciate if you could write to me direct on ajantha@jetwinghotels.com

Once again please do accept our sincere apologies regarding the inconvenience. We would appreciate if you provided us with a second chance to show you the true Sri Lankan hospitality that we are famous for. Please do not hesitate to make the booking with me direct so that I can ensure there is no repetition of the previous incident. 

Looking forward to welcoming you again back to Jetwing Colombo Seven Hotel.

text: Terrible experience.  We came late on our first night with our two young children. The rooms next door had a party with singing and guitar playing all night. Despite numerous phone calls to the reception, who were too scared to confront the guests or really do anything about it, the party went on until 5am. The next day instead of refunding our money they "upgraded" us to another room. The next night had loud, bassy house music also until midnight. This hotel presents itself as "luxurious" and pricey, in reality it is a 3 star hotel with poor service. While the staff are absolutely lovely they lack any real hospitality training, which is not what you expect when you are paying this much money to stay in one of Colombo's finest suburbs. Not only will we avoid this hotel we will be avoiding any Jetwing Hotel.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for your valuable feedback and please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused. 

I would like to inform you as we have done during our many mail correspondence that ‘getaroom.com’ is a 3rd party online digital platform who operated individually and has no link to the official hotel website ‘www.jetwinghotels.com ‘and the booking engine URL starts with https://booking.jetwinghotels.com/getavailability?. 

Your booking made on ‘getaroom.com’ was a rate fetched from ‘Agoda.com’. Even though you booked on ‘getaroom.com’, the booking was made on ‘Agoda.com’ by ‘getaroom.com’. The payment was charged from your card by ‘getaroom.com’ and passed on to ‘Agoda.com’.

The hotel has not received any payment for this booking. However, our e-commerce team has managed to get in touch with ‘Agoda.com’ who has agreed to refund the money to ‘getaroom.com’ since this 3rd party platform has made the booking with ‘Agoda.com’.

While you have paid ‘getaroom.com’ who in return paid ‘Agoda.com’ who currently has your money, based on our correspondence with ‘Agoda.com’ they will refund the money to ‘getaroom.com’. As per our correspondence you will need to contact the 3rd party platform which you claim is ‘getaroom.com’ to refund your money. Our many attempts by the e-commerce team to contact ‘getaroom.com’ has failed and while we will support you and try to contact ‘getaroom.com’, we would like to request you try and get in touch with the 3rd party platform you claim to have book which is ‘getaroom.com’
Once again, 

our sincere apologies in the inconvenience caused and while our e-commerce team will try to support you on your request with ‘getaroom.com’ we would encourage you to do the same with your booking platform. 

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

Ajantha Perera
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Do not book with this hotel just DO NOT. Their website sends you to a third party website known as getaroom.com and it’s a SCAM. I booked a 4 day stay with Jetwing Colombo 7 Sri Lanka. Over 40 emails back and fourth and Jetwing have still not resolved it. They have no idea where my money is and now are not even responding to my emails! ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warmest greetings from all of us at Jetwing Colombo Seven. 

We thank you for your feedback and thank you for selecting Jetwing Colombo Seven for your stay. 

We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed the breakfast selection and the roof top infinity pool along with the food and drinks at Ward7 bar. I will be sure to pass on your kind words to the kitchen team. 

It is heart breaking to hear that you did not like the location of the hotel, as this is our main strength and preference of all guests who stay with us. The many cafés and restaurants located around the hotel, with the exclusive shopping malls and proximity to all business and corporate locations. However, I totally understand if sea front beach properties might be your preference. 

We are running at very high occupancy, and this could be mainly due to the Christmas rush. Your feedback is well noted, and I am discussing with the elevator company to understand if we could increase the speed of the elevators as it can add to wait time when the hotel is very high in occupancy. 

As the hotel offers complimentary unlimited WIFI this can be slow when occupancy is very high, as many of the guests tend to be using for various reasons. However, there is also a paid service that is very much faster even during high occupancy. I have also spoken with my housekeeping team to make sure that all hair dryers are plugged in before the room is released, as some guests tend to remove it from the bathroom socket. 

We try our best to offer early check in based on availability and due to very high occupancy it can be difficult to offer check in before the standard time of check in which is 1400hrs. 

I would like to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences caused and would very much appreciate if you could give us a second chance to make things right. Also, would appreciate if you could make the booking directly through me at ajantha@jetiwnghotels.com so that I can personally attend to your reservation.  

Thank you again for your feedback and only by such feedback that we can focus on areas for improvement.  
Looking forward to welcoming you back again to Jetwing Colombo Seven again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)!

Ajantha Perera
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 57, Ward Place, Colombo 7, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Pluses - the place is cheap and rooms passable. Breakfast selection very good. Bar on top floor has great views of the city and a good food/drink selection. Infinity pool a nice touch!
Minuses - not a good choice for a business traveler. Poor location, Wi-Fi slow as molasses. Friendly but generally clueless staff. Checkin took forever (5 people behind the counter, lots of paper shuffled, still took 45 minutes…), exactly what the traveler needs after a 11 hour flight and an almost 1 hour ride from the airport. Bathroom stank (open drain?) - they couldn’t/wouldn’t address (Opening the bathroom door took superhuman strength - what is with that?). Hair dryer didn’t work - oddly enough, there wasn’t enough a compatible power outlet for the thing in the bathroom, had to use one in the room to discover that! Figured the place was at 40 % occupancy when I went - elevators took forever to show, shudder to think of wait times when their tourist season begin. Bonus: I could see the grotesque artichokey monument/tower out of the window!
Conclusion - I wouldn’t stay here again. Makes better sense to spend 40 or 50 bucks or more a night and stay at a nicer place on the seafront.
title: Cheap…but not much else…

Not recommend to anyone to visit this hotel.

text:
Me and my wife has been to all Jetwing hotels across the country. We loved all stays but Jetwing colombo 7 is worst of the lot. Mainly we checked in due to the current power outage in the country and we both had to work the next day.

To start with the reception was so unfriendly. They were not polite at all and sounded like they paid the our room charges.

Rooms needed to be soundproof. Our room number was 302 and there was adjoining room to it. Which was making loud noises through out the night. Really need to sound proof the rooms! This was disturbing in the most disgusting manner as we heard all unwanted noises to our room while we were working.

Room wife was horrible too.

We were asked to go to the rooftop for dinner. Firstly the staff at the rooftop restaurant did not know that any of the in-house guest were coming for dinner. They asked us to make a reservation! After about 20mins we were given a couch to have dinner. Anyways after ordering it took 1 hour and 30 mins for us to get the food.

Same thing happened at the breakfast buffet. They did not have a table for us. 

I do understand you guys accommodate external guest for various reason but don't you think in house guest should get priority? Or simply don't provide the half board option to in-house guests.

I have never experienced this in any Jetwing hotel. 

Furthermore, receptionist asked leave the room sharp at 12 in a very harsh manner as the hotel is fully booked.

We have always wanted to stay for longer at any Jetwing hotel however here we wanted to get out asap.

I highly regret choosing Colombo 7.

Few of the staff at both the restaurant were very supportive

text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans cette hotel.
La vue
La vue est superbe y compris depuis les bungalows

Les chambres
L’idée des bungalows isolés en forme de ruche est bonne sur le principe. Par contre peu ou pas d’isolation entre la partie chambre et la partie salle de bain/toilette….bonjour l’intimité.
La décoration des chambres manque cruellement de goût.. mais c’est effectivement une histoire de goût.

Le service
Le personnel est très gentil est accueillant mais pas au niveau attendu pour le prix payé.
De plus on avait demandé à l’hotel de nous réserver des billets de train pour un voyage 2eme classe reserved seats. Il nous ont facturé une somme indécente pour le service rendu et nous n’avons pas obtenu les billets demandés. Ce qui nous a laissé la désagréable impression de nous être fait flouer.
Nourriture du restaurant et du petit déjeuner de faible qualité et sans saveur. La viande est souvent trop cuite.
Dans l’ensemble, le prix demandé pour cet hotel est beaucoup trop élevé pour le niveau de service délivré.
Nous avons eu l’occasion de séjourner dans des hotels de bien meilleur qualité pour beaucoup moins cher au Sri Lanka.
Je ne recommande pas cet hotel. Rapport qualité / prix décevant.
title: Prestations pas au niveau du prix demandé

placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka

It was a very disappointed Rude service By A Lady named  JUDITH …As a hotelier and a Traveller with 22 years experience in the hospitality industry this was the bad experience I ever had and.she is not suitable for the hospitality industry.Very rude and even she doesn’t know how to answer a call or how to negotiate with a guest.
