roomTip: Try to ask for fixed price,Better go with bed only option and find foods from somewhere else (not tasty), Cabin architecture fails with echo
text:
Really disappointed service.
1. Breakfast: No service. While eating plates were taken. Also one of our team member took english buffet. And she got her meals after 45-70 minutes. It’s not crowded here also. So disappointing.

2. Room chargers: in the beginning they have told one price for the room. And in the checkin and also in the room change they have increased it in the final moment. Very poor team.

3. Kids package: Once they charged for the kids, they are not in a position to provide extra bed for the kid when asked. They are saying that they are gonna charge for the extra bed too 🤣😂. Better start a fundraiser project for them.

4. English Breakfast: Contains ulundu wade with parippu wade. 😂 no sausage and no meat. So sad.

5. Service is dissatisfied.
title: Sad and bad experience

ownerResponse/text:
The above reviewer has failed to mention why he has written such a low review about the hotel. It is because we had to charge him twice for breakfast. The client ordered a takeaway breakfast for 3 people for their early morning excursion. When they returned back to the hotel later in the morning they had also joined the breakfast buffet. It is standard practice to offer 1 breakfast for 1 person and not 2 breakfasts for 1 person. They were charged by the hotel staff for the additional breakfast hence the disappointment.
Further this customer had used bad language on our staff for having charged them for breakfast which is not by any means acceptable at our hotel and was requested to apologies to our staff, which he had later apologies for. Our staff speak clear and fluent English and they are veterans in the hotel trade.
Our resort does not need air-conditioning as it is in the hill country which is naturally cool and with plenty of breeze. If one feels a bit humid, we have fixed a fan in the room and each room has four windows. We take pride in our resort being owned by a Srilankan and our resort is currently rated as one of the top resorts in Sri Lanka.  We are not sure what he means by 5 beds for 25 guests when we have 12 Cabanas and can sleep minimum of 24, clearly this reviewer is mudslinging at the hotel for being caught out for what he was trying to do on the sly. We always give the best service to all our customers.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Watch out for this one. Pictures look amazing and the location surely is.  The restaurant connected is cute and the views are amazing.

Manage your expectations though. Staff speak bad english and the food is average quality. Breakfast is served very slowly and staff are not on point.

The cottages are not airconditined and bathrooms are smelly at times. Again, the photo’s look amazing but the true reality is a hotel that does not meet the mark on the quality you would expect for the room prices charged.

Also take into account take it takes a 1 hour drive to Ella so you will be in the middle of no where. Also take into account that there are no villages or whatsover connected to this place.
It is ok for a 1 night stay but don’t do more because its way to isolated to get around. Several guests had regrets they booked for 2 nights plus.

Due to bad english communication is hard. This is a sri lanka run hotel so don’t expect a Bali vibe. Pool was not cleaned and cold. Also much smaller then shown on the pictures and only 5 beds for at least 25 guests.

Overall impression; pretty bad. Much room for improvement and a misleading rating on several platforms.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your feedback and we have investigated your feedback. I would like to inform you that our resort is a luxury boutique hotel and we have standards and policies that our hotels adopts specially during Covid days. There are few points that we have to inform you.

1. Kindly note that our resort is operating at full capacity and the standard check-in time is 2 PM and checkout at 12 Noon. On the 28th we were fully booked therefore we could give you only 1 hour late checkout as we need to fully sanitize the rooms and leave for 1 hour before we check-in another customer (Due to Covid)

2. Our resort is only for residents and we do not entertain outside guest/walk-in during these Covid days as we can minimize the risk of Covid to our resort and the neighboring small village close to our resort. There is high risk of Covid spread in Sri Lanka and we as a top end resort consider the Covid risk our utmost importance in protecting our customers and our staff. If your boyfriend had to come and visit you from the outside, you need to get permission as like any walk in guest. This is standard policy in a top boutique hotel due to Covid-19.

3. Our resort manager had already given you a call and discussed your feedback further and explained to you our circumstances and operational procedures.

If there is any inconvenience cause to you we regret it and our Residence Manager had already apologized for the miscommunication and misunderstanding.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
we cheked in to the hotel on 28th sunday around 4 pm. they warmly welcome us. full bord payment was 28,000/= rs. before comming we deposited 20,000/= , before giving us the cottage they requested the rest 8000/= rupees. at that moments we were dissapointed that will never happend to us at five star hotels like kandalama,heritance ahungalle, benthota beach, grand udawalawe ekho ella, angle beach unavatuna ,coco royal beach waskaduwa, citrus hikkaduwa, the next day sharp 12 they told us to hand over the keys.then my mother told that we are in the pool and asked some more time to stay because we had late checkin. they gave only have half and hour and send 2 workers and asked to leave us. they lied us saying some more custermers coming on the way.  then we went to the dining hall at 1.30. lunch was not ready.
my boyfriend  came to visit us and hope to have lunch with us.(he and his family also working in the hotel sector.)  they strickly told us not to let visitors in. i was realy dissapointed he came 80km to take lunch with us.they even dont let him in to the resturent and asked me to talk with him in the outside of the hotel if needed. they said the reason was corona policies. my both parents are doctors and currently working as MOH doctors. there was not such policies and also as a owners son of a hotel, my boyfriend  told that they cant treat guests like that way. even his hotel is bigger than this they never treat custermer this way. i really don't recommend this hotel.
title: not recommended for others

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Malinga
It seems that you are aggrieved, simply because you were denied a refund for a cancellation when checking into the hotel, and therefore determined to find fault where possible. 
I seriously dispute your claim that the “drainage system is a disaster”. This is a Heritage Property, and whilst some of the showers maybe slow to drain due to narrow gauge pipes, it is hardly a disaster. The shower did not flood, it just took time to drain. 
With regards to the trains, we are totally transparent about the proximity of the railway line - we even have a video with the train going past the hotel on the home page of our website. The trains do not run all night, and as you can see from the many other flattering reviews, guests view this as a bonus and not something negative. Clearly you did not do your homework.
For someone who claims to be from the industry, you should know that when making a booking, you enter into a contract with a hotel, and that there are terms and conditions attached. These are included in the invoice sent you when you made the booking. Our cancellation policy is fairly standard throughout the industry, and as a boutique hotel with a small inventory, we cannot afford not to stick to those terms. 
You asked to cancel one room and reduce two nights from another room booking, and all of this on the day of arrival. For you to expect us to agree to this with no charge is unreasonable – we are unlikely to sell the rooms and therefore this is a loss for us. We simply asked you to pay 50%. Perhaps if you had asked nicely, instead of bullying my staff, we might have been more amenable to your request. As it is, to vent your spleen you have written this review whilst still in the hotel since you had asked for late checkout, which we have agreed to free of charge. Seems no good turn goes unrewarded!
Yours,
George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I had high expectations for this “heritage property,” but unfortunately, it was a letdown. First, the drainage system is a disaster—it simply doesn’t work. Be prepared for bathroom issues during your stay.

The worst part, though, is the location. It’s right next to train tracks, and let me tell you, good luck getting any sleep with trains roaring past at all hours. If you’re after peace and tranquility, this is definitely not the place.

Now, be very careful when booking because the cancellation policies are extremely strict. They seem far more focused on squeezing every penny out of their guests than actually providing good service. Despite the hotel being barely 30% full, there’s zero flexibility or consideration. Don’t expect any understanding from management either—George, in particular, made sure that every detail of their penny-pinching policies was enforced to the letter, leaving no room for discussion.

It’s unfortunate to say, but the KK Collection seems more interested in protecting their bottom line than in ensuring guests have a pleasant experience.
title: Disappointing Experience at The Villa Bentota by KK Collection

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Bardell

Thank you for your review and your comment which are duly noted.

With regards to the train, I am guessing you booked on Booking.com, because we do not mention the proximity of the station on our website. As a hotel we are limited to simple facts on their website but we are completely transparent about how close the railway line is to the hotel - we have a video on the homepage showing the train passing the hotel - I dont think we could be any clearer on this.  Obivcoulsy we cannot move the railway line, and nor do we hide the fact that it runs past the end of the garden.

We have noted your comments regarding the spa and am sorry that you were disappointed by the service provided.  The lighting is soft, since you hardly want clients to be blinded by the overhead lights when having a massage!! 

We will endeavour to improve the service, especially in the spa.

With best wishes,

George cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
A real mixed review, sadly the negatives outweighed the positives for us.  Firstly though the hotel staff were amazing here and they cannot be faulted (except the spa employee) for any negative reviews.  The food was lovely and the restaurant staff who looked after us during our stay, although young were very friendly and attentive.  We had water brought out to our sunbeds during the day without request,  and even watermelon one of the days.  If you were to eat in the restaurant the prices were higher than most we saw, and the drinks including alcohol were amount the most expensive - twice the price of some of the other places we stayed in our trip.

The building itself was beautifully constructed and lots of thoughtful chill out areas.  However it stopped there.  The rooms were quite worn round the edges and needed updating, the doors didn't close properly and although our room was clean enough it was basic and not luxury at all.  The high standards from some of the other hotels we stayed in left us very disappointed which was a shame as we were here for 4 nights.  

One of the main issues for us, which I haven't seen mentioned in other reviews I've glanced at (surprisingly) was the train track.  Online it very cleverly says the train STATION is 6km from the hotel.  What it doesn't say is that the TRACK is right behind the swimming pool with the crossing with access to the outside track (no security).  If you planned on a chilled, relaxed time by the pool be prepared for a train go past honking it's loud horn and blasting out a lot of toxic smoke and pollution.  The track was so close to the hotel that when we were in our room at night the windows would rattle with the force of the train going past, and the sound of the horn kept waking us up.   The only time we had respite was between 12.30-4am 3.5 hours of no service!!

We also had a very bad experience of the "Spa and Wellness centre".  For starters, it shouldn't be called this.  It was a dimly lit room with a table in the middle of it.  The towel on the bed was a pool towel, and the worker there didn't have a clue about the treatments he was giving.  Reflexology was more like a very painful sports massage - and the manicure was a very painful massacre of the nails - it was so bad we had to walk out the treatments.  The equipment that was being used was old and worn, the nail file had rust on it.  When I asked for the treatment to stop the employee got angry and confused, I told him he was hurting me but he told me to sit back down, I immediately left and reported it to reception.  The manager didn't really do much except apologise and tell us we didn't need to pay for the "treatments".  I would not recommend the spa at all.

Sadly, we wouldn't choose to stay here again, and just make sure you check any hotels along this strip as they all pretty much back onto the noisy train line!

(You can see how close the train is in the photos, we did take a video which showed this too and the noise but can’t post it!)
title: In need of improvement, train line too close to hotel, and the "spa" is one to be missed!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

I am sorry that you did not enjoy your stay at The Villa Bentota. Perhaps we were not the right hotel for you?

It is a shame that you did not mention some of your issues whilst staying at the hotel; and instead you have used this public forum to vent your displeasure. Had we known, we would have tried to rectify some of the issues that you were not happy with - the staff are there to help and ensure guests have an enjoyable stay. 

Best wishes

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We do not recognise the hotel we stayed in from the descriptions and comments in most of the previous reviews nor the website.

This hotel was the most expensive hotel of the 10 5 star hotels we stayed in during our 18 night tour of Sri Lanka in February 2024.  It was also one of the most rustic, primitive and lacking in luxury.  As such it truly was the poorest value for money.  Maybe other guests were seeking a different type of experience from a hotel that boasts on its website 'contemporary styled', 'boutique hotel', 'extensive renovation ..... affordable luxury' and more.  The accurate word that is used is 'heritage' for which read basic and very worn at the edges as the buildings are very old.  What's more we are fans of Geoffrey Bawa's architecture and visited several of his highest regarded properties, including other hotels.  We clearly had different expectations.  

If you are a mozzie magnet, this is not the hotel for you - or maybe not the room we stayed in, 'four'.   It had 3 doors directly to the outside from the bedroom, none of which closed well.  The bathroom was entirely open to the elements on one side, letting in not just the mozzies but all manner of other flying or crawling bugs and creepie crawlies, too.  It was the only place where I got bitten, despite using the provided mosquito net over the bed.  

This room also had no privacy because directly outside the window was a lawn that had staff passing as they tended to the grounds and other guests strolling by constantly.  Worse, it had a direct view from the train.  The blinds need to be fully shut owing to their design, so you get no daylight or face being on display.    

How other guests can consider the train an interesting feature is beyond me.  Maybe they do not get woken by a train that runs until midnight and then starts up at 4:30 in the morning, tooting loudly as it noisily trundles by.  Take your own earplugs; none were provided in the room.

For a luxury, boutique hotel the security is a joke.  There's a charade about exclusivity to gain access from the road, cars need to toot and drivers explain themselves to a security guard to open the huge metal gate to gain entry.  Yet the back of the hotel is open to anybody who walks along the train line - many villagers seem to commute daily or just stroll along this way - and there is full access to anybody from the beach which can be reached by the general public.  One nosy guest from a neighbouring hotel just wandered in thinking it might be a restaurant, so anybody can do the same.

We were told with great fanfare about their beachside sunset tiki bar.  As the hotel provides no loungers on the beach in front of the hotel and just erects a make shift bar to serve a limited range of over priced and strange cocktails, this is a huge missed opportunity.  The first guests bagged the 2 chairs or sat on a few tree stumps, the rest of us stood up looking like idiots with nowhere to rest our drinks.  Given the small, boutique hotel emphasis, they could even have made more of the feature, even created a setting for guests to meet each other.

The food was OK, but the menu is very short and there was an emphasis on 'western' dishes.  If you wanted local food, you had to request this well ahead, and then the choices were limited.  Despite other reviewers stating they could choose off menu if nothing suited, nobody mentioned this at any meal to us.   

The staff was the best feature.  There were many of them, and they did seem to aim to please.
title: Overpriced, underwhelming

ownerResponse/text:
Clearly I am disappointed that you were not pleased with your meal at The Villa Bentota.  We try very hard to meet our guests's expectations, but in your case we failed, for which I apologise

I should like to point out that Jaggery Beef is, by nature, a spicy dish, so perhaps this was not the best choice for you. Having said that, the kitchens omitted to add chilli, as requested, but they did use cardamom and cumin, otherwise this would not be Jaggery beef!

I am perplexed as to your comment about the staff making jokes - they are very professional, and unless you speak fluent Sinhala, I totally fail to understand how you thought something they had said was a joke.

The Villa Bentota dates back to 1880, and is not a purpose built hotel, so frankly your comment about the corridors does not warrant a response.

Yours,

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Mittelklasse Restaurants ist in Bentota beste Wahl.
text:
Ein bescheidene Leistung in Restaurant.
Was auch immer man bestellen will, sagen die ja und bringen irgendwann was man nicht wünscht.
Und zu falsche Zeit.jogger Rindfleisch  war so voll Flachsen das nicht viel essbares überblieb.
Kellner erlauben sich bei Beschwerden Scherze welche bei Gott nicht angebracht sind.

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I’ve not experienced such poor customer service before, this was a shock since in Sri Lanka we have been humbled and amazed by how kind everyone is. 

The assistant manager was patronizing and rude. When we said we were going out for dinner (dinner v expensive and not particularly nice dining area) he scoffed at us. Also questioned all activities we told him we were doing. 

My room was so tired looking! It was smelly and the bathroom was quite disgusting. The shower was damp musty and mould on the tiles. 

Ants absolutely everywhere. Crawling on us in our sleep, they were in the bathroom, on the floor, infesting our suit cases. We don’t expect this from a “luxury hotel”. 

I felt very uncomfortable being in my bikini - members of staff (around 20?) gathered on the lawn and I felt watched. Also a train would chug past slowly right by pool area - men leaning out of windows. Horrible! 

I really recommend you stay at a less pretentious place - you’ll get oodles better service.
title: Smelly, ant ridden rooms. Hostile management.

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Ruined last night of our holiday. Management laughed at us when we complained about the below:

- ants absolutely everywhere in room, they even climb into water glasses and into beds (see pic).
- shower was 1* (see pic)
- bathroom stank of damp due to no windows or ventilation 
- tired looking bedrooms, in serious need of renovation 
- all-male cricket match on days 2&3 of stay. We felt uncomfortable in our bikinis by pool surrounded by men. Worse yet, we were told we could use the sunbeds with umbrellas as this encroached on cricket pitch! 
- Loud music on check out day which started at 10 in the morning making it impossible to lie by pool (I have videos but unfortunately I cannot share here).

The pool man and dinner waitor were very kind. Their superiors really let them down!
title: Management disrespectful to women

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Most disappointed experience in years. Very rude and unwelcoming staff. Untrustworthy manager.

I was traveling over the South coast with my brilliant mum and I wanted us to have a nice and relaxing rest during our last night in The Villa Bentota on 21 January. I know the brand very well as long as I used to come very often to Tintagel in Colombo and I have never been disappointed before. From the first minute of our arrival to The Villa Bentota premises I didn’t feel a nice welcoming. When I parked my car the security person didn’t guide me where it’s better to park. The receptionist was standing at the entrance but he didn’t come to the car to help us with the luggage until I asked him to do so. He looked a bit lost and strange. Didn’t say any welcoming words to us. After entering the reception we immediately heard a strong noises of reparations work coming to the inside. The GM of The Villa showed us around. Finally we approached the small pool where the numerous workers made a very noisy reparation work and we didn’t, however, receive an apology from the GM. When we finally came to take our room the continuous noise was also there. I registered this noise with my phone on the video. This noise was lasting until the end of the day. Next morning before our checking out we were seating near the pool and suddenly the GM asked me to take my car and park it close to the main road telling that in 5 min a big track will block the road for some electrical work and nobody knows for how long. He mentioned that it’s a municipality work and not under the hotel control. But I told him that I’m unhappy that he is telling me that only now and give me only 5 min for that move. While I was in my swimming suit and I didn’t have my car key with me. Normally municipalities inform hotels in advance and the GM also should tell me that in advance and not put me in a stressful situation. I did my best to take my car as quickly as I could but when I driver to the road the track was already there. The workers told me that the track had an accident and can’t move and that we have to wait maybe 3-4 hours until the track reparation is done. We came back to the hotel pool. Suddenly in 10 min a hotel receptionist came to the pool and said that I can go as long as the track was moved. I asked the GM if he is a serious person that he arrange such a stressful situations for his guests and he is not capable to organize a good coordination with local municipalities? As a GM he should be near the track to get an exact information to transfer it to his guests! But he was completely irresponsible! Upon my return to Colombo I contacted the Paradise Road CEO and I was politely explaining our displeasure and disappointment with our stay at the property and how much I like his other establishments such as Tintagel and Gallery Cafe. He contacted The Villa GM and he told me that GM only mentioned the problem with a track on 22 January. GM didn’t want to tell the truth to the CEO that during all the day of 21st the continuous noise of reparations was disturbing the guests and preventing them to relax near the pool and in their rooms. It’s a shame for the image of such a reputable and one of the best Srilankan establishment hotel! As a hotel guest in this situation we may receive compensation for an unsatisfactory stay which ruined our experience. But unfortunately I still didn’t receive any email until now even after talking to CEO with a considerate offer regarding this matter.
title: Most disappointed experience in years. Very rude and unwelcoming staff. Untrustworthy manager.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

While we appreciate your comments about our service and food it is quite unfortunate that the standard room you reserved did not meet your expectations. We can assure you that every aspect of the hotel has been designed with much thought and care to ensure our guests are treated to a unique experience. 

Should there be any discomfort or disappointment our team is always committed to do the vest best they can to make our guests comfortable. We believe that our team did offer you an upgrade to a Superior room the following day upon finding out that you were not happy with the room you had booked via an online agent. Further the standard room which was offered to you was similar as shown in our pictures and they do not mislead.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
The staff at this hotel were very attentive and friendly, as we found consistently throughout Sri Lanka. However, the price we paid for a 'standard room' at this hotel was not proportionate to the rest of the accommodation we experienced in Sri Lanka and we were left feeling incredibly disappointed with the experience in this hotel. 

Whilst we booked a 'standard double' which boasted many features according to the hotels main website, our room did not resemble this, when discussed with the manager we were told this was because booking directly a 'standard' was of a better quality than booking through an agent, the website at best then misleading.

We were allocated a room right above the bar/restaurant area, it was very open which meant that it was possible for the hotel guests to see me walking from the shower to the wardrobe (as the wardrobe was outside the main room on a suspended floor above the communal area). This is totally humiliating and degrading for women (and of course men). 

I'm not sure if this room, which felt like we were staying in someone's spare room which usually is an office, was an after thought or a response to a lack of available rooms. However it is significantly below the level of standard I would expect from a boutique hotel and I would recommend that people are very careful where/what they book in this hotel. 

On a positive note, the food was good and they have some decent SA/Aus wines.
title: Most disappointing (and by far the most expensive) in all of Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

We appreciate your detailed feedback about your stay and we regret that you had to experience such a situation during your last day at The Villa. We shall further investigate this matter and implement immediate corrective actions in order to avoid a similar situation from taking place. 

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
My husband and I and our 2yr old son had had a wonderful 2wk holiday in January touring Sri Lanka ending our stay at Paradise Road Villa. 

We were in Suite One with its own plunge pool - the room is quite dark with no view and also the bathroom lighting isn't very good. We didn't go in the plunge pool as it could have done with being skimmed over with a net before our arrival as there was some trees foliage on it. Otherwise the hotel is very beautiful. 

Unfortunately our holiday turned sour on our last day. We'd left our room that morning and were given a small room next to the pool and above reception to shower in before our flight. I left the pool at 5pm to shower and when I came out my husband & 2yr old son were still happily by the pool. They came in at 5.30pm to shower. Shortly afterwards staff started fumigating the whole pool area with mosquito fogging. There had been no warning especially considering I'd seen staff members walk past while I was out on the balcony enjoying the sunset.) This filled the entire atmosphere and immediately started coming into the room I was in as they were fumigating right outside. I was 5wks pregnant so panicked as I saw the fumes coming towards our room. I quickly shut the door but it wouldn't shut properly and the fog started coming through every gap and immediately filled the small room. I tried to go out into the landing but there window was just an open frame with no glass so the landing area was filled fog & fumes. 

I ran back in the bathroom where my husband and son were showering and held a towel to my face and we all tried to keep low. I was really scared and concerned at what affect this would have on my unborn baby as well as my young son. 

Once it sounded like the fumigating had finally finished  I waited a few more minutes for the fog to disperse and I flung the doors open and went downstairs to speak to the receptionist. I couldn't believe there had been no warning or request to ask us to move to another area of the hotel, particularly as we had a little boy with us. All the receptionist said is he didn't know we were there, he thought we were by the pool. I said how could we be by the pool with all that fogging surrounding the area. 
He told me it's safe (but then men doing it we're wearing large masks). I was close to tears and shaken as I explained what had happened but he didn't see the issue. 
He reluctantly knocked one of our restaurant bills off the final balance which was about £40 (big deal considering the final bill!) 

I've only just found out I'm pregnant and this is supposed to be a happy time but now I'm just scared for my baby and it turned a fantastic holiday into a really sad cause for concern at the end. 

My brother's family had spent their last night in a hotel in Negombo where they had also experienced mosquito fogging but the staff had warned them beforehand and suggested they took my 3yr old niece to another part of the hotel so they wouldn't be affected by it. I can't believe this wasn't the case at Paradise Road Villa.
title: Mosquito Fogging with no warning

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road Tintagel Colombo.

It is unfortunate that you stay in our hotel did not meet your expectations. During the time of making the reservation each guest is informed about the passing tracks in order to ensure that the guest are able to make an informed decision about their reservation at The Villa Bentota. 

Every aspect of the hotel has been designed with much thought and care to make sure that all our guests are treated to a unique experience. We have received great feedback from our previous guests about the property who have an eye for detail and appreciates art and true design.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I stayed here because the review were good, but instead this place is awful because:
1. The railway is literally passing in the garden, so a lot of noise, it's dangerous (you have to cross the railway to go to beach!) and people from the train are looking at you sunbathing! Unacceptable!
2. The room (n.3) was ridicously small, inaccettabile for paying over 250€/night! Small and poor (no air con in the majority of it!
3. Service is very poor and food really average.
Geko, mosquitos are everywhere!
I don't recommend this place to anyone!
title: No no no!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

It is quite unfortunate that your experience did not meet your expectations. placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: Highly over rated and over priced to international competition. Checked in for 2 nights and no one even bothered to make up our room. They serve you as if they are doing you a favour. Not worth a cent. Rooms will be worth if it was price at 80 US dollars because the beds are uncomfortable and the linen is very poor quality. The breakfast is of the poorest quality - you can eat better food off a roadside shop. There is no back up power hence when the lights went off we were left in the dark in a bathroom where there is no natural light. Over all there should be a -5 star rating for this place. DO NOT CONSIDER THIS PLACE
title: Overrated place

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for reviewing Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

It is quite unfortunate that your stay at The Villa did not meet your expectations. We have noted your detailed comments about your experience specifically the shortcomings in the suite and at breakfast as we are committed to investigate further to understand and prevent such situations from taking place which could reduce the total experience. We have taken your feedback into serious consideration and shall work towards rectifying these claims as mentioned by you.

Kind Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
Charged USD 600 for a two bedroom suite that has only 1 bathroom! One of the A/C's didn't work properly. The tv area (quite a small TV) for the room was not air-conditioned.
We were staying here because we were attending a friends wedding at the hotel. However, even though they charge full price (more than you would pay at a 5 star hotel) they decided that they would not serve food from the only restaurant they have after 2pm.
After paying such a ridiculous amount the least I would have expected was a decent breakfast. However, just like the rusty TV and faulty A/C no corner was left uncut. The breakfast provided with a 600 dollar room is an option of one thing (Villa breakfast, similar to American breakfast). They had a Sri Lankan option which requires notice of 12 hours! Of course no one told us this the previous evening
About 20% of the menu is a notice stating that any extras ordered would be billed at full a la carte price.
So we ordered 4 Villa breakfasts for my wife and I and two children. 2 fried eggs sunny side up, 2 fried eggs over easy, 1 omelette and 1 scrambled eggs. The waiter obviously didn't understand as he brought scrambled eggs instead of the eggs over easy.
When I sent it back another person came and asked if there was a problem. So we said we wanted the eggs overeasy and he said certainly and went back to the kitchen. A few minutes later they bring two fried eggs with the yolks broken and hard. Clearly, their chef does not even know what over easy means.
The sides such as bacon and sausage were also ridiculously small. One 25g sausage or 2 tiny undercooked rashers of bacon.
If you are considering this place please think again! There are far better options with more luxurious facilities, better food and better service available in Bentota at half the price!
title: Please don't waste your money!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for the review of Paradise Road The Villa Café. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your feedback. 

Our pizzas are all prepared in our pizza oven and not in a microwave, in addition the chicken you had on your salad was smoked and therefore certainly prepackaged. We will certainly look into the feedback you have provided and will aim to improve the standard of our restaurant to avoid any further such disappointments. 

We hope to see you again at Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

Best wishes
The Management - Paradise Road The Villa Bentota
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text: We have visited this restaurant before and unfortunately the standards have definitely declined. The food was brought out at lightening speed indicating that it wasn't freshly made. The atmosphere consisted of a microwave pinging at frequent intervals and the pizza ordered with cheese sticking to the plate had clearly been preprepared and heated in this. The chicken in the salad was gristly and again prepackaged. This is a real shame, as for the price we would expect the same high standards as served in the Colombo branch.
title: Disappointing Restaurant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ala O,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property on trip advisor. On Christmas Day this year Sri Lanka experienced one of the worst rains in our history. Paradise Road The Villa Bentota was built by the architect Geofrrey Bawa with an aim, as with all his buildings, to embrace nature and the warm climate of Sri Lanka. The humidity you experienced on the walls was particulary due to these unusuallz heavy rains; however we assure you that we have an ongoing budget that allows us to continuously restore any moisture and/or fittings (minus natural patina outdoors which purposely adds to the design of the property).

In regards to in room wifi we aim to encourage our guests to relax during their stay and switch off from technology however due to several requests we are now extending our wifi to all rooms in January 2015. In regards to the refund you requested we apologise this is not possible during our high season.

We apologise for the shortcomings you have faced with our staff, we pride ourselves on our service and have looked into the matter immediately to ensure that all our guests experience the same high standard of service.

Saskia Fernando Hammoud - Director, Paradise Road Company
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We have just returned from our 5th visit to Sri Lanka, two days early, and  £1,500.00 financially lighter (for rebooked flight home, as after 2 hours phoning around all the best places were of course full as it was Christmas) due to the appalling state of the rooms at this hotel.

Potentially a death trap - the final straw was returning to our room in Christmas Day at 11pm to find it literally seeping water from the walls & ceilings (through electric lights) and spores growing on the walls. It was nightmarish.

Put very simply, the Villa Bentota, Paradise Road could be fabulous, but is suffering from intense under investment and lack of planning to manage a building of its age and character in an extreme tropical climate. 

The staff do well to manage an extremely difficult situation, despite some arrogance (see below) and the fact that they will do their best to hide (but it is understandable as there is nothing they can really do). There is no evidence of a fixtures and fittings allowance from their budget to roll out essential maintenance, and really, at these prices there should be.

I will let my 'candid' pictures of the two suites we stayed in speak for themselves. No filters. Dank, smelly and impossible to get dry. The mould and the smell on the ground floor was indescribable. We moved after one night - and serious histrionics from me - to the room above, which did not smell as bad, but as both rooms had bathrooms with no extraction or proper ventilation (just a tiny foot tall and wide window) it will always be impossible to air and dry these rooms after the use of the shower - let alone the effect of the climate. 

Oh - did I mention the bars on the windows? The subterranean first 'suite' with its basement ceiling glass blocks and the fact that when we checked I we actually thought the glass on the windows was opaque due to condensation?

In addition - no in room wifi. I will leave you to your own conclusions on this. 

Paradise road have several businesses in Colombo, that we have experienced before, and a good reputation. They are doing  serious damage to their reputation by not taking more care of their Bentota property. Sadly, it does seem that the country seems to be suffering from its own success in attracting tourism after the cessation of war and this place really is to be avoided at all costs. 

This is my very first trip advisor review. Why? Because I believe that you should praise a place directly and also critique professionally, and directly. Sadly, this is the very first place that I feel needs to be named and shamed for its poor product. If I had read the terrible and poor reviews on line and had not just looked at the headlines good reviews, I would never have booked it. I have learnt something myself, as the poor and terrible reviews are pretty spot on, if a little emotional. Finally, I am
Posting this as, despite the indisputable evidence that the product is totally substandard, I was told:

'We are number two on trip advisor in Bentota' .

For small boutique - Go to Taru Villas almost next door, Dutch house in Galle, and if they are not available go to a larger hotel with international representation, like the fortress in Galle, but don't go to the villa Bentota. My mother general tip - go to hotels that reply to their trip advisor reviews - good or bad.

I hope this helps anyone in their research from making the same mistake I made. Have a great time in Sri Lanka - it is a wonderful place with great people - just choose your accommodation wisely.
title: Emperors New Clothes

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
We had to change our booking a month before arriving in Bentota as because of health reasons we needed a ground floor room and were only offered that option if we upgraded to a suite, the reviews of these concerned us.
We visited the hotel to see what we missed, our first impressions were not brilliant- the place felt deserted, we wanted to look in the gift shop and someone had to find the staff to open it for us. The cafe has absolutely no outlook at all, so we didn't even stay to eat, it was empty too. The shop however did have some interesting and tasteful gifts. 
Overall we are relieved we didn't stay a week, as had been our plan, we are enjoying the hotel we chose instead and feel we had a lucky escape!!
title: Lucky escape!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

We were terribly sorry to hear of your experience in Sri Lanka and that it has resulted in a negative view of Paradise Road The Villa Bentota.

Unfortunately, when you contacted us from Galle 1 week after your departure to complain about a claimed theft by our staff, there was absolutely nothing we could do. We provide safes for all our rooms and advise guests to store all valuables accordingly. 
We can however imagine how disheartening it was to learn that your passport was misplaced and can only be disappointed that this inconvenience now relates to our property. 

Our only recommendation to all travellers, is to store valuables in the safe provided and if not, with you and should you notice anything missing to report it immediately so that something can be done about it. 

We hope to welcome you one day back to our property and reverse your poor opinion of us!

Yours in Service,

The Management
Paradise Road The Villa Bentota
placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: Don't stay here.... Problem solved.
text: Stayed here for a friend's wedding a few weeks ago, sadly the event was marred by rampant stealing from our rooms, yes rooms plural. Overall our group 'donated' over $3000USD worth of possessions to the staff including a passport which as you can imagine was an absolute joy to replace.... The only explanation we got from the staff was "it's not in lost and found". Not good enough considering the price and reputation of this place. Stay away, there are WAY better places to stay in Sri Lanka.
title: BEWARE!!

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I recently stayed at Villa Bentota for two nights. My husband and I had so looked forward to this portion of our trip as we had just spent two weeks in India and other parts of Sri Lanka. Bentota was going to be our two days of pure relaxation and peace.

We are American and travel very, very frequently. We both work in the travel industry for leading international travel magazines and review hotels often for our company's print and digital publications. With this said, we have stayed at some of the worlds most exquisite and unique properties, being fortunate to have experienced truly "the best" in terms of boutique and luxury travel.

Villa Bentota, in all essence, does not live up to its promise or marketing efforts. It is a stunning hotel with beautiful spaces and and an authentically vintage, antique ambience that I personally love. The design is interesting enough and the grounds are beautifully manicured.

But, unfortunately, once the initial high you get from the beautiful surroundings fades away, you realize that the hotel has a LOT of work to do before it can compete in the international travel market. Sri Lanka is a "newly discovered" travel destination for Westerners, and it's beautiful. But, those creating hotels to cater to people who have experienced the best should pay much closer attention to the details.

From the moment of check-in until check-out, we experienced some of the worst service we have ever seen at a hotel promoting itself in this luxury category. Examples...

No one was available for check-in upon our arrival and we had to search for 10 minutes to find someone at 10:00 pm to check us in. The food is wonderful, if they get your order right, but chances are your fresh papaya juice ordered at the beginning of breakfast will arrive at the end. By the pool, you my have to search for someone to bring you towels to use and then ask them again to bring you a drink menu, ask them again to order that drink and search for them to actually get that drink in your hand. It may take them two to three hours to clean up the pool area after someone has left, leaving the chairs and tables looking quite messy and dirty - not the best ambience. 

When you finally get that drink, don't mind the frequent trains bustling by the pool area as the hotel literally just in front of train tracks that take people on the journey from Colombo to Galle. You will have to cross these tracks to go to the beach - which, by the way, has no chairs, towel service or people to ensure your comfort. The wifi in the hotel is very, very spotty so don't bank on it if you have important things to do via internet. Also, don't mind the lack of help when you are lugging your bags from your room to the lobby to check out...those who are supposed to help you are talking amongst themselves while you are struggling.

All in all, I really had high hopes for this hotel. We were so very excited to experience the romance of it. But, the owner, Mr. Shanth Fernando, should definitely focus more on assembling a staff with greater attention to detail than promoting his hotel as the "it" destination in Sri Lanka.
title: Beautiful hotel and idea in theory...horrifically execution

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
text:
I paid to stay here , going by the fantastic reviews, but when I reached there it turned out to be a scary damp and dark old house. 
I had paid sgd 700 for 2 days but this place was so bad that we gave up the money and bought ourselves another place.
I wouldn't stay here even if you paid me to, so I didn't mind losing my 700$ , they obviously did not refund a cent, which is ok. But then this really is a warning for all those who go by the reviews on trip advisor, for some reason this Place does not live up.
The good reviews might be of club villa which is another property next door. 
But paradise road villa is totally avoidable.
And btw there is no beach view at all.
And the beach itself is inaccessible. You need to cross the rail line and the bushes to get to the beach.
The balcony is infested with big red ants.
We were bitten by mosquitoes within 15 mins of our stay.
title: Huge Letdown

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip:
Avoid the Executive Suites which don't have sea views. 
Hope and pray that they have upgraded the air conditioning units.
text:
We were so excited about staying here as the website and the price of the room promised a lot. Unfortunately we were really disappointed and I agree with everything that has been said about the aloof, uncaring attitude of the manager.  

We booked Executive Suite 1. What can I say... it was damp, dark and with the air conditioning on it was like sleeping on a runway. The 'private plunge pool' was a dank, cold-looking pool with an oily film and leaves floating in it. I wouldn't have gone in it if you'd paid me to.  We explained to the manager that we were very disappointed with the room and asked to be moved, which they accommodated but only after we'd had to spend another two nights in ES1.  The new room (7) was a lower grade of room but so much nicer than the Exec Suite - shared veranda overlooking the gardens with beautiful shutters and light flooding the room.  Unfortunately the air conditioner was just as noisy and we barely slept. 

The food in the restaurant is good but there needs to be more variety. We only stayed for 4 nights and got so sick of looking at the same menu night after night. The restaurant service is dreadful. Staff wander around in a daze, orders are lost or forgotten, barely any English is spoken. And when you're paying $250 a night, being charged for water at dinner is just so stingy.  

There is a lovely bar with an open front looking on to the gardens. It would be such a relaxing place to sit, if only they didn't blast out the same 'Dad Rock' CD. Every. Single. Night. 

Ultimately, for what this place is trying to be the service is not nearly good enough.  Nothing would make me go back.
title: Doesn't live up to what it's trying to be

placeInfo/address: 138 18 - 138/22 Galle Rd, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Villa Bentota by KK Collection
roomTip: None of the rooms! And avoid suite 3!!!
text:
We were six adults staying for 2 nights in Paradise Road The Villa. I had booked two standard rooms and 1 executive suite (suite 3 - this was supposed to overlook the sea, but it didn't coz of the trees). First of all, the bald manager has too much attitude (about what I do not know!). Don't think he has had any lessons in customer service. All the 3 rooms had a musty smell even though it wasn't raining when we stayed there. The first night, I got bitten by 2 bed bugs in about 20 places all over my body. And this was in the executive suite!!!! Called the bald manager at about 2 am. Thankfully he came immediately. Firstly he refused to believe that the red flared up marks all over my body were due to bed bugs. Then when we insisted that he check the bed, he did find two BIG BED BUGS!!!! And you know what his response was upon seeing them - the last guest in this room must have brought these bed bugs with him!!!!!! So does this mean that the room wasn't cleaned after the last guest left??? When I asked him that he was visibly embarrassed and showed us another executive suite. This was smelling badly and the walls were damp. But since it was the middle of the night and I was with a baby, we took that room and tried to sleep. The next morning, he showed us a 3rd suite which was on the ground floor but had a smell of fresh paint as it was painted recently. We told him that we don't mind our original room as long as he cleans the bed properly. He refused saying that the whole room will be thoroughly cleaned, the bed will be removed and replaced etc etc and this will take a lot of time and didn't give us the same room back. So we had to do with the smelly room. During all this, the manager never once offered anything at all as compensation for the bad experience I had. On the last night, we had a late check out and they charged us USD 100 for that. This was already agreed upon but the least they could have done would have been to waive off this charge. Now for the best part - 2 hours after they told us that our bed bug ridden room will be closed and cleaned very thoroughly, they gave that same room to another family!!!!! We were sitting for lunch and we saw another family standing in the balcony and then emerging out of the same villa. So in conclusion, horrible stay, no warmth or consideration from the manager. They are just there to make as much money as possible without providing any real service. And I paid top dollar for this place. The food is good though. Though the waiters seemed to be all in a daze and had difficulty understanding simple requests. The level of English is also poor. Oh yes, one more thing, they treated my driver badly as well and did not provide any place for him to stay.
I went for dinner to The Club Villa on the last night and it was good. How is it as a resort - I don't know. The look and feel of both places is very similar. But one thing I do know is that I have never ever seen a boutique hotel with boutique prices where the management and the staff behave this way. I'll never return.
title: Bitten badly by bed bugs; inconsiderate manager

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel  is way overpriced for the what is it. Whilst the staff is very nice and helpful, the building is run down and dirty. We got initially allocated the ‘ultra’ category room called black rajah. This room shouldn’t be called a room. Bathroom is dirty, ceiling is really low is you are taller than 1.80cm, careful with your head. It is a lower ground floor room located below the dinning restaurant so you hear every single step above your head. The door didn’t close properly let alone lock. Toilette is totally open, with a gap in the wall so you actually really have zero privacy whilst in the room wanting to use the toilet yet. The massage spot is in the middle of the garden so zero privacy and perfect for all type of mosquitos and other insect looking for a body to bite! I found the price charged for the hotel outrageously expensive comparing to other hotels in the region and country and for what it has to offer. Really disappointing and unpleasant experience overall.
title: Very disappointing hotel given the price charged

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
This was the third hotel we stayed in during our trip to Sri Lanka. After the first two, our hopes were high, but were sadly let down. The property is lovely but desperately in need of some TLC. I think they rely far too heavily on the the word "boutique" to cover a multitude of sins
 Our first room was very small and dark. We quickly realised that the free WiFi did not work in that room. We were offered another across the hall, which was much brighter, but no larger, and did have some weak WiFi reception ( a must for international travelers). We pointed out that there was no safe in the room, so the staff member went and picked up the safe from the first room and brought it into the new one. Not my idea of a secure place to leave valuables!!!
The pool area was pleasant, but almost entirely in the shade and enveloped in smoke from the surrounding village houses. The pool looked to be in need of a deep clean.
Breakfast was good. The dinners were a set menu ( with some choices) but were expensive by Sri Lankan standards. We were not told that we could have chosen from the lunch menu.
Our room was on the side of the property , above the kitchen. We realised that if we had the shutters open, we could be seen by staff members walking up a path beside the villa, so we had to keep them shut while dressing and changing.
At over £350 a night, I don't think this was good value for money and I certainly wouldn't choose to stay here again.
After reading other poor reviews, I expect a strong rebuttal from the owner who doesn't appear to accept criticism about his  property.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
We note your disappointment and appreciate your stay got off to a better start for you on arrival.Having discussed this same feedback and price issue with your travel consultant too,to whom we immediately responded,I will address it again here...

The query about dinner billing was double-checked,and all was correct.In circumstances when guests  - occasionally but very understandably - for some reason want less for dinner, we typically first offer the option to go with parts of the main set dinner menu at a reduced price.If that is still too much food, we can offer the option of the lunch menu a la carte but typically guests go with the former.

In this case,for 2 out of 3 items each as described, at a cost of Rs 4000 per person.The price structure/reduction for parts of the menu has been the same for many years, without any problems.Wine and bottled water came to an additional Rs 3150,and 10% SC added to the total

We are very sorry that your stay did not feel optimal, and that you did not raise any queries about dinner and drinks billing during your stay when it might have been easier to explain fully in person

Thanks again for choosing The Kandy house for your stay, and hope you generally enjoyed your time in Sri Lanka
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay somewhere else
text: Our welcome to Kandy House was nice and after checking into our room, refreshing after a day of touring, we went to the dining room for dinner.  We told the manager that we were not very hungry when offered a fixed menu but the manager stated that we did not need to have the entire fixed menu and order parts of it and the price would be adjusted.  We each had 2 appetizers and when we received the bill, we were rather shocked to find that for 2 appetizers, the bill charge was 4000LKR each (full menu was around 5500LKR!!).  When I mentioned this to our travel consultant, she followed up and was told that the pricing was correct and that “ordering from an a la carte menu would have been better instead of choosing to go with parts of the set menu”.  One problem however, we were not offered the a la carte menu?? The only mention was, don’t worry we will adjust the pricing accordingly... well, the price was adjusted but rather unfairly!! Additionally, we were awakened around 4:30 am by chanting from what seemed to be a nearby temple.  Normally, it would be ok if it lasted for a minute or two but unfortunately, it lasted for what seemed to be an hour.  Would I stay here again, absolutely not.
title: Very Disappointed

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked The Kandy House as part of our 37th wedding anniversary celebrations, and whilst there are many wonderful aspects to the hotel, there are also a number of major disappointments 😭
The property is beautiful, the staff very friendly, the pool area is superb, and the food is very good.
However, it sells itself as “sublime / restful / oasis of calm”, which sadly it wasn’t. We deliberately returned early one day (just after lunch), to lie by the pool, swim and read a book. Unfortunately, we were unable to do so due to incessant noise from grass cutting and dogs barking next door, which lasted for 4 hours !! A housing development is being built next door, which added to the general mayhem.
The pool is superb, but it is impossible to enjoy without getting eaten alive by mosquito’s and ants.
We knew that this hotel was not “cheap”, but we were very disappointed to find 29% added to our bill at the end (19% tax and 10% Service). As this has not happened anywhere else in Sri Lanka, it is difficult to avoid reaching the conclusion that this is a deliberate pricing strategy.
A shame really, I would love to recommend this hotel for all its good points, but it is hard for me to get past several key negatives. What was due to be a highlight of our trip, has proved a major disappointment.
title: Great potential, what a shame

ownerResponse/text:
It is certainly a first to be referred to as a significant name in 20th century literature - I think the author wrote novels which moved between realism and fantasy - so am happy to respond in that context
Real was that your breakfast was late and not warm enough.It was obviously an empty gesture in your view,but we did reduce your wine bill as a way of expressing our regret -and for the record here we are sincerely sorry.We also later learnt you complained at most hotels you stayed,and the group with whom you were travelling (but seemingly not spending much time with) gave us positive feedback
It is a fantasy we are rude clowns.We are never complascent and strive to better ourselves,but after 14 years we have an idea about the profile of feedback from our guests,whether from the guestbook,word of mouth,on-line,travels agents or otherwise -it is typically positive about service and management...and for sure we do not foster a culture of “no”
We are deeply sorry our hotel did not work for you,your trip was generally disappointing and for our mistakes
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: A small boutique hotel run by rude clowns.  Took 40 minutes to serve a cold breakfast ordered the night before.  Little choice of food that was mostly second rate.  The house of no, no we don’t have that, no we can’t do that, no we forgot about that...  Management needs to train their staff about polite service and following through on their commitments.  Yes means no!
title: Kafka House

ownerResponse/text:
I appreciate you have acknowledged what you enjoyed about The Kandy House,and that some of the circumstances you experienced would have ben both frustrating and stressful when accompanying your grand-daughter.However,it's very important  for us to make some clarifications,as there have been some significant misunderstandings and consequently some misrepresentations in what you have written

The information received from your travel agent ahead of your stay was totally incorrect.We have since been in touch with your agent who has sincerely apologised for your negative review and for "the bad image to your prestigious hotel",plus appreciated how we helped you by accomodating you over New Year in spite of our policy. 

To further clarify,we do request the ages of guests in advance,and your agent stated you were both adults booked in a double-bed room - we would have queried it months ago at the time of booking if they had mentioned about your grand-daughter - and they had mistakenly only forwarded your "middle" name on the confirmation.That explains some questions,consternation and concern on your arrival presenting your unrecognised "surname" and with a young child.When the voucher was presented by your driver,the middle name was only then recognised.As you say,you were both welcomed in spite of the errors by your agent,and the management and staff made every effort to look after you in these circumstances throughout your stay.

Also it may be helpful to quote in full your comment in the Guest Book...."A lovely relaxing stay.My grand-daughter (who really is not old enough to stay here) and I have been very well tended to by Janaka.The grounds are glorious,and the rooms are delightful".

We totally understand that our gourmet 5-course dinner for New Year's Eve would not be appropriate for your grand-daughter.Although encouraged to join the latter evening and fireworks,you mainly chose to stay in your room on your return from Kandy

So to us it feels very harsh that you reciprocated our welcome with such a negative review and the headline "stay elsewhere",but partly understand it probably has been prompted by the frustrations of your experience given you would be expecting all to have gone smoothly with your travel agent

We are sorry that a third party incorrectly processed and communicated your booking,and that in some way it made you feel uncomfortable,especially for your young companion - we love children,but for many years have taken the advice of our agent counterparts and the experience of guests(and you will now know the reasons) that it's better suited for children above 12 years-old,a policy regularly communicated to all our counterparts.

We hope you understand the need for a full clarification,and thank you for coming to stay at The Kandy House.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
I regret reviewing this lovely property so negatively, but I was surprisingly disappointed with my stay here. I arrived on New Year's Eve with my 7-year-old granddaughter.  When we walked inside with our guide, we were greeted by the manager and a woman who apparently was in charge of reservations.  I never knew exactly what her status there was (nor did I see her again, thankfully), but she was the ONLY PERSON in all of Sri Lanka who treated me rudely.  I was told that under no circumstances were children allowed, to which I responded that my reservations were made many months before by a travel agent who knew the ages of me and my granddaughter.  Again, I was told that no children are allowed, and after being essentially berated for about five minutes, my guide showed this woman a paper of some sort.  Immediately, the mood changed, and we were both welcomed and introduced to our personal "butler" (a term I'm totally uncomfortable with), and shown to our room.  

The bedroom was adequate, the sitting room adjoining it was adequate (but not very comfortable), and the dinner was adequate AND expensive.  Jonaka, our "butler," was extremely nice and attentive, as was all the staff, including the manager.  The property is lovely but seemed overly pretentious. I booked the tour as a package, and as a result, I have no idea what I paid for the room we had.

Because I realized that we weren't really welcome at the Kandy House, we stayed in our room the little amount of time that we were actually on the property.  The second night of our two-night stay was New Year's Eve, which featured a 5-course meal beginning at 8 PM, too late for a child and too expensive for us both (8000 rupees each!!!!).  So we ate in Kandy instead.  

We stayed in fabulous hotels during our 10 days in Sri Lanka and were treated royally in them all, with the exception of the Kandy House.  Children were catered to everywhere we went, so it was quite stunning when we were made to feel unwelcome here.  My suggestion for the booking office would be to require the tour company to state the ages of the guests when reservations are made; then the unwitting guests won't be subjected to the cold reception that my granddaughter and I received.
title: Make another choice

ownerResponse/text:
Yours is an interesting and certainly extravagent review,and we think it relates to your stay back in October.It is probably in order  to make a miixture of exaggerated and incorrect claims because we asked you to comply with our booking policy and  pay for rooms which were cancelled at the time of your stay - a very common policy in so many hotels around the world.

To suggest favourable reviews are ficticious just defies all logic and is not respectful to our previous guests,many of whom have remarked that if anything our website underepresents their experiences

Anyway,it's always important to address comments,so our responses are as follows:
1.The experience is meant to be more like staying in a home than an hotel,so we intentionally do not provide telephones,TV,fridges etc in the room.Guests can easily keep items refrigerated in our kitchen,there is a telephone accessible in the office if you wish to make calls,and staff are on hand to serve all your needs
2.Of course we advised against drinking the tap water,that is very common in Sri Lanka and we provide plentiful complimentary mineral water to guests
3. It's an historic building set in 6 acres of garden and woodland with a cast-iron gate both unobtrusive and sympathetic to the property.All hotels have a security guard on hand,anyone would be surprised if there wasn't one although this is just a precaution and we do not experience any problems and we have good relations with the local village.To suggest it's scarey and like a military compound is absurd.The road was under temporary reconstruction,and is now flat and smooth.
4.Yes,we are outside Kandy but typically a drive of only about 20 minutes to the city centre.Our guests appreciate our location away from the bussle of the city,choosing to make trips to visit any sites or otherwise and then relax at the hotel
5.Of course some mosquitoes can be present especially at some parts of the year,but no more than any other part of this tropical country.The "mozzie bangles" we provide are really appreciated and are effective,and some guests take them for their onward destination,and comment it's a gem of a gift rarely offered at other hotels.Again,mosquito nets are the norm in so many tropical countries and in Sri Lanka.
6.It's abundantly clear that The Hotel Suisse suited you better,which would begin to explain so many of your comments,and I'm pleased you felt comfortable there.

I think you were expecting something very different,and we have been in conversation with the travel agent as so much clearly did not suit you at The Kandy House.You were  booked into the wrong hotel for you and in your frustration,you seem compelled to post your first and only review on Tripadvisor with some vindictive and extraordinary remarks.

Happy New Year
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Do not believe the website.  It is pure public relations. For example, they show a candle-lit dining table in the "dining room" where you would presumably meet other guests.  The reality is that you eat outside where a wild bird almost hit us while it was attacking a mirror near the table while the staff did nothing  Other realities for us are:  
1. Our room had no television, no telephone, no internet, no drawer space and no privacy.  The open bathroom facilities and bed were in the same space separated by only a mosquito net.
2. Management  told us not to drink the water.
3. Access to this place is by an almost impassible dirt road filled with gullies and deep holes.  Our driver said you really need a four wheel drive.  The area around it is questionable/scary and to get in, a guard has to be summoned to open a large iron gate.  It is like a military compound.
4. All the tourist destinations are in and around Kandy. It was a grueling hour's drive from there.
5. The area is infested with mosquitos.  Except for the small room we were in, the entire inn is open to the outside---reception areas and rooms, dining, wifi area.  Upon arrival each guest is issued a citronella bracelet that must be worn on the wrist while here for mosquito protection.  The rooms have an electronic repellent distributing device and at night the staff encloses your bed in mosquito netting wherein you must sleep.  In the event of a medical emergency there from allergies or anything, I don't think any help could reach us. 
6. There is NOTHING to do there.  We were booked in for four days.  We left the first morning, but, although the place was one-third empty, they would not give us a refund for the nights we missed. We went to the Hotel Suisse in Kandy for the rest of our stay and it was quite comfortable and civilized.
If you are a young honeymoon couple who don't care about amenities, mosquitoes or touring, but will gaze into each other's eyes all waking hours, maybe you can stay there and ignore everything else.  Be sure to ask anyone who rates/recommends this place if they ever actually stayed there.
title: Beware of staying at this "hotel"

ownerResponse/text:
It's plain wrong that the hotel does not encourage feedback,it's just very hard to understand what makes you say that.We always do,as reviews on tripadvisor and directly from so many guests over almost 10 years have testified.
It's hard to respond to all your individual very negative comments,as many of them differ from the experiences of other guests,including those who stayed in the same room,but suffice to say we are never complacent and digest all feedback seriously - obviously including yours which since your stay,given such a negative overall review, we have been discussing with other guests who stay in Lime Butterfly so they and we can compare their and your experiences.
The lady to whom you refer was actually from the office,not the manager(he talked with you during your stay),and was upset and largely speechless as result of the manner of your dialogue with her.
We have not raised the price of the rooms nor food in recent years and very consistently our counterpart travel agents and many guests tell us our pricing point is good and appropriate,and we regularly review our peer group and other hotels.
We are sorry that whatever your expectations on price,location,food,room or otherwise were not met by The Kandy House,and that you enjoyed the rest of your holiday in Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you never get Lime butterfly room.
text:
We had no idea that although we were paying US$350 per night that our room was dark and small.
The bathroom was divided by a curtain, which I could not believe.
The "lady manager" had the charm of a goldfish and even when I complained that there was not even a shower cap in the room, just smiled.
Our view was the dirty glass roof of another room below.
Breakfast was edible but nothing worth the room rate.
They were also the only hotel that could not make a decent pot of tea.
We had a look at other deluxe rooms in the hotel which was 100% better than our room and had a door to the bathroom and also a balcony. 
Our room should be standard room and charged to reflect the short comings.
We said that we felt the room was not worth the money and was told that the description was in the website.
We had to have the lights on even at midday. The room had shutters but no window pane. 
The set menu was the most expensive of all the hotels we stayed in while is a Sri Lanka.
The hotel is about 40 minutes away from the city so you could not go for a stroll after dinner.
It's going to be interesting see the response to the review as they did not encourage feed back.
Will I stay again, not sure.
title: Never book the Lime Butterfly Room

ownerResponse/text:
Firstly,I would like to thank you for considering The Kandy House as your first choice to stay,and am sorry you experienced a number of misunderstandings,which need to be clarified and can hopefully be best summarised as follows:

The hotel's child policy has been in place for over 9 years since opening,and our counterparts are advised of all policies at least annually - additionally and importantly,our confirmation to your agent included a further reminder,and it's stated on our website.It's probably also worth pointing out that we love children,but feedback from guests and experience with agents has consistently been that this policy makes sense  for this type of smaller property,and is not unique even within Sri Lanka (as well as other countries where it does exist for some hotels).

We just cannot make an exception when such a policy exists and others may not be able to stay there as a result,as well as those choosing it for that reason in some cases.When you arrived,all the other guests were either on an excursion or had not yet arrived,and for that period more than half the rooms would have been occupied.

Again,we are sorry this created frustration for you and hope these clarifications address your impressions,and that overall you had a good experience in Sri Lanka
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't go with children under 12!
text:
We arrived at the hotel (with an 8 year old boy) after hard day's car journeys and sightseeing, and wanted to rest (trying to find this hotel is incredibly difficult and time consuming).  The hotel and surroundings did look lovely and they showed us the rooms. But the big showstopper was that somehow they had taken the booking from AMEX travel without warning them that this hotel has a strict policy of absolutely no children below 12 years old (never before come across such a policy in decades of world travel).

We explored if an exception could be made given the mistake on all sides, and especially as we seemed to be the only guests, but there was no budging on their side.  So reluctantly we went off back to Kandy, and after some exploration, and a guide book we luckily had, we found Helga's Folly, which was even better than the Kandy House (its a spectacular Sri Lankan equivalent of a an old British stately home), and we ended up very happy in Kandy in the end.
title: Warning - dont go with kids under 12!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your review and comments.We are delighted you found the hotel so beautiful,we have certainly strived to create a special environment for guests,and are sorry to read that not all your experiences matched that,although you make clear you "enjoyed" your stay at The Kandy House.

It's unfortunate for you that you arrived feeling so ill,possibly from the journey or a previous experience on your itinerary.We have never received any negative feedback about our welcome,and we are sorry if this was lost in our immediate efforts to offer a more practical remedy to your obvious discomfort,including offering to organise medical assistance and a local coconut remedy on the premises.These were not accepted,and understandably you were in your bedroom for most of the day of your arrival.Also,we made the smaller lunch menu available to you late in the evening as the vegetarian option on the main menu did not suit you,you enjoying mezze platter with your husband followed by pasta for yourself.
