The following day we were keen not to disturb you as you stayed in the room until late morning,when we were happy to serve you breakfast instead of lunch.To clarify the issue with hot water,the regulator had been turned down for a number of previous guests who had mentioned it was too hot,so we just needed to enter the room to access the boiler (receded above the shower area,requiring a ladder) to adjust this,but you and your husband did not wish anyone to enter the room during the whole day,including to clean and make up the room.I hope this did not lessen the chance of us first finding a mosquito under your pillow - all the beds in the hotel have good mosquito nets,and are normally turned down and checked daily.There's an easier way to regulate the air-con system(which was installed last year) via the remote control which can adjust the air direction appropriately.Throughout your stay,we were asked that the staff not go into the room.

We intentionally do not have telephones in every room,although our staff are always available until the last guest goes to bed in case anything is needed.In an emergency,guests are advised to ring the manager in residence on a phone in the common area,close to all the rooms inside the main house, and some lights on the landing and passageway were left on as usual during your stay.

When you had advised us it was your birthday as well as honeymoon,we had planned a complimentary birthday cake,and a bottle of wine,for your enjoyment but omitted to mention this prior to your departure to the perahera,so we are very sorry not to communicate that to you directly.You took your room key with you when you left for the perahara,having said you would return for dinner.Later that night,we received a telephone call from your driver to say you had chosen to have dinner elsewhere in Kandy.That is obviously not a problem,but it's probably important to clarify that on both nights you did not sample either of our main dinner menus.We offer 22 cocktails and mocktails,and are sorry if you did not enjoy yours.

Again,we are very sympathetic if these circumstances,and perhaps some bad luck with an illness on your honeymoon and birthday, combined to make your stay less enjoyable.However,we remain concerned when a guest leaves on a positive note saying they had enjoyed their stay,only to find a "Poor" rating appear later with a list of issues.Hopefully we have now clarified some of these,and we are mindful you have complimented the hotel,including the management and staff.

We have just completed a very successful perahera season for so many of our guests,and are again very sorry that some things did not work out well for you.Wishing you and your husband best wishes and happiness throughout your new married life together.
placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We stayed in a delux room and found it way too small.
text:
The hotel itself is beautiful - in location, scenery, and design. We stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon and also for my birthday and were initially very excited about staying somewhere so highly rated on Trip Advisor. 

However, my husband and I were both very disappointed with the hotel for several reasons:

- Our welcome was cold and not friendly.

- Hot water only ran for five minutes. To solve this problem required several hotel staff and a very tall ladder to enter our small room to turn on a switch. The switch for the hot water should really have been on prior to our arrival.

- The room had no telephone. To get in touch with the hotel staff we had to use the phone in the communal areas. As all lights are turned off when the last guest disappears into their room, this is not ideal.

- Lunch and dinner menu was very limited, with three options for dinner - none of which during our stay included local cuisine, which we found disappointing.

- While the hotel has an extensive cocktail list, the quality of the cocktails were poor.

- The aircon system is dated, and blows too strongly onto the bed on the lowest setting.

- There was a dead mosquito under my pillow on the first night.

Despite this, we did enjoy our time at Kandy House. The hotel has a good collection of games, which were handy for a relaxing evening. The manager was also very accommodating to our requests regarding dining. The grounds are beautiful, and the staff are polite and always keen to help, although some of them do not have a great understanding of the English language.

I was disappointed that the hotel did not live up to our expectations, but happy to have had the Kandy House experience.
title: Beautifully Charming - But Too Many Flaws

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Make sure you are given the name of your room and have them confirm in writing that it has A/C.  The red dot something ultra room does not have A/C is on the ground floor at the front of the building - in my opinion it's not worth the extra cost.  
Make sure you don't have a shared veranda otherwise you may find it occupied by your neighbour or worse still be woken by their early breakfast!
text:
We booked an Ultra Room 7 months ago and specified to our agent that A/C was a must.  Arrived at the KH and were shown to our Ultra Room - with no A/C!!   Whatever the blurb may say - you need A/C!!!

We were given an alternative Deluxe Room - with A/C And after a minor confrontation with the manager he agreed to prefund the difference.

We then opened the door from our bedroom on to the veranda to find another couple sat right by our window enjoying dinner.  I only hope they aren't early risers otherwise our planned lay in will not be possible.

Dinner was Ok but with a very limited menu - 2 starters, 2 mains 1 dessert

All in all the stay is not living up to some of the write ups - but then again we've just come from the Ulagalla Resort further north which was sensational
title: Just not good enough

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived on New Years Eve DEC 31, 2010, 3pm at this stunning place holding a confirmed booking...received warm welcome... drinks... became registered... and a lovely room . Then we went downtown. Coming back to Kandy House 2 hours later at 8pm, mangeress Tania Brassey had packed our suitcases and placed them in the lobby. The answer: "we did not have any booking - room is sold to someone else"!??
Background: at New Years Eve, Kandy is the most wanted and overbooked place in Sri Lanka - so the simple solution to us: our room was sold to someone, which had offerd a higher price... Thank you! As an “support” Tania had booked us alternative room in the overcrowded Kandy at Hotel Regency: dbl room USD 650 incl. diner buffett (internet room  USD 100/night). Happy new year!
title: SP contra MM > stunning place - unfortunatley: management mafiosi

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text: I cannot recommend this hotel.   It's very beautiful, the decor is really lovely, and the welcome is very pleasant.  However, all the other reviewers are right about the mozzies - we had to insist on them supplying one of those plug-in repellers...  And no air-con made my partner very uncomfortable at night.  Sleep was difficult all round.  The hotel is next to a religious establishment, and they start their high-decibel, ear-shattering chanting at 4.45am... end of sleep... it's AWFUL!  We ate there on the first night but were very disappointed as the choice was limited to two dishes, and there was no Sri Lankan food on offer, only Western food which was very disappointing.  My other half's food was cold and not very nice - mine was delicious but that wasn't much consolation.  And the meal was eye-wateringly expensive.  Finally, it's quite a hike into central Kandy;  half an hour or more of wiggly roads.  We were there for two days and you can't get a lot of sightseeing done in two days - and it makes it even more difficult if you are such a long way from town.  Incidentally, when we asked them to recommend a restaurant, they didn't...
title: Totally disappointing after a great start.

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We can only agree with the other negative reviews. 1. Location is too far away from Kandy and the surrounding of the hotel itself is not interesting (only if you are interested in a swimming pool). 2. Rooms are too small and too hot (no air conditioning in the hotel). We stayed in a suite (actually two small rooms) in the basement with no ventilation. Only a small fan. Ceilings are very low, you hear the cracking of the wooden floor above you. 3. Food terrible; breakfast the worst we had during our trip. Dinner not good. 4. Staff unprofessional and be careful they try to cheat you....
Do not stay here. Most travel agents know about the complaints...
title: Very disappointing; bad rooms, poor service...

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Kandy House for 2 nights and the location at least 40 minutes outside Kandy means you can't just pop in and out of the town. The setting of the hotel is lovely with beautiful gardens and nice views from the pool. 
We were very disappointed with the room, we had paid for an upgrade to "Ultra Deluxe" which the hotel was unable to provide, and the room we were given was small and very hot, it had no seating area within the room and a only a shared verandah outside. The wardrobe doors made enough noise to wake the dead when you opened or closed them!
The dinner menu was very limited with only two choices of western style food at each course and it was expensive compared to everywhere else we stayed in Sri Lanka.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just returned from spending 2 weeks in Sri Lanka on honeymoon. We spent about 2 nights per hotel all over the island including the Kandy House.

Now don't get me wrong, this hotel provides a lovely setting and decent service but in comparison to other boutique hotels in Sri Lanka we just felt that this fell short on a number of aspects, and this was even more disappointing after previous reviews and therefore the anticipation of our stay here.

This is the only hotel I am reviewing from my honeymoon, as I feel it necessary to give a couple of warnings to honeymooners about this hotel.

The first real disappointment was the room which was small and noisy. We had a long day to get to the hotel and when we arrived late afternoon we simply wanted to relax in the room for an hour or two. Unfortunately, and it is probably an exception to the general rule of the rooms, but it was tiny - the bathroom was almost bigger - and it was above the kitchen so not only did this make the room very hot but it was also very noisy with the clanging of pans etc and constant voices. 

I think other rooms though would have been very tranquil and probably larger but for the price we had paid for the room we hadn't expected what I imagine must have been the worst one!

The second disappointment was dinner. You are forced to choose from a set menu with just two choices per course, and just the one option for pudding. To be honest the food was nice, but not amazing, but the real let down was the fact that it was the most expensively priced meal we had all trip. It was almost double the norm of better dinners that we had had in other hotels that provided far greater choice on their menus. 

And finally, which is a bit picky and difficult to prevent, but due to its location (surroundings were woods and paddy fields) there were a lot of mosquito's which made relaxing by the pool after about 3pm impossible... back to the noisy and hot room.

The hotel was half an hour from Kandy but we felt it necessary to get our driver to take us to town for dinner on the second night. Also, it was the only hotel we stayed in that refused to even allow our driver to enter the building. This was not in keeping with the general welcoming and relaxed atmospheres that every other hotel offered during our trip.

Overall, the hotel is a beautiful building and staff try very hard to put you at ease with good service but please just be aware of the above. Our room was Lime Butterfly so I would specifically request not to have this one, especially if on honeymoon. And I would recommend that you make arrangements with your driver to spend at least one dinner somewhere in town if you can which will probably upset the management. This was the only hotel we stayed in where we felt that the hotel was a business rather than a luxury boutique service.
title: For Sri Lanka - average!

placeInfo/address: Amunugama Walawwa, Kundasale 20270 Sri Lanka
text:
Having booked this hotel following the reviews on Trip Advisor, sadly, it fell short of what we were expecting.
Our main reason for visiting Kandy was to visit friends, we booked three nights, but only stayed fro two.
Kandy House is architecturally stunning as is the setting (apart from the journey to and from Kandy), our room was beautiful with a big separate bathroom but lacked in the amenities that are usually standard in boutique hotels, beware the bathroom floors are dangerously slippery when wet.  The windows were glassless with a light blind and a wooden shutter, following the turndown service the lamps were left on with the blind up and the shutters open hence I got badly bitten by mosquitoes.  On the second night, we changed rooms to one with glass in the window but my husband was not too keen on the bathtub in the bedroom and the toilet just behind a concrete screen.
We were the only guests staying at the time, which was fine but we would have liked a bit more interaction with the local staff, the manager and his wife were very chatty, informative and helpful in finding us an alternate hotel for our third night. At times we did have to go looking for the staff, when we wanted a pre dinner drink, these are generally served without nibbles.
The food was adequate but there was  no choice for example at breakfast we were  asked “how would you like your eggs” not given any other choices, dinner was a set menu but we ate at Kandy house as it was a bit too far to go back into Kandy for dinner.
I had been looking forward to the yoga and Ayurvedic treatments; however there was no yoga teacher available during our visit. I did try an Ayurvedic massage but I cut short the treatment due to getting bitten by mosquito’s again only bars on the window. A massage bed and some relaxing music would have been preferable to a mattress on the floor and the joviality of the kitchen staff, as the kitchen was next to the massage room. We have nothing against hearing happy staff but it doesn’t create the right ambiance for a relaxing massage.  When we provided feedback about the massage it was not charged for but the choice remark "you are the only person in eight months to not enjoy it" was unnecessary.
Would we return, to Kandy, yes but to Kandy House, no, in our opinion, it is a good standard guest house but not quite there yet for it to be classed as a boutique hotel.
title: Not quite a boutique hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that your experience didn’t meet your expectations. We do strive to offer a unique, nature-focused experience, but we understand that certain aspects, like the journey to the park entrance and the amenities, may not have aligned with what you had hoped for.

We apologize for the miscommunication regarding the entrance fee, hot water, and electricity. Your comments are valuable, and we will certainly address these areas to improve the experience for future guests. We appreciate you acknowledging the staff and the guide’s efforts, and we’ll continue working to provide better clarity and ensure a smoother stay.

Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope you'll consider giving us another opportunity to improve your experience in the future.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text: The camp is remote, to get to the national park entrance it's a 30-40 minute bumpy ride, we were over charged on the entrance fee, disappointing. The tents are ok, certainly not glam, told there was wifi, not. Told there was hot water, not. Told there was electricity, on and off, fan, lights and rechargeable torch. The staff were good, the food good, the safaris interesting, the guide very knowledgeable,  but the whole experience was expensive and overpriced
title: Not glamping, more like camping

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we sincerely apologize for the disappointing experience you had during your stay. We understand your frustration with the discrepancies between the website and your experience, especially regarding the all-inclusive package, activities, and safari options. We always aim to provide an exceptional experience for our guests, and it’s clear we fell short in this instance.

We take your comments seriously and will review our communications, including website details and offerings, to ensure that future guests do not encounter the same issues. We also deeply regret the lack of transparency regarding the availability of activities and the disconnect between the information provided to you before your arrival.

We truly appreciate you bringing this to our attention, and we hope you’ll consider giving us another chance to provide a more seamless and enjoyable experience.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
This was an exceptionally disappointing experience.
I researched the Mahoora website extensively before booking on wotif. We were very much looking forward to staying at the eco camp however once we arrived we were informed there was no night walk, no activities, dinner was not included and there was no hot water (we booked the all inclusive package). We contacted the camp manager ahead of the day to ask check in times as well as to see whether we could join an afternoon safari following checkin. They only came back to us with a check in time so when we arrived (at the designated time) we were told we’d missed the safari. We were actively discouraged from doing a whole day safari, despite this being an offering on the website. There was no responsibility taken by Mahoora for the disconnect between their website and wotif. Also Big game camping experience is on the same site, which is budget so we could have paid much less for essentially the same experience.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Trek,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the lack of water during your stay. Your feedback is crucial, and we'll address this issue to ensure it doesn't happen again in the future. We appreciate your kind words about the food and the efforts of our staff, as well as your positive feedback about the tour. We understand your disappointment, and we're sorry that we fell short of your expectations. We hope you'll consider giving us another chance to provide you with the experience you deserve.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this place!
text: We paid 400$ for a tent with running water, toilet and shower but there was no water! The staff kept telling us that the monkeys toyed with the pumps . Not true the well was dry and the pumps were not working! Just tell us the truth! That being said the food was good, the staff tried hard. The tour was great. Don’t stay there because there are other places to stay in a tent!
title: No water

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're truly sorry to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations and that you encountered issues during your stay. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the water not working in your bathroom and the discomfort with the temperature in the tent. ; this is certainly not up to our usual standards, and we understand how frustrating it must have been.

We'll address these issues promptly to ensure a better experience for our guests in the future. Your comments about pricing and accommodations are duly noted, and we'll review them to better align with our guests' expectations. We appreciate your input and hope for the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved stay.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Way over priced, the water in our bathroom did not work for the two days we were there. 
The staff tried hard but the accommodations are not aligned with the price. I don’t recommend staying here. 
Tent was hot even with the fans, tough to sleep. 
Again for a $400 price point and called VIP at the very least the water should work.
title: Way overpriced for the accommodation. Don’t recommend staying here.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest 
We at Mahoora are very happy that you have really liked and appreciative of almost all aspects of the experience other than the first-day dinner and some aspects of our mobile tent.  

We have provided the exact mobile tent published on the website and other communications, without any compromise. Exact dimensions of the tent and all the amenities are also explained in our communications. We believe that the "Luxuries" provided need to be perceived having the understanding that it's a mobile tent.   

The water leakage to the bedroom carpet could have happened due to the shower curtain being opened during a shower. We have not found any plumbing leaks. However, housekeeping staff was advised to be more vigilant on the areas mentioned by you. We thank you for the feedback. 

We are really sorry that certain aspects of your experience hadn’t been to your entire expectations.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We decided to make the booking having read and contacted management regarding recent negative reviews on Tripadvisor. To their credit Mahoura acknowledged our concerns and reassured us that our concerns would be addressed. On a very positive note the staff are as much the value add to the experience as are the surroundings. Of particular note was our naturalist (Puwarhara) who had a deep knowledge and passion for conservation and what Sri Lanka more broadly has to offer. Our safari driver (Nishantha) was the second pair of eyes who spotted wildlife that was ridiculously hard to locate but also took care as we travelled over the roads of the Udawalawe reserve. 
This was however where things stopped. On the ‘negative’ and specifically related to the accommodation the food was quite variable and sadly well below expectations. The barbecued meat on the first night was inedible. We found the Sri Lankan selection on the second night a better option though the food was only warm at best. The so called continental menu was mediocre and not worth the effort. 
Mahoora is an expensive experience and our expectations were that the standard would have been high across our stay. For what you pay there needs to be a serious review with what is being offered particularly if they consider cheaper options now entering the space. The tents appear modified ex-army and are a novel experience but really don’t meet the same glamping standards offered elsewhere around the world. The bathroom facilities are very small and located directly behind a thin partition and the head of your bed. Lighting is poor throughout. In our tent the waste water from the shower seemed to have leaked onto the rug near the bed. This should have been identified as part of their general maintenance along with removing the mould from the bottom of the shower curtain. Perhaps for a one night stay this is tolerable but is really below par. The concept appears good but if you charge a premium you also need to deliver a premium. We have a stay booked for their property at Wilapatu and hope things are better.
title: Certainly NOT glamping

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your valuable feedback. We understand that you did not entirely enjoy your experience with us at Mahoora. We are sorry that you were not provided with a mosquito net as we provide mosquito nets to our clients on request and we do not have soap at the tent as we provide shower gel. We are concerned that you were not aware of the 30 minute drive to the park and that our campsite was not inside the park, perhaps this was not communicated to you. We are also sorry that your expectations on the guide were not met. We have taken the issue very seriously and taken immediate action to expand our pool of naturalists & other staff and have a standby person at all times. We are also alarmed that you got sick from our food. We can assure you that our food is of very high quality as we service high profile clients at Mahoora. Upon investigation we did not hear of any issue on the food from other clients from the same night. Nevertheless, we sincerely regret that we were not able to fulfill your expectations.
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Not the ‘luxury’ safari camp experience we were hoping for but if you are thinking of staying here, the Elite tent is the only accommodation that comes remotely close.
Even then, ours was lacking a mosquito net and basic toiletries like soap.
There are 2 main issues. The first is the distance of the camp from the safari park - at least a 30 minute drive in a jeep on bumpy roads followed by queuing to get into the park and then more queuing with numerous other jeeps to buy tickets. 
Mahoori did not provide an English speaking naturalist and the ranger supplied by the safari park spoke very basic English.  We had assumed that the campsite was inside the park - to us, there didn’t seem much point in camping when there were more comfortable accommodations to be found closer to the park.
The second issue was that the Mahoori campground was understaffed. The English speaking manager was doing his best to multitask but appeared overwhelmed by the number of guests that were checking in and requiring orientation/assistance.
To cap it all off, my partner got sick following dinner on the first night. Overall, did not meet our expectations.
title: Disappointing experience

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for placing your review on us. We are thankful to trip adviser for having given the opportunity to place your story.  However we would like to bring a couple of concerns that we have on your review as we can see based on the transactions and correspondences that you had with us that your review is biased. Primarily you have inquired from our sales consultant on the product Mahoora Elite and thereafter made your booking on booking.com on Mahoora classic which does not consists the same product features. On your arrival, you have shown our staff the itenary you received from the direct inquiry through our sales consultant . Whilst you enjoyed the extra safari you refused to pay the additional charges and upon request to pay an aggressive mail was sent with the hope of creating a confusion and mitigating your responsibility to pay. Unfortunately it is very visible that there is a lack of integrity in your dealing and your refusal to pay extra charges 

	 	We are placing all these details as your review can be completely misleading for other travelers
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Don't do it! Bad communications with the company before, under and after. Several days after the stay they still send confirmations email regarding the "upcoming stay". It was a very expensive experience with bad/mediocre food. Our guide in the park did not know very much and we spotted more animals than he did. The camp is far away from the park entrance (35 min each way by jeep). We payed 409 USD including tax and service charges for two persons for one night which is seriously overpriced. Afterwards Mahoora harassed us by claiming an extra 200 USD in addition to the 409 USD.

Not a recommended company.
title: Overpriced and did not live up to the expectations

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are glad that you enjoyed our staff service. We are sorry for the inconveniences caused by the food and accommodation. However,it is a mobile tented campsite which you cannot compare with a permanent structure. We are deeply sorry that you had a bad experience with us. We have taken your feedback into account for improvement of our services and have come a long way since then. Again, we are truly sorry!
placeInfo/address: Udawalawe National Park 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Find somewhere else to stay.
text:
It is sometimes hard to write a review on a hotel where the staff are trying hard but just about everyone else is wrong.  A mitigating factor maybe that the new law in Sri Lanka has forced them out of the park to a location 45 minutes drive away (they claim 30 minutes but..) that is alongside a dam but at the swampy end.  The mosquitos are a problem but only one of many.  The tents are cramped and the bathroom smaller - this is not luxury tents in the style that is found in Africa or India.  The quickly (?) cleared land has been left with tree stumps to trip over in the dark.  The food is poor by any standard and the smell of diesel hanging over the entire site coming from the kitchens does not help.

We arrived at 18.30 hrs on Christmas Eve having had a drive in the Park - a drive provided by Mahoora with a non English speaking driver that hung onto the bumper of another vehicle that had a spotter/guide.  After a poor night we were able to arrange another place to stay at 10.00hrs on Christmas Day - not bad considering.  We had been booked at Mahoora for 3 days/nights but delighted to get out as quickly as we could.

I sent a note to the management suggesting they re-llok at their business model because this is not a luxury tented experience.  The other people we met when we were there were also complaining.  I feel sorry for the staff but this place should be avoided at all costs.
title: We were glad to escape after one night.

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
I decided to book Coco Tangalla after having read only positive reviews, and knowing the place is part of the Manor House Concept in Sri Lanka. The price was medium high for the country, so I assumed the villa was nice enough. My fault.
I can not say the place is bad…but surely it is not a boutique villa as presented. 
More an “ok” guest house maybe. 
The place would need to be refurbished and better maintained. It appears messy, old, basic instead of stylish. My bedroom had a very nice terrace/patio with the view on the pool: all the sun-umbrellas  have holes; no slippers in the bedroom; the bathrobe were literally exhausted, and one maybe not even washed but…; the safety box completely rusted; the aircon works at the maximum speed only; the fan on the ceiling was so dirty I was afraid to turn it on…
It is mentioned as a 3* place. Surely not a 5*, that’s ok. But frequently in the small place like that, the category of the stars is not applicable. 
Here is totally applicable, but for the same price I have paid in 4* hotels in the country, largely more deserved.
Surely it is over priced for the standard offered, compared to the other places where I stayed during my trip. It costs not soooo less of the Galle Fort Hotel, -same brand property-, but it has nothing, really nothing in common with!
title: A guest house with the price of a boutique hotel

ownerResponse/text:
We take each individual review very seriously,and typically want  to be constructive and open-minded should we reply.In this case,it is very clear that additional context and comment are required.

The words in your heading "...not the experience we were expecting" says a lot.Obviously your tour operator had booked the wrong hotel for you.This very long review is largely a cut + paste of your email to your tour operator,written in the context of you trying to get a refund for a hotel arranged for you and which you checked out of before sleeping there one night.That choice is of course yours,and it is fine if the hotel did not suit you,but I am rather surprised you have replicated the same in a public forum - a number of your comments contradict so much written by others,and the overall feedback we have received from guests staying at Coco Tangalla for many years.

We know that your tour operator tried to book a different hotel but Coco Tangalle was booked due to unavailability at your first choice.We also understand the same may have happened in Kandy,where unavailability existed for your first choice and your tour operator also selected an unsuitable alternative.Perhaps overall they did not fully understand the expectations of their client,nor explained that you had been booked in a different type of hotel than your first choice.

In general this review exudes the frustration of a client who was booked by their tour operator into a hotel as a substitute to their first choices - which you have pointed out in your comments - and who ironically would have achieved their first choice near Tangalle had they just not rushed away in haste,without even a proper conversation with the manager,as there had been a last-minute cancellation at the first choice and for the best room no less!

In your enthusiasm to leave and haste to criticise,I feel your comments are somewhat disingenuous and for me importantly,do a disservice to our other guests whose budget may have been less than yours but have thoroughly enjoyed their stay.I don't think it is a coincidence that your review is surrounded by headlines such as "Outstanding"..."Refined Tranquility"..."Absolute Paradise"..."Fabulous Boutique Hotel"...and more.We hope Coco Tangalle remains the first choice for many more travellers to come,we look forward to welcoming them.
placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We experienced an overwhelming sense of disappointment on arrival at coco tangalla located within the interesting town of tangalle on the southern coast of Sri Lanka.

'Each of the six spacious rooms is individually designed and elegantly decorated by combining period-style furniture with brightly coloured silks and Sri Lankan fabrics.
Facilities include a swimming pool and meals are usually served either at the terrace which offers superb views of the sea, or in the garden.'

This is how the hotel was described to us by our tour operator. I just cannot understand why so many postings are so positive. I can see it would suit the needs of some travellers looking for a small bed and breakfast style experience, but as part of an alleged luxury tour of Sri Lanka this hotel did not suit our needs at all. 

This was supposed to be three nights, four days of relaxation and being pampered in a comfortable villa by the sea after quite an exhausting tour.

Reality at coco tangalla - 
only two rooms have sea views. Far from spacious rooms, we were allocated on arrival a narrow bedroom closer to the main road, a busy and dangerous bend with traffic horns, adjacent to the small uninspiring dining facility at this hotel. 

The only window was blocked by a screen separating guest walkway and dining area. I can see why this was done; you would not want to be resting on the bed with the world watching but the consequence was to make the room dark and claustrophobic.

The staff are friendly and welcoming; it is not their fault how Coco Tangalla is represented by the tour operators or the hotel's marketing team. Consumers do deserve the chance to enjoy honest representation of the hotel experience at coco tangalla, especially on the holiday of a lifetime experience that couples booking a luxury tour would expect. This would be fine if we had chosen a three star hotel for our trip.

The management on arrival kindly offered to upgrade us to a bigger room next day, which was appreciated as a gesture, but it is a real lottery booking here to know what room you will end up with especially if your tour guide and driver keeps you out all day on the day of arrival! If you are staying here more than a night or two perhaps check in advance the features and location of the room  allocated to you. It is a small property so not very difficult for the staff to manage your expectations in advance. Also be sure to check the proposed menu for the night of your check in, so you can decide in advance whether to eat on site or not if you are on B and B basis. I would not recommend tying yourself into half or full board at this establishment for any long stay.

Overall description of the property in our opinion is misleading. Meals served on the terrace/garden - it's only a patch of grass next to a modest pool.

The bathroom door does not close very easily, and the towels are thin and hard suggesting old and poorly laundered.

The beach 

Disappointed by the beach which is indeed in front of the property, however the sound of crashing waves on the rocks was very pleasant and the sea is close. Going for a walk on the beach brought us to a suspect pipe and smelly stagnant body of water, broken glass and the beach adjacent to coco tangalla did not feel clean,  in spite of the heavy surf. Might explain some of our thoughts further down about turndown service and subsequent issues with Mosquito control.

Dinner 

Set menu choices limited and unappealing. Surprised not advised in advance that the hotel  has no alcohol licence, which seems somewhat odd for relaxing beach experience hotel. 

We were offered some kind of free wine with dinner the hotel along with some kind of requirement for a voluntary donation, which sounded to me like selling wine without being able to select what you require.

After our rather average meal, we enquired if water for drinking and teeth cleaning would be put into our room during the turn down service. This turned out to be one very small bottle of water to be shared by both of us, not even a bottle each! 

Upon entering the room after dinner, staff had made considerable effort to make the bed look attractive in the small room provided but the fact that the Mosquito nets were fully down was a concern, and the overwhelming smell of insect repellant was truly suffocating: we could not even contemplate sleeping in that room. I had not experienced this suffocating control system in other hotels we visited on this trip.

This hotel may appeal to customers travelling on a budget depending on the rate secured (it's hard to know the rate we paid since this stay was part of a luxury tour arranged in the uk but this was a late substitute by the local ground handling agents) - be wary of any substitute offered on a tour and check both good and bad comments before making your mind up if the substitution seems fair. I will of course be taking this up with the tour operator upon my return, but we were determined to enjoy the rest of our holiday in comfort.

Coco tangalla was not the place to relax and enjoy  the beach we were looking forward to at the end of our otherwise very enjoyable but tiring tour of Sri Lanka. 

We checked out without sleeping in the bedroom, we found there are better alternatives nearby to be pampered with fine dining service and romantic getaway if your budget will stretch. 

Coco Tangalla would certainly not be the right place for a honeymoon, or special anniversary, or birthday. We were extremely disappointed that our first view and taste of the Sri Lankan beach experience was at this property and are very thankful that we were able to move on at further cost to another property.

I know there are some very positive postings on this website and it's is good to have different opinions, I felt we should share our personal experience to help manage expectations of guests looking for feedback about coco tangalla!
title: Coco Tangalla was not the luxury boutique hotel beach experience we were expecting

placeInfo/address: 355 Mahawella Road, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Only one room if you must stay here - King Coco
text: Was so looking forward to a few days relaxation at the end of our tour in Sri Lanka and was horrified to arrive here on a very busy and typically noisy road and right on a bend. Once inside we were shown by very polite and kindly staff to a very small room with a rank bathroom. to say I was upset is an understatement. If I said the width at the end of the bed to the cupboard was two flip flops wide , the same on one side and on the other we had to put our luggage as there was nowhere else for it to go. After one sleepless night we were offered a slightly bigger room with a separate shower which was a minor improvement but after discovering a cockroach by the toilet that night I wasnt impressed. I expected a better standard and would be hard pressed to give this the equivalent of two stars. The staff were patient and kind and the food was fine. The pool was very nice and as there are only 5 bedrooms it was never crowded. The only room worth having was the King Coco. during our 5 nights here we watched a procession of arrivals look as dismayed and disappointed as we were and ended up feeling sorry for the 5 boys who were running the place. This really wasnt good enough and I blame our travel advisor for putting us there as the other hotels we stayed in had been much better. Sorry to be so negative but it was really not good enough.
title: Big disappointment

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Let me me give you the good news first.

The only three things that prevent me from awarding this establishment a 'Poor' rating instead of a 'Terrible' rating are the mini garden with the swing, the young lady who served us tea and the abundance of a multitude of fish swimming freely in the lake.

The rest 'falls' away quite fantastically.

The nature/walking path is in such a state of disarray and neglect; I love a nice stroll and a sit but I do not love rusty, broken benches in dilapidated summer huts.

Moving a bit further, we found a poor little pony locked in a mosquito-infested stall...

The swimming pool was maintained poorly with chipped tiles biting into me on more  than one occasion. The changing rooms were merely glorified toilets.

Then there was the buffet...and the lunch service...

The food was bland, mediocre, disappointing.

And, oh-my-lord the lunch service!

The buffet was set to end at 03:30 pm, however the staff began taking away everything at 03:10 pm, rushing and ruining what would have otherwise been a relaxing lunch.

Step back to before 03:10 pm, and the staff began conversing, discussing and laughing rather too loudly disturbing our (expected) quiet lunch. 
Proper training breeds proper performance.

Historical reputation is a thin robe to veil the naked state of slow decay; sad reminders of better days lay strewn about the grounds.

Nothing to thank you.

Will not be seeing you soon.
title: Hunas Has Fallen

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel is located in lovely green hilly countryside north of Kandy.  Riding by car is at least 1:15 h. 
The last bit of the road is in an extremely bad state. 
Rooms are big and have balcony and a lovely view over the valley. 

There’s no staff to be seen at the reception. 
If someone can be found , English language will not be understood. 

Warm water is only sometimes available 

The pool is big but noisy and no clear water. 

Carpets in the public spaces are rotten and mouldy. 

Food is good but not hot. 

Friendly staff in the restaurant 

Room service extremely bad  

The worst point for us: Hunas falls is advertising hiking and walking in the surrounding. But they’re are unable to provide maps or jpx data. No path signs. Nothing 

And the last. 

It’s a really big hotel.  We stayed Alone during high season.
title: Ambivalent Hotel in a poor state in lovely surroundings

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check facilities before u go. A bit dated hotel. No proper wifi
text: I am 12 years old. We visited this hotel with my Father on his office trip. It was a disaster. First the room was very good but there was not enough water pressure, the buffet was very good. The pools shallow end was not level and not good for us kids.  The pool table was broken, no english books , The staff were ok and friendly
title: From a 12 year old

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
While I admire the location, beautifully managed garden and the nature hotel service was far from my expectations.  I had bad customer care from the reservation.  The website didn't allow me to book online using debit/credit card, so I had to call hotline.  Once the payment was done through a bank transfer, had to call/WhatsApp multiple times to receive confirmation.  Reservations continuously ignored my calls and queries, and never returned calls.  We were informed to be ready for breakfast at 07:30 so that we can start a jungle trail at 08:30.  To our surprise, the staff was still cleaning the floor at 07:30, and the breakfast was not served delaying our jungle trail as well!  Out of thousands of hotels I have visited in my life, this is the first hotel which didn't serve tea/coffee at the breakfast!  Tea/coffee were not served for 20 finish since ordered, so we had to give it up to be on time for the jungle trail.  While on the jungle trail, the manager called the guide multiple times and instructed to slow down until some late guests to join us wasting our precious time that could have been spent on something else.  Room service was too slow.  What was confirmed to be delivered was not available, but we were never informed until the rest was delivered.  When asked the waiter said they called the room, but 3 of us were in the room who didn't hear a phone ringing.  Either he was lying or the phone system doesn't work.

It is sad to see such a nice hotel in a beautiful nature has fallen into this level due to poor management.
title: Beautiful nature, nice surrounding, but very poor service

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not expect what is shown on social media.
text:
I like to start off by saying the scenery is out of this world and the location is truly unmatchable. However , the operations / management of the hotel was very disappointing. Infact we shortened our stay and checked out in one night though we had booked for two. 
The staff can not be blamed as they did try their best - but they had limited knowledge and limited resources. What was appalling the most is it didn’t match the standards of advertising at all. The stories and posts the pages share are a complete misrepresentation.
On arrival we were informed that hot water is only available from 6.30-9.30 am and pm. While on your end there might be difficulty, what you must understand is in this day and age no one goes to a hotel paying close to 40 K a night for basic resources to be withheld as almost every house now has geysers . 
Then we were informed of a power cut. A hotel that has a power cut???? Even my house has an inverter and we didn’t pay so much and come all the way to stay in the dark in an unknown place risking our safety and sacrificing our comfort.

Next the food, while the staff did try their best to accommodate us - more that 3/4 of the menu wasn’t available quite contrary to what is posted on social media. There are advertisements of a games room which looked very enticing . But we found a pretty old and dilapidated room where most games were not even available. Even the hotel couldn’t be viewed properly as the lights were constantly off. We felt very unsafe and unproductive. Extremely dissatisfying
title: Complete misrepresentation on social media

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
I booked this hotel for my cousin on 22nd August for two nights in December. The rate on their official website was LKR 44,000 for two nights and I received the booking confirmation after the payment. 3 Weeks later, I get an email asking for LKR 79,000 for the hotel that I already booked, saying that they have increased the prices. An 80% increment on the price within 3 weeks!!! 

I emailed them asking them to be reasonable since we already had the confirmed booking, and guess what, they are offering LKR 3900 reduction in the rates. How INSANE. After asking for a refund, they took 3 more weeks to refund our money, resulting in us missing most of the offers available in other places. They said they are waiting for the management to approve the refund. I mean, Seriously?

The Worst Hotel Experience I ever had. 

Please avoid this irresponsible, untrustworthy and unprofessional place.
title: AVOID at All Cost

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
Hunts falls hotel food and beverage service staff was incredible specially Chaminda. Waiter .Sidath butler. Wasantha & Hemantha. F&B Excutive they're most popular and valuable staff. Customer satisfaction is high standards. I been many places for holidays but hunas falls hotel is best destination for specially for HONEYMOON couples. 
I was booked this place through my friend is Sidath butler.I  work with Sidath Maldives he works under me.. He was recommended hunas falls hotel.  In case there was a time I was really disappointed since I  gifted something very small to my friend, but the management fired him due taking the gift that I have given to him. I believe management will revised the decision with the good manner to continued his carrer with the Hunasfalls hotel. I am willing to promote Hunasfalls hotel outside from Sri Lanka & I have big trust on the Hunasfalls management.
title: Despondent about the management

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
As hotel Hunas falls was known to be one of the best hotels in Kandy I made a reservation for a double room for 6th of August 2021. I made this reservation on mid July and hotel requested a 50% of advance payment to complete the booking. Hence I deposited the money on same day and I confirmed my booking. However I got a call from the hotel on 28th of July saying hotel is closed until 7th of August. Since I already arranged my trip I told the hotel that we are not in a situation to change our date hence I need my advance payment back as we have to look for another hotel to stay. Then they were agreed with it and they asked me to send a mail requesting for a refund. On same day (28th July) I sent them the mail as they requested but I never received the refund or even a reply to my mail. On 10th of August I sent them a chaser mail but still no response.

Last few days I called the hotel and they took my contact details and said they will call me back but they never called me back. This was happened twice. I am utterly disappointed with the service provided by this hotel to me so far. When these things happens as guests we are scared to make advance payments for hotel bookings. 

Now it is almost 1 month since I made the payment but I am yet to receive any kind of a response from the hotel.
title: Not responding for customer requests

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
The road leading up to the hotel is in extremely bad condition. Whilst dangerous, it is also not responsible on the part of the Hotels' Management to allow guests to travel here under these conditions. 

We are extremely disappointed with the Hotel and its Management which caused serious damage to the vehicle we were traveling in. This is NOT acceptable and we CAUTION all travelers to Hotel. We believe the Hotel should not operate and accommodate guests until such time the road leading up to the hotel has been repaired.
title: Access road makes hotel visit Horrible!!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mayank 

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts and Spas! 

Thank you for selecting Amaya Hunas falls. We deeply regret to note the issues mentioned and we consider as a prime responsibility to express our deepest apologies since we have not managed to fully satisfy your needs due to the specific unfortunate and seldom incidents. Your comments will be  passed to the  management team for immediate corrective action. 

Warmest Regards,

Deepika Disssanayake
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: Horrible food! Horrible service.. ac’s dont work.. very negative attitude of staff.. ask for trekking.. staff on leave.. ask for spa.. staff on leave.. ask for dinner at 7.. not started.. ask for wine on menu.. mostly not available..
title: Amaya hunas falls

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Wathsala

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts and Spas! 

Thank you for taking time to post this review following your visit. All your valuable complements and comments are well noted .We are sorry to note that you were disturbed by the noise made by some guests.  . Thank you again and Hope you will be our guest in the future as well.

Warmest Regards,

Deepika Disssanayake
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: The rooms are not sound proff and there are some really loud people who doesnt know to behave when they come to a hotel, screaming nonstop disturbing everyone. This is our 4th visit to this hotel but the first time we had such bad experience. We got one more night to go .. hoping it'll be better.
title: Worst Ever Holiday

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts and Spas!

Thank you for your review of your stay with us. We always appreciate hearing from our guests, including places of improvement. We apologize that the comfort of your stay was interrupted and We will definitely take your comments to our team to ensure that in the future, these are not recurring issues.

Thank you for your valued patronage. 
Warmest Regards, 

Deepika Dissanayake
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text: They should rename the place Moth Falls because there are significantly more moths than people in this hotel. Moldy carpeting and stained walls complement the barely-attached toilet seat and leaky shower. The housekeeping staff appear to be doing nothing, as a dead mosquito remained crushed on the wall from the previous tenants of our room. To top it all off, the food is awful, the fish tasted like it had been caught last year. The rooms are disgusting and the service is mediocre (we were welcomed by a front desk person who said no more than two words to us and took over 20 minutes to check us in without explanation), save your money and stay elsewhere.
title: Don’t go

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa - Wattegama Road, Wehigala East 21012 Sri Lanka
text:
We travelled as a group of 6 (3 couples). Arrived at the hotel almost an hour after the scheduled check in time. But got to know that my room  was not ready yet so we took a walk through the stunning garden. This resort is located in a stunning landscape. But some basic errors of the management and some rude and neglecting members of the staff ruined our stay completely. 
1.	Hot water was not working properly in my room. And the direction of the faucet was messed up. (On left for the wash basin tap and on the right tap for the shower with no red or blue marks on it.)  
2.	Asked for an iron and a board twice, but never got it so I had to go for the dinner in my gym clothes.
3.	At the restaurant we were totally neglected and no one even offered the drinks menu to our table. (But they were very attentive to some selected tables) 
4.	Food was bland. Fish tasted like fried with old oil. Same desserts for both dinner and lunch.
5.	At the dinner service I spotted someone has put the spoon from a meat dish to a vegetarian dish. When I returned there some 20 minutes later it was still there. 
6.	One of my friends booked a suite with a kitchenette, when asked while booking they said it is fully functional. But the kitchenette was only a non-functioning stove and a couple of glasses plus a bigger refrigerator.  
7.	When asked about how it functions they said that it is there for Arabic customers who bring their own food and ‘cookware’ with them. (Are you serious now?)
8.	 They sent a fruit platter to the suite but had to call the housekeeping again to tell that we can’t eat fruits without a knife to cut them.

9.	After calling few times again finally an iron was delivered to our room. It looked like an antique. (Photos attached). I was almost electrocuted attempting to put some water to the steamer. 

10.	After all the terrible things I decided to take my wife for a spa treatment, when asked about the spa they had a nice answer. ‘’Sir, the spa is opened but we don’t have a therapist today.’’ 
11.	Almost all the people at the restaurant were not even bothering to smile when they spoke to us.

Finally it came to a breaking point when we asked for a little late check-out. Even without asking the reason or anything they rejected it saying ‘’we are full today’’. So I had to remind the person at the reception that we had to wait for some time to get our rooms even we arrived an hour late. His response was ‘’ the room was ready but you went for a walk.’’ Believe me he was the same person who told us that one room was not ready when we arrived. Having enough bad experience I decided to call the manager. 
The assistant manageress listened to our experiences and promptly apologized for the inconvenience. But it didn’t change anything as they have already ruined our hardly found day off. This happened just before the lunch, after which we checked out. Suddenly at lunch service everyone at the restaurant (same people who neglected us for 2 meals) came to us to talk. 
As we booked this stay for a credit card offer, the only thing I can assume is that the staff treats the locals who come to stay with them using such offers as third class customers.  So please do not offer such discounts if you don’t want locals to stay at your property. Because most of the people find it very hard to find a time for a getaway from work and hate it when that day is ruined. And it’s really sad that such a stunning place is abused by the bad attitudes of handful of people.
title: If you don’t want us to stay – just admit it

text: I'm beginning to think we went to a different hotel from that described by other reviewers. We were there over the Christmas / new years break. From what the staff told us, the hotel had been struggling with occupancy rates and this was the first time in a while they had a fully booked hotel. Lets just say it showed. Initially, the reception looked and felt quite nice with a bit of an old ski lodge feel to it, but that's where the niceness ended for us. I don't think the room had been cleaned in a while, we actually had to get a hoover in to sort out the room ourselves. The shower leaked so every time it was used, the room was flooded, bringing up all kinds of dirt hidden in the  bathroom and I dare not imagine what else. Amenities were poor e.g. no fridge in the room. When we complained to the manager, he really had no response except to say he will swap our room the next day. It was a real shame as the location is beautiful. Unfortunately our longgggggg drive up to reach the hotel was just not worth it.
title: Heinous Falls

Confirm meal options in advance

text:
I booked a package that included bed and breakfast, and later added lunch through the app. Upon arrival, I was informed that the buffet was unavailable, which was understandable. However, the restaurant also did not offer the set menu, which was disappointing. As a result, we had to pay separately and ended up having lunch at the rooftop bar.

One of the most unpleasant experiences was when the housekeeper knocked and immediately entered the room without waiting for a response — a clear violation of privacy.

The lady reception staff member was not as welcoming or friendly compared to other hotels I’ve stayed at, which impacted the overall impression.

On a positive note, the room had a beautiful sea view, although it also included part of the city. The rooftop offered a lovely view as well and was a nice place to relax.

Overall, while the location and views were great, the service and hospitality fell short of expectations.
title: Inconsistent Service with Beautiful Views

text:
The hotel is a recently acquired Radisson’s property and have the looks of a 70s vintage property. The hotel is badly in need of a refurbishment. The checkin experience was dismal, as the hotel didn’t respond to two emails I sent to them requesting for a room upgrade we were eligible for as per Radisson’s rewards program. On arrival, the hotel had no information about our emails and couldn’t give us the upgrade. We had booked ocean facing premium rooms. The rooms were very tiny, but yes, it was ocean facing. Breakfast buffet was adequate however, slow and bad service spoiled the experience. None of the orders at the live counters will get served to you, and you have to wait and grab whatever is available. Room service was also really slow.

Only saving grace was the rooftop restobar with infinity pool. View from the top was fantastic and the pool, though small, was well maintained. There were no steam/ sauna arrangements as well. 

This property needs a big uplift to be sold as a Radisson’s property in my opinion.
title: Disappointing Experience

text:
This was one of my worst experiences at this resort. I faced disappointment during the reservation process, as my emails went unanswered. I nearly gave up on this resort but decided to give it a chance. Unfortunately, the resort's communication is very poor, and the staff lack hospitality training.

On Saturday, there was no buffet, only à la carte options, which we were not informed about until we arrived at the restaurant. When guests asked questions, the staff often paused for 7 to 10 seconds to use their mobile phones before responding. The coffee machine was broken, forcing us to travel to a nearby resort for a cappuccino.

Compared to other resorts, we were impressed with the service at Maalu Maalu Resort, which is very close to Calm Resort. However, when we called the reception, they asked us to call the relevant extension to place orders, which was inconvenient.

Overall, it was one of the poorest services I have ever experienced. However, I must mention that the restaurant chef and manager were very helpful and attentive to our dietary needs during the buffet, especially regarding allergies.
title: Poor hospitality

Dear Guest ,

placeInfo/address: Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed as a family of five including three teenagers for a beach break in the middle of a tour of Sri Lanka.  
First the good points.  The hotel has a great location on Passikudah beach with wide beach frontage and a big pool. The beach is stunning and has a great water sports centre 5 minutes walk down the beach with jet skis, snorkelling etc.  The hotel spa was also nice.  
Now the bad points. Staff not able to communicate well and terrible service for everything.  The only thing that was quick was taking your plate away the minute you stopped eating.  Food in the restaurant was buffet only with a poor choice and poor quality.  Also restaurant enclosed with no air conditioning making for uncomfortable eating.  Very difficult to get an alcoholic drink too. Gym had limited equipment and also not air conditioned.  Lots of Russian visitors with signs and TV all in Russian too.  Only 10 sun loungers at the pool and difficult to get pool towels or any drink/food by the pool.  Beach bar never open.  Rooms ok but layout of hotel means all first floor rooms have no view as they look onto the beach bungalows and second floor rooms also limited views too due to beach bungalows so not able to sit on balcony to enjoy the outlook.  Our rooms were also close to staff quarters plus pigeons nesting in the roof so quite noisy.  Also watch out for the visiting cockroaches in the bathrooms and poor drainage meaning shower regularly flooded the adjacent bathroom area.
Sorry to say we were disappointed with this hotel considering it is advertised as 4*.  We would rate it more like a low 3*.  Passikudah definitely worth a visit but if we recommend to stay in one of the other 4* hotels on the bay if you can.
title: Disappointing!  Lovely location but not much else positive to say about this place

text:
Reception:

Courteous, friendly personal but do not understand a thing you tell them, probably due to lack of exposure and training.

Hotel space:

Located right on famous kalkudha/Pasikudha beach.
Poorly maintained garden, corridors, patios, furniture and spaces.
Poorly illuminated pathways and water dripping corridors, an accident waiting to happen.
Every other property in the vicinity have provided for sand removal method on the way back from beach, but in here there is none.

Room, Bath and sleep:

Comparatively small rooms and bathrooms.
Damped towels, hot water taking its sweet time to arrive.
Adequate bathroom amenities.
AC is directly facing the bed so sleep may be disturbed.
Very poor selection of TV channels.

Pool and beach:

Nice and spacious pool.
Well-kept beach and pool beds.
No life guard on duty.

Restaurant and bar:

They virtually recycled food items, same salad was available for more than 3 meals in the same plate.
Breads were dried out and cold.
Only one person was interested in guests, was the chef. Service personal were plenty and nobody seems to have the proper idea of what to do.
One appeared to be the FB manager was in the bar most of the meal time.
Please try to adjust meal times to 7-10, 12-15, 19-22 at least.
Make a drink menu and train the bartender so he does not have to surf internet every time.

text:
A very disappointing visit to Mawalla Tangalle Taru Villas property. While our rooms were comfortable, the anticipated and considered service that we have experienced at many Taru Villa properties before was  gone. When we enquired after this we were told that the management had changed but kept the owner/founders name. The gardens, overall design of the property is beautiful however its very clearly not well looked after. A couple of 
- when we arrived there was no greeting, no introduction to room or property. we called our friends who had already arrived
- We had to ask the staff to replenish water in the vases. There was mosquitos breeding in all of them.  
- Drinks/glasses weren't cleared overnight unless we asked 
- Meal requests/Room Service orders were met with - "it will take some time" 
- breakfast (the only meal we had over 2 nights) was so disappointing. Simple, Sri Lankan food was lacking flavour. Tea/Coffee service - awful. 
- The service staff were very obliging, and while they weren't ever rude they have no idea what is going on. 
- The pantry/kitchenette areas in the stand alone villa and pool house had cockroaches. The kettle, caffetiere and coffee cups were not cleaned. The fridge smelled of old food.  
- there was a small snake near the kurumba house pool 
- toiletteries in the bathrooms were empty

While the property itself is beautiful, the rooms and particularly the service needs careful attention. At almost 300 usd a night this was no villa experience.
title: Well below expectations.
