ownerResponse/text:
Dear chrislondon2015,

We are saddened to read this review and taken aback by the harshness of it, considering no indication or mention of your dissatisfaction whatsoever was made by you or your partner at any point during your stay. We wish you had given us the chance to address the issue of noise disturbance from next door while you were staying with us, as we would have at least been able to move you to a different room/side of the property (or even another of our beach properties), away from the construction sounds, or asked the builders to restrict their activities to certain times of the day. Instead of this you chose to wait till you had returned home to email us your complaints and subsequently post this scathing review because you didn’t accept our offer of compensation, wanting a refund of your stay instead, and having first threatened in your email to us that you would be “warning” others by reviewing us online. 

Other guests who were staying around the same time period as you had no such complaints or concerns about building noise or the state of the bay/beach, for instance. Unfortunately flat seas and white sands are not to be found anywhere along the South and West coast during the Monsoon, not even at Rekawa, which you mentioned is lovely, and is just 15km away from our Mawella Bay. We wish to clarify that during this monsoon/ low season month of September, when our accommodation rates are lowest (and we believe to be excellent value for money, contrary to your view) the ocean tides deposit rubbish/flotsam & jetsam right along the Southern/Western coast, yet it bears mentioning that the photograph you have posted is not of our beach-front, but of another section of the bay/beach. We have a dedicated team of gardeners and staff that attend to our direct beach front year round to ensure that this area is kept clean for our guests. Regarding your other remark about our beach front, we would like you to know that the reason we have a chain-link fence is to keep out stray dogs and cattle that walk along the bay or come from the nearby village, which used to be a real problem for us. The reason we chose this material (which was not ‘cheap’ by any means) instead of building a wall or planting vegetation was to allow views of the ocean from the main villa. 

Regarding the construction noises from next door, you say you “raised this with the management” (yes, but a week after you had left us) who “told us clearly that they didn’t feel the need to warn their guests about the building noise”- this is misleading and untrue, as is your presumption that next door is a building site that will make Mawella “completely unenjoyable for some time to come”. 

Regarding your comment about our selection of wines, we would like to clarify that during this low season period, we stock three types of red and three white New World table wines, all of which are suitable for storage and consumption in the tropical humidity, along with beer and other beverages which are more suitable for this climate. We take your criticism on board however and intend to have at least two premium wines available during the High Season for our guests, so we thank you for that pointer. 

While we feel some of your statements are deliberately damaging and ignorant of facts (such as how long noise from the building work next door will continue for, or the price of lobster in the monsoon season) we understand that aesthetic tastes of style, design, layouts etc are highly subjective, and thus will not address your assessment of the same at Mawella- fortunately the majority of our guests & reviewers do not share your opinion. 

We wish to apologize for the genuine shortcomings in our service (eg that staff members offered different opinions of whether you could swim in the sea or not- for the record, the answer is always “if you practice caution & know your own limits”) and we are sorry to hear that our staff were not as proactive or helpful as you expected. Never before have we found a lack of fluency in English to be a sore point for any of Taru Villas guests- perhaps because we have visitors from many different backgrounds and nations (French German Portuguese Chinese etc)- but also because at all times we have an English speaking Manager and one or two service staff with adequate levels of English on duty. 

Yours Sincerely,
Team Taru Villas
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
First - it's not all bad.  The furnishings and décor are very tasteful indeed.  And they've got a good chef, the Sri Lankan food in particular is good (if expensive).  The main garden has some good old trees

The main thing to warn you about is the building noise.  There is a building site right next door (within a metre of their boundary), and our stay featured dull, heavy thuds every few seconds from before 0800 lasting all day, interspersed with the whine of saws and angle grinders.  Then some sort of festival or event with a booming sound system until 0500 (although this party, unlike the building noise, might have been a one-off).  We raised this with management who told us clearly that they do not feel they need to warn guests about this, even though they are marketing themselves as a luxury haven of relaxation.  The building works apparently stop and start, but were nowhere near finished when we were there in September 2017, I would expect noise and disruption for some time yet.  This is clearly unfortunate for Taru Villas, but they have chosen to make it their guests problem rather than theirs, no warnings, no chance to rebook, no discounted rates.  This was exacerbated by very poor soundproofing in our room (staff talking fairly quietly in the kitchen, for example carried clearly into our toilet - and presumably vice versa...).

The noise is a good enough reason to stay away, but it's by no means the only problem here.  

Whilst the interiors are luxurious, outside is really badly thought-out.  They have completely ruined the narrow sea view by fencing it off with a cheap chain-link fence and leaving a barren, square patch of compacted sand/soil with weeds in it (see photo).  I guess they might call it a 'private beach' but it looks like a forgotten car park.  It is one of the worst uses of an ocean frontage I've ever seen.  I've never been within 30 metres of the sea and felt so far from it.  Mawella Beach - although no fault of Taru's - was also properly filthy when we were there.  We tried to go for a walk but turned back after a few minutes, sick of wading through oil-stains too big to avoid (see photo).  This might be better in other seasons, but Mawella was horrid in September (Rekawa bit further up the coast, however, was still lovely).

Worth also mentioning Taru's obsession with 'privacy' (a selling point according to their promotional material).  What 'privacy' seems to mean is fussy little screens everywhere so nobody can see each other at dinner.  Never mind that in the communal pool you pretty much look into someone's living room.  Or that, as an open-plan complex of bungalows, it is never going to be anywhere near as private as somewhere that offers upper-storey rooms.  So they end up providing very little real privacy (esp. with noise) whilst making you unsure where is part of the communal grounds and where isn't.  Weird and confused.

Other problems:
- No reliable wifi connection, and staff gave conflicting instructions about which network to use and how to connect.
- Staff gave three different answers about whether you could swim in sea (yes, no, maybe).
- Excessively expensive seafood and alcohol (we expect a mark-up in a high-end place, sure, but lobster is cheaper in London!).  And if you're going to put that sort of mark-up on a wine list, please don't just have Jacobs Creek!
- Very tiny pool that had been badly over-chlorinated when we were there, pretty much had to glue my skin back on after a 20 min swim.
- Difficult to communicate with many staff, although they showed willing.  I'd never dream of raising this as a criticism on the street or in a low-medium range hotel.  But for somewhere that markets itself to the international luxury market, and there being no shortage of good English speakers in Sri Lanka...

So, overall, this was the worst part of a two-week holiday in Sri Lanka.  The noise would have spoiled it, but even without that I think Taru is some way off justifying its price point.  This place is spectacularly bad value.

But one star for somewhere that is generally trying (the poor staff have to don raincoats to sweep up leaves knocked down by rain)?  Too harsh? The problem for Taru is that there are plenty of mid-range places in Sri Lanka that are getting pretty much everything right.  Taru's offer is muddled and complacent, and the building noise and filthy beach will probably make it completely unenjoyable for some time to come.
title: Beware building noise late 2017! Muddled and overpriced anyway

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Chandra, 
While thanking you for your recognition of what we have tried to do right, this long review of yours is a misrepresentation of the truth. It must be answered for the sake of balance and veracity. Several aspects you have failed to mention, which shed new light on your story & allegations, as follows: You have acknowledged that you stayed with us first in early January (for 5 days) and you were evidently so pleased with the Taru Villas "product" and what we offer our guests, that you booked to return for a much longer period the very next month - to the latest property to be added to our portfolio, Mawella- recently upgraded from its earlier incarnation as a private residence. Because you wished to stay with us for a period of approx. 3 weeks, you negotiated a very discounted rate which we were happy to offer you because of the unusual length of your proposed stay. The one proviso being that you paid for it in advance. It is most certainly the practice not just at Taru Villas but in almost all small properties to take full payment on confirmation (no small hotel or villa worth its salt, will be naive enough to let a guest stay in credit for extended periods). This is considered good & usual hotelier practice in a sometimes dishonest world. Despite the very special rate you were staying for (including breakfast, services charge and all government taxes of approximately 24.3%, we refunded you the unused nights in full, sent you a gift and extended you courtesies & complementaries, both during and for the inconvenience at the end of your stay. We did not insist on applying our cancellation policies to your request for a refund. I believe it is wrong and inconsiderate to demand much more than that. It is also highly presumptuous to suggest that you would not have received your refund if you had not followed it up with your persistent calls, when you are clearly ignorant of the red tape and bureaucracy that must be addressed in order to have a local bank conduct a debit card refund to an international bank, despite conceding there were also bank holidays in the midst of this exercise! In our experience, 10 days is hardly unusual, even if not to be condoned. Further, out of a period of 21 days, your dissatisfaction and sudden decision to check out occurred on the 15th day of your second sojourn at Taru Villas. This alone speaks loudly to the lack of balance in your review (2 stars? a "poor" rating on TripAdvisor? Of course you are entitled to your review and rating, but I am also entitled to declare it undeserved.) You implored us to allow you to stay (in the Master Suite no less), despite us warning you of the inconvenience you may face in having to change rooms within the villa to accommodate prior bookings; you were even willing to check out of Mawella completely for a few days to accommodate a prior "whole villa" booking request by a private party (again which you had been apprised of while you negotiated your rates, before the booking confirmation).  You also opted to stay when we explained to you that we were facing some serious teething problems with the electrical systems in these first two months of operation, and that there would be inevitable power interruptions while we tried to fix the problem. And that, Mr. Chandra, I believe now makes for a more rounded representation of the facts.... I didn't even mention your penchant for visiting local shops/restaurants in the vicinity and bringing in meals to our villa, which is generally unacceptable in any small hotel establishment (our business at Taru Villas – Mawella is based on providing both board and lodging to our guests, not a private holiday home where you can bring in your own food- for that style of vacation we now have, for instance, Taru Villas – Kurumba right next door to Mawella, a small holiday home that you can rent and arrange your own meals and not have the services of a small hotel), this in spite of praising our in-house chef/kitchen and his quality of food. 
One can't "have one's cake and eat it too" Mr. Chandra.
Nayantara Fonseka (TARU)
placeInfo/address: Katuwenewatta, Moraketiara, Nakulugamuwa,, Morakatiyara 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived ar Taru villa Mawela in the afternoon to the sounds of the peacocks all around us. The main 4 bedroom villa is in a stunning location right on the beach. Just like the Rampart  street villa you could sense Taru's influence on the immaculate furnishings, very clean and tidy. We were not disappointed our large room was overlooking the ocean, "brilliant". We were here in January with a friend and when she left we rebooked for a longer stay in February. The staff here are the best we have encountered n the country including the Manager, the room boys and the chef was outstanding. They went out of their way to please the guests and they were genuinely very pleased to see us returning in February.
The problem with Taru villas is their  policy of insisting that you pay in full in advance for the accomodation including breakfast for the full duration of your booking. Then when you leave you pay for any outstanding extras that you may have had like drinks and any extra meals. They had no policy of refunding any monies to you if you had to curtail your stay in case of any unforeseen circumstances arising due to them.
The problem started when they started to install solar panels while they had guests staying at the time. They brought in an area  maintainance manager to undertake this and also to release the resident manager as he was called away due to a family member taken ill. This new manager was totally unprofessinional,rude and insulting. During this installation we had numerous electrical power cuts caused by the fuses blowing. Which meant that we had power cuts to our room on 2 consecutive nights.this affected 3 of the 4 rooms at the villa. It is no fun in this tropical heat and humid conditions even the locals were finding it very uncomfortable. An electrician attended to the fault but on the 3rd day the fuse to our room blew twice before we got into bed, we immediately gave notice to leave first thing the next morning. This was no holiday but an endurance test. This had nothing to do with power cuts in the Island as Taru villas have their own generator.
The next morning they were unable or did not know how to refund my money I had paid for the days I will not be staying due to the problem that they had caused. I had paid in full by my direct debit card and it is a very simple transaction for them to refund the money back to my account. Since they could not do this I asked for the cash equivalent, no they did not have the cash but they now insisted that I pay in full for the extras I have had which was a much smaller amount than what they owed me. I said that this was redidiculous, but they insisted that if I wanted the refund I would have to pay for the extras in full. We were so drained and tired by then and knew we had to find alternative accomodation nearby. So we paid by debit card on the understanding that they will refund the money owed within 2 to 3 days as it was a bank holiday.
As I suspected the money was not transferred to my bank as promised. I now had to chase them up with numerous phone calls to them and my bank. I spoke to theTaru villathe manager and he put me on to the head office district area manager, she in turn put me on to their firms accountant who then passed the responsibility to his bank. I wondered why am I chasing all these people when it is their responsibility ? I rang up the head office area district manager I had spoken to earlier and insisted I wanted to speak to Taru she said that Taru was abroad on business. A few days later I rang her up again this time she tells me that Taru is somewhere in the office but she cannot see her whereabouts but tells me that she would get Taru to ring me back. Since I did not get this call back I sent Taru a email to the head office but to this day I have not heard from her. I got my refund on the 10th day and I believe that if I had not persivered I may not have got the refund. Imagine if I had left the country it would have cost me an arm and a leg just on phone calls to chase these guys up.
What is astonishing is that they charged me in full for the 3 sleepless nights my wife and I had to endure. No compensation was offered nor given. It is even sadder that I believe that Taru is not aware of these events taking place and it is shocking that the middle management team of a boutique villa can act in this way.  I urge all future potential customers not to pay in full, pay a deposit to secure your booking and settle up at the end of your stay to avoid any similar incidents.
.
title: You do not get what you paid for

text:
For the first time ever...as experienced world wide travellers ,this hotel did not honour a booking.com reservation we made some 15 days before.

However we were then told they were sorry but the booking clerk had failed to book us ....and worse still they had a  group arriving later ..and no room for us.

We asked to speak to clerk but she was said to be unavailable!!!
This was despite us arriving on time tired and hungry from UK having booked half board. 
The mistake was made before we arrived but no one simply messaged or rung us.
That is inexcusable..we then had to scramble to find a room at height of season 

We have NO explanation refund of taxi  or apology 
Only reception staff sorry and embarrassed

The hotel put the profit of group booking of 8 before two upset British ladies
We just want to warn others who may arrive alone or worse still middle of the night 
I did cry at one point which should not be the start to long haul holiday 

SRI LANKA AND THE LOVELY LOCAL PEOPLE HAVE BEEN SO LOVELY SINCE  BUT CASSANDRA COULD HAVE SPOILT EVERTHING

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid having your meals there although it is hard to do.
text:
First the good things: the setting is lovely (although hard to get to on a very bumpy road so you can't easily get away from it, say to get a good meal); the pool area lovely and the rooms well-appointed, many with a nice view.

Now the bad: the food is very poor, pretty much an insult and it left us hungry at the end. I cannot fathom how there can be so many positive comments about the food on this site. This is no doubt one of the worst meals we have had in our lives and we eat pretty much anything. I cannot understand how it is possible to prepare such a bland, tasteless meal in a country so full of wonderful ingredients, spices and taste. I'm terrified that we will have to go through this experience again tomorrow as we're here for another day and there are no alternatives around. Really, really disappointing. I would definitely not recommend this to anyone who enjoys good food and considers good meals an important part of the holiday experience.
title: Terrible food in an otherwise nice place.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
To start of, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable. But, the WiFi doesnt work, at 
least in our room at the end of the hallway. The menu, in this land with beautiful food, is full of pasta, pizza and burgers and the buffet, although having some local dishes, just didn’t look great. Our room wasn’t cleaned as nobody has told us we need to ‘sign the board’ if you  want your room cleaned. And, while I type this, a party is blearing to us from the restaurant area on  a Friday evening at midnight. It feels like we are on one of them all inclusive resorts with entertainment teams.  NOT what we signed up for, not what you would expect from a luxury ‘culture resort’.
title: Not what you would expect from a luxury culture resort.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa Kimbissa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Was supposed to stay here in January having had the property booked for over 4 months. Received an email the evening before we were due to arrive advising they had unforeseen problems with our room due to bad weather and that we could not stay there. They advised they could look at other hotels but provided no further information on this... Bearing in mind we were due to arrive in 12 hours we took it upon ourselves to book our own alternative arrangements. The weather in Sigiriya at the time was absolutely fine and interestingly enough they were still selling rooms on various booking sites after spinning this classic line. I think it was a classic case of overbooking and rather than owning up and offering a proper solution they took the cowardly route and blamed the weather whilst providing no helpful solutions. Avoid at all costs unless you want to have to rearrange your trip at the last minute. Ended up staying at Hotel Sigiriya which was fantastic and where we received proper service.
title: Poor Communication, Poor Service, Poor Excuses

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the guests recent experience at Ubuntu Beach Villas by Lantern. 

The Villa was not aware that guests had requested for an Ocean Room with Bath at the time of check-in. Guests were checked-in to the room around 4.00pm and around 5.30pm guests had called the reception and informed that they require a room with a bathtub. 

The Executive Housekeeper who was available on duty immediately visited the villa and attempted to speak to the guests and explain. Guests insisted on  speaking to the Duty Manager. The Duty Manager was on a break, but upon notifying he reached the Villa within 15 minutes. The Duty Manager explained to guests that all rooms with baths were sold out and the hotel did not pre-reserve a room with a bath as prior request was not made.

The Ubuntu Beach Villas by Lantern consists of 4 Ocean View Rooms with Bath, 4 Ocean Rooms without bath in addition to its 8 Courtyard rooms. Since all rooms with baths were occupied, we arranged an upgrade to a suite at Lantern Boutique Hotel which is over U$ 100 per night, twice the size and more luxurious.

Guests declined the offer and requested for a refund. It is a common practice internationally for all guests to pay at the time of check-in. If guests wished to change the hotel, cancellation charges would have applied.

Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 53A Galle Road, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81740 Sri Lanka
text:
I would like to share my experience of why we had to leave this hotel and of the 5 hours we spent there waiting to speak to the manager and then arguing with him, I want to be fair because the hotel looks nice and clean, however this is not the way you treat your guests, so there you go:  

1. When we arrived, they sent us to a different building a few minutes away from the main building by tuk tuk which wasn´t explained in the advert. If you want breakfast or dinner you must go there. 

2. As soon as you get there, when you do the check in, you have to pay for your stay before you see your room, and here was my mistake. 

3. We booked the Ocean View Room. The description and the photos showed that the room had a nice bathtub however the room they gave it to us didn´t have it. We complained but the duty manager had a 2 hour break so we had to wait fa full 2 hours until he came back to find a solution. 

4. After 2 hours he confirmed that they didn´t have any rooms with a bath left and there nothing they could do about it so we decided to leave however they said that they couldn´t give us the money back. They showed us another room but it wasn´t what we booked so we argued for another 2 hours, they laughed at us and made us feel really uncomfortable. The duty manager didn´t speak very good English so he had to tell someone else to translate. It was a nightmare...

5. In the end I phoned the website where I booked the hotel and thank God they helped us and find another place to stay and arranged everything to fix this mess. 

6. To be fair, the hotel looks nice and clean, just make sure you check what you booked and see the room before to avoid this situation. The information is not clear in the advert and the staff should be more professional when situations like this come up, guests shouldn´t feel uncomfortable.
title: Misleading advert

text:
We went here on a recommendation from where we were staying. They billed us for the most expensive gin, even though I asked for a different one, but my main gripe is how they charge customers. 

We stayed in five different places in Sri Lanka. Everywhere said their 20% government charge was included in the price. Fair enough. Not here though. They state their prices in US Dollars on the menu then ADD 20% after PLUS the usual 10% service charge. So u end up paying 30% more on ur bill.

I found this under handed and sneaky. They say it states it on the menu. So fair enough, but make sure u take a magnifying glass to see it. It's that small u can't even read it on the Internet! 

AVOID!!!
title: Rip off and sneaky. AVOID!!!

text:
Made a reservation for Ubuntu by Lantern on the 14th of September 2016. I booked two rooms for the 31st of December. Received confirmation. All set, or so I thought. 
On the 10th of October I received an email from the hotel notifying us that there was a compulsory buffet dinner and like it or not we had to fork out an additional $260 for this. We were rather perplexed by this late condition. We pointed out that we had already made dinner/party plans for the evening. Furthermore our group included two vegetarians. We were bluntly informed that there was no choice in the matter. At this late stage we were out of options for accommodation elsewhere. The rooms were nice enough for the price we paid. This executive decision certainly left a bitter after taste and simply reflects very poorly on the owners and management. We were notified more than a month after we received confirmation of our booking. There are much nicer and better run properties in Mirissa.
title: Unprofessional and unethical

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Karan,

Several elements of your experience were explained to you at the hotel when you first discussed this with us.  Being a heritage building, we have severe restrictions on what can and cannot be done to the building.  That being said, you were offered an opportunity to move rooms on the day you arrived, which you turned down "because you didn't want to deal with the stairs", despite having to use stairs to reach the room you had booked.

The Grand Apartment Suite which is the one across from you, is connected by a sitting room, which, unless used, insulates you from any sound coming from the room itself.  We cannot account for sound coming from the property next door, however.

Lastly, the cancellation policy was made very clear prior to booking, and was the reason that no refund was offered.  Your original reason for leaving was the lack of exhaust fan in the bathroom.  When we explained that the cancellation policy would still apply, then other "issues" came to light.

We are sorry that your experience was not what you had hoped for, but this matter has been dealt.  We hope the rest of your travels around Sri Lanka were more to your liking.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I came here hoping to have a relaxed getaway. We wanted to enjoy the Galle area and had read the wonderful online reviews.
We stayed in "The Grand Apartment"at Galle Fort Hotel. What they don't tell you anywhere in The advertising and booking is the fact that the room is connected to another room and everything that's going on in the next room is very very audible...
The bathroom has no ventilation. It is suffocating to use the bathroom.
At night, the lights from outside light up the interior of the room and it's impossible to sleep in a dark room (picture attached)
We had booked the room for 4 nights but we decided to check out within the first day.
The management refused to even partially refund the amount and retained the entire amount for the 4 nights. Absolute theft.
I would be understanding if they retained the amount for 1-2 nights but for all 4 nights??
Extremely unreasonable management and theft in the name of heritage.
title: Disappointing room and management experience

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Urs,

We are sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay at The Galle Fort Hotel.  The trouble with a 400 year old Unesco Heritage building is that we have immense restrictions on what we are able to do, structurally, that don't disrupt the integrity of the property.  This does mean, however, that wooden ceilings which are also wooden floors can be disruptive if the room above is occupied, and the other guests have early starts for activities like whale watching or flights to catch.  We are currently working with the Galle Heritage Foundation on the best way to resolve this, without going against their rules.

I also presume by "large holes in the carpet, torn curtains", that you are referring to the mosquito nets that hang from the bed itself (as a precaution against any mosquitoes that might be present), and the original panel rugs that cover the top canopy of the bed, as we have no curtains in any of our rooms.  Certainly the floor carpet, recently purchased, doesn't have holes.

With regards to breakfast, you requested, and were given, multiple meals by the team, so perhaps waiting for all those plate to come made it seem chaotic?  I apologise for the worn menu cards we had to give you, as we waited on our supplier to print the new ones, but we have them now, so that won't be an issue going forward.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is marketed as a historic luxury hotel. We had booked a suite for about 600 USD per night for 2 nights. At first glance, the hotel has a lot of charm and is also well located. Would we recommend the hotel? No way, never!  This for the following reasons …
Rooms are extremely poorly insulated, you can hear every word and every step of your neighbors. For us, both nights were over by 05:30. The room ( a 600 USD Suite!) was neglected (e.g. large holes in the carpet, torn curtains 
 etc.)
The breakfast service was always chaotic, the menu cards dirty and worn.
 Stay away from this hotel, the hotel next door Galle Fort Bazaar seems to be a much better option in every way.
title: Overpriced and definitely NOT a luxury hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

We are sorry that the room you viewed online, with images of the layout, views and furnishings, prior to making your booking, was not what you expected, with the "tasteless furniture" that is true to the colonial heritage of a nearly 400 year old building.  Your disappointment was noted at the time of check in, and an alternative room offered to you, which you chose not to take.  This matter was dealt with, on site, in line with our policies and the booking terms that you would have been aware of prior to making the booking, and clearly explained to you at the time.  We hope you enjoy the rest of your Sri Lankan travels.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Großen Bogen machen. Es gibt genügend bessere und günstigere Hotels in Galle
text: Gute Lage schlecht geführt. Preisleistung stimmt überhaupt nicht. Die Beschreibung der Zimmer stimmt nicht. Zimmer dunkel, ohne Fenster, weder Ausblick noch Terrasse. Terrasse soll die Restaurantterrasse sein. Geschmackloses Mobiliar. Man würde heim einchecken gleich wieder gehen.
title: Gute Lage, schlecht geführt. Beschreibung stimmt nicht. Preisleistung nicht gerrechtfertigt

ownerResponse/text:
Good afternoon Lin,

Thank you for letting us know how disappointed with your stay you were.  

Whilst your experience definitely left you with a bitter taste in your mouth, and there were some communication issues at the time, one of your rooms WAS ready at 13:30, and the other room was in fact ready at 14:05, and the staff agreed with you that check ins would be done simultaneously after lunch.  At this time, you made the request that the luggage be put in the rooms in the interim, which was done.  Usually, we put the luggage in the room after the guests have been shown to the room, so that we can put the luggage in an area that suits them; leaving the cases downstairs made sense at the time.  Going forward, we will of course put the luggage near the beds instead.

Your lunch was, unfortunately, delayed somewhat due to a group of 26 that was dining at the same time, and the kitchen was trying to ensure that they all got their meals together at the same time.  We apologise for not being able to get your meals out at the same time.

We do apologise unreservedly for the delay at breakfast the following morning, however; there was a communication breakdown between our kitchen and service teams, which resulted in your meal taking longer than it should have.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Air conditioning in bedroom is placed to blow directly onto the bed.
text:
We arrived at 1.30 and were told our rooms would be ready at 2.00. That was fine, we knew we were early. At 2.00 we were told they were still not ready so decided to have lunch. We ordered three bowls of soup and one salad. It was 45 minutes before the food arrived. During that time no member of staff apologized or even looked vaguely concerned. Our room was a loft suite with the bed and wardrobe upstairs. The luggage was left downstairs!
The following morning we waited thirty minutes for two bowls of granola and yoghurt. The service in this hotel is not poor, it is non existent  and nobody seems to care
title: Non existent service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Siglo,

Compliments of the season, and thank you for sharing your thoughts.  I will take them up with the kitchen team and do a thorough retest of the various flavours, as they absolutely should be authentic, and are definitely not "watered down".  Sri Lankan food is not specifically "spicy" hot, per se, but it does have a variety of different spice flavours, all affected by the region a dish comes from, and we try to respect those regions by recreating their dishes authentically.  If we are missing that mark, and the food is not spicy hot enough, guests can always request housemade chilli or fresh chillies to add to their meals.

However, it's good to know that for you, we didn't get it right, and we can make the necessary changes to sort this out.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
My review is not about the hotel, but its restaurant

Its located in the hotel and overlooks the room blocks and the swimming pool. At dinner, the ambiance was beautiful and relaxing. 

The menu for dinner had a selection of starters. The main courses were divided into a section suggesting that dishes were from specific parts of Sri Lanka and another section with straightforward mains. The starters were good. We ordered 3 different mains to be shared. The portions were only good for one person and not enough to be shared. We should have been better advised by the waiter. 

And the main courses were bland. Despite being advised by the waiter that they would be spicy. Sri Lankan food is great. But the ones produced here are bland and a very poor representation of Sri Lankan flavours. Perhaps they have been watered down to suit the Western palates. If so, let the patrons know so that we can request for Sri Lankan authentic flavours

I would not recommend this restaurant for its food.
title: Lovely Ambiance at Restaurant but if its Sri Lankan flavours that you’re looking for, then this is not the place

ownerResponse/text:
Good afternoon Priscilla,

Compliments of the season.  

I'm so sorry to read of your frustrations with booking accommodation for your family at the Galle Fort Hotel. 

That said, we ABSOLUTELY do welcome families with children.  However, given the age and design of the property, there will be certain rooms that we prefer not to allocate to families with small children, due to safety concerns.  We also have a limited number of rooms, aside from those, which can accommodate extra beds, and still provide you enough space as a family.  If those rooms are not available, you would have been advised that we would not have been able to accommodate you in the rooms that were available on your chosen dates.

If you would still like to stay with us, you can reach us through the email address on our website, and we will be happy to assist you wherever possible.

Yours sincerely,
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid if you are a family, you will not be welcome
text:
We were looking forward to staying in Galle Port hôtel. 
We are guilty of having 3 kids so we called them directly to book 2 rooms, asking for a baby cot as well.
We were told no rooms could accommodate us and no additional beds could be put except in the library suite (68sqm) but not on the other suites (some bigger).
After rechecking the hotel site and wasting an hour trying to understand we called the hotel again.

At the end we were just clearly told that it is the hotel policy not to accommodate families and kids.

Very disappointing.
At least they should be honest and indicate the hotel as adults only on their website.
But I guess that in off season they are happy to take the money from families....

There are many other nice hotels around, so if you are a family...go somewhere else !
title: Families and kids not welcome!

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning JosieJoan,

I'm so sorry to hear that your stay is not to your liking.  We are more than happy to adjust the volume of the music for those who ask it, and can do a dinner table for you directly outside your room if you like, where any live music is less likely to disturb you.  If there's anything else we can do for you during your stay, please let me know?
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel room was not what we expected. Very small and cramped for 2 people. Hotel full so could not move rooms. Not suitable for 2 nights at all.
Dinner very slow service.
Live music was so loud you could not talk to your partner . After asking the second night will be the same too!
 Very very disappointed with the whole stay.
Had some lovely hotels as we travelled round sri Lanka but this is not one of them

Not a good send off back to America it has left a bad memory.
One more night to go!
title: Disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Bronwyn,

Unfortunately, we have no record of you having stayed with us, so it's likely that this review is meant for another establishment.  Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is in a very old building built by the Dutch. Our room was very narrow and very dark and gloomy with very little natural light. The bathroom was tiny and the shower needed a good clean. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights - we would have moved out after the first night, however we had pre-paid via our travel company - that was the only reason we stayed. The hotel has an open air restaurant/bar very close to the rooms and it played live music until around midnight each of the nights we were there. The music was really terrible quality and very loud so we got little sleep. The bathroom for the restaurant had no soap or hand towels or hand dryer. The food was very ordinary quality however the portions were generous. For breakfast, you had to serve yourself tea and coffee from an urn. I do not recommend this hotel.
title: Loud live music every night

ownerResponse/text:
Good morning Mihiri,

We are devastated that the meal you experienced was not the one you expected.  Your feedback has been invaluable to us, however, and we have strived to make substantial changes to the menu itself and the way we do things, and have had great feedback from locals and foreigners alike since, so your poor meal has been a catalyst for change.

If you are ever this side again and would be willing to give us a second chance, please contact us and ask for me directly, and I will be glad to assist you in any way I can.
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Lovely location and setting but poor quality food & drinks.
text:
We (18 pax) had prebooked the place for dinner based on the menu. Sadly this was one of the worst meals & services we had in Galle. Food which was over priced was insipid . Some meals were sent back as they were just loaded with coconut milk was brought back with a truck load of chillie flakes saying it was re-made to be "spicy" . Not edible!  Eg; Noodle bowl with chicken & the veg version, Babath(tripe) - 0/10 for taste & appearance. Pork chop was a super thin slice, not close to a "chop" !!!  Cocktails with fancy names were so watered down with mediocre starters. They were heavily short staffed as it was just one person attending to everyone. If one is to do a Sri Lankan menu, let be Sri Lankan with a twist  (Tasteless food is not a reflection of a Sri Lankan meal for anyone!!).   

The following day the staff & manager did apologize but it is not a place any of us would go again nor recommend, based on our experience .
title: Worst meal in Galle

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Linus, 

Thank you for this review and the feedback given. We are truly sorry that you had a negative experience on your visit and we want to make this up to you.
We have taken appropriate steps to ensure that our staff is trained in the products on offer and to make all transactions seamless and transparent. I would like to get more details about your negative experience that happened on that day in order to learn from our mistakes. Please feel free to contact me via email at rm@galleforthotel.com 

I will be delighted to host you for drinks at the verandah when you next return.

Chamara Dedduwage
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The service offered was unexpectedly dishonest from what was otherwise a beautiful hotel. . We go cheated. We stopped for drinks this afternoon and I ordered a gin and tonic. I asked for a Monkey47, but was served some other ordinary gin. Had to pay Rs 2000 for some cheap gin. Just to warn that you make sure you got what you asked for at the start. This is not the time for hotels to cheat on their customers.
title: Linus Sweden

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Moji Negro

Thank you for your review and feedback on your experience at Galle Fort Hotel 

We fully accept that your one stop experience with us was not a sensational one and as a result we suffer a poor review and its consequences. 
However I must add that we have had a mixed bag of reviews since we started to roll it out we are improving both the quality and service to our guests each day. and as this was an experience in the beginning of the year which was a really busy period and we have adjust all areas that none of these issues will repeat again and as you can see all other comments we get are in good status for our service provided . 

I thank you for your review; regret the poor experience you had but I am confident our service will add enjoyment and pleasure to others visiting the Fort in the future.

Thanks & Regards 
Dennam Spittel
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't stop here for a drink on the veranda unless you have a lot of time to waste!
text:
After quite a long, humid day walking around the forte we decided to stop for a cold drink with our driver.  The service was terrible and slow.  We waited a long time for our drinks and then our bill.  In the end we approached the counter to pay our bill and the male waiter was clearly not happy but we couldn’t afford anymore time to wait!

If this is anything to go by I wouldn't stay in the hotel.
title: Only stopped for a drink and that was enough to experience the poor service!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Burnie
,

Clearly the Galle Fort Hotel did not meet your expectations during your stay and it was marred by some regrettable and most unfortunate incidents. It is not the way we conduct our business as is apparent with our other reviews.I believe your main contention with us was the room that was allocated to you. This was in fact an upgrade from the junior suite you booked on the request of your travel agent. They were aware of the layout of the room and in fact should have briefed you before you checked in.

In addition I also want to address a few of your other complaints;
We are a tropical country and it is to be expected that there would be some form of flies, especially in the heat.
The black spots you mentioned on the wall of the shower area is in fact stone chips that is part of the terrazzo wall.
Again, the dinner that you claim was very expensive, was booked by your Travel Agent. I'd like to add that given it was a 7 course special dinner, during the peak of the festive season, the price paid was quite reasonable, especially if you compare other options around the fort.

It is also regrettable that you used foul language on my staff, which was uncalled for and caused an unnecessary spectacle with all the other guests around.

It is very clear that you have had issues with your agent here, but taking it out on the hotel is not very nice.

However, I do hope the rest of your trip was good and that your family had an enjoyable time in Sri Lanka.

Dennam Spittel
Resident Manager 
Galle Fort Hotel
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pot luck. Even booking 2 rooms 12 months in advance, we were unable to get a room with a bath (as promised).
text: 2 of our party of 4 adults were "upgraded" to the loft room. Double bed upstairs and an open staircase leading to toilet and shower downstairs - both dingy, with black flies. Only washbasin was in a cupboard in the "lounge" (toilet and shower too small to accommodate a basin). We immediately complained to the manager, and asked to move to another room, but he said it was our fault because our travel agent had agreed to the "upgrade" and they were full. Very angry as the hotel had insisted we stay there 2 nights, with the second night including a very expensive New Year's Eve meal. Stayed in 5 hotels in Sri Lanka and this was the worst and most expensive.
title: Mixed Room Quality

ownerResponse/text:
Dear |MPL1

Thank you for posting your review of your Pre drinks experience with us and I accept that we fell well short of your expectations.
Clearly from your feedback we have to up the ante on quicker service and offer a better quality product. This has been immediately addressed. I have no doubt that as we move forward pre drinks at the bar will become a feature of visiting GFH and its service standards greatly improved from those which you regrettably experienced.
As to my knowledge all who have stayed with us have not made any comment as such and they have highly enjoyed their stay with us which the followed comments below proves it ! the staff strength of the hotel have been  balance accordingly with the season . 

Once again thank you very much for sharing your feed back with us 

Thanks & Regards 
Dennam Spittel
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We decided to have pre-dinner drinks at this very beautiful hotel. The waiter ushered us to a table and quickly brought the drinks menu...it took another 15 minutes for someone to come and take our order. The drinks took another 10 minutes to arrive and quite frankly were a joke...they were so watered down! So we decided not to waste any more time...explained what had happened and just wanted to pay and leave. And we were made to wait again...and no apology. In a country where typically there are plenty of staff, it was surprising to see only 2 people doing the waiting on as well as making the drinks! And certainly without the attitude usual in Sri Lankan hospitality. I feel sorry for the people who come to stay here.
title: Terrible place to have a drink

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sarah,

Thank you so much for your feedback. We are scheduled for a refurb in the next few months and can assure you all your concerns will be addressed.

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Visited 7 years ago and it has changed Mangement and seems not a penny spent on it since then. 

Library suite no bed side lights, broken bathroom light, no covers on bare bulbs in bathroom, black mould in shower, dirty under beds. 

Garden Room 1 - toilet broken and despite being asked to fix 3 Times still not working. 

Just needs some work as all a bit tired. Such a beautiful building it’s a shame. 

Breakfast service on day one unbelievably slow while 3 members of staff sat in office oblivious. One of them actually having his breakfast!!

Manager, if there is one, needs to do some retraining with staff as they are nice but unhelpful and so slow. Service not included which is a good thing.
title: Used to be good.

placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: My husband, I, and our 11 year old daughter attempted to make a reservation at this hotel this week.  We phoned the hotel while in Sri Lanka, explained the size of our party and the age of our daughter.  We were told that even thought there were rooms available  none could accodmate us, save, one, and  offered a grand apartment suite.  We called back to confirm the reservation, having cancelled another hotel reservation in country only to have be informed that we could no longer have a reservation.  We were told that we must have lied or misrepresented ourselves (we most certainly did not) because the room we’d been offered wasn’t available to a family with a child, even one of an older age.  We were further chastised and lectured that as a “heritage” property the hotel feared that children would damage the premises we were not welcomed.  Funnily enough our daughter has been welcomed at heritage properties around the globe with far more significant art collections, and antiques; she is hardly a hooligan.  Clearly this hotel does not welcome all guests seeking to enjoy Sri Lanka’s culture and history, and is happy to leave potential guests hanging on their whims.  When we asked to speak to a manager to see if anything could be done we were told the manager didn’t return phone calls.  Sadly we will  be bypassing Galle; if you are looking to explore Sri Lanka-we recommend it, but please tread carefully where this property is concerned. My issues isn’t with the policy it is with the extremely poor communication and rudeness of staff.
title: Misrepresentation and a Failure to Take responsibility

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Judy,

Thank you for the feed back.

We are due for a complete refurb soon and I am sure all your concerns will be addressed.

Kind regards,

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Not a Loft Suite
text: We were booked in here for two days but checked out immediately. We had reserved a Loft Suite, which looked gorgeous on the photos, but these do not give an accurate impression. The bed is on a mezzanine, reached by a polished wood spiral staircase that has no handrail on the lower half, and the sheer drop presents real health and safety issues, particularly for the less mobile. There is also no modern bathroom - a primitive shower and toilet are located in the sitting room, neither is tiled, and there was damp on the plaster in the one in our suite. We felt the whole place needed upgrading to meet the standards of luxury advertised. We stayed in some lovely heritage properties in Sri Lanka, but this was unfortunately not one of them. Heritage should not mean neglected. This may have been top quality once but no longer fulfils its potential. Management were charming and accommodating despite our sorry experience.
title: Does not live up to its reputation

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Darren,

I am truely sorry you feel that we are dodgy and deceiving.

I have your bill in front of me and have gone through all your points and all the extras you mention above. They are all on your bill and you have signed it? I believe that the card machine was not working that day and that's why we insisted on cash. It is company policy that all bills are settled before the guest checks out. I do wish you had brought up these concerns with us at the time and before you signed your bill.

Kind regards,

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I have visited Sri Lanka at least 10 times now for business and leisure since 1999. I have never had issues and always found the people to be welcoming, friendly and honest!
I have admired the Galle Fort hotel since its opening and had always promised myself a stay when the opportunity arose. On a return trip to India my family and I decided to call into Sri Lanka and visit this hotel among others! A short break that we where very much looking forward to.
On first impressions the hotel itself is gorgeous and certainly lived up to expectations.
Whilst checking into our room I enquired about extending our stay another night. The gentleman ( who gave the impression of Manager.. Prattesh.or similar???) advised that he would come back to our room to advise if an extension was possible. Approx 20 minutes later Prattesh advised that we could extend however we would need to pay him cash for the extension. I then enquired if we could upgrade our room to one of the larger apartments on the top floor. Prattesh again left our room and later returned, advising that we could upgrade however again we would need to pay cash directly to him to do so...in our room!! ( a very unfamiliar process for a hotel ). After checking into the larger apartment we paid the considerable figure in cash directly to Prattesh without receipt from him!! On doing so we requested a late check out to assist with our late flight out from Colombo which he agreed would be 2pm.
On the day of our departure we met Prattesh in the morning at breakfast following his one days leave. He advised me that unfortunately we would need to leave the hotel room by 11am due to other bookings...which was not the arrangement agreed.
We packed promptly and left for another hotel for day use feeling very disgruntled, let down and annoyed at the operations of the Hotel management.
Unfortunately in haste i left my new Apple wireless EarPods in the room. When I returned to Australia I contacted the Hotel and spoke with Prattesh and discussed the return of my Ear/Air pods. He advised that they had found them and would return them via post. I offered to pay for all costs however was advised that they would be returned. Unfortunately 3 weeks later i had not received them so I contacted the Hotel and spoke with the Western GM and had the same discussion. He advised me that this would be addressed and he would notify me of associated costs. Unfortunately now almost 3 months later I have had no contact or no headphones as promised!!! Extremely poor, dishonest, inadequate and disappointing service from a hotel of this standard! I will not recommend this hotel to anyone due to our very poor experience!! Such a shame and a sham for something with so much potential!
( i find it necessary to compliment all other general staff at this Hotel and their service and friendliness! )
title: Beautiful property let down by decieving, dodgy management

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Flub55,

I am so sorry for your experience at the hotel. This is not our normal standard and thank you for bringing our short comings to our attention.

Yours sincerely,

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We read up the rough guide and turned up fir pre dinner drinks  and planned to stay to eat as the dining area looked inviting. What a disappointment. Having ordered we sat fir 20 minutes then realised they had lost our drinks order as others around us were served. After we complained nothing was done to bring our drinks so we left. We had planned to stay fir dinner but  there are lots of lovely places and this  one needs to sort out it’s service
title: Ignored

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Maggie C,

Thank you for your criticism of our establishment and I am truly sorry that you have been left with a poor image of us. 

I have looked into your complaint and it turns out that you were not a guest of the hotel and were in fact seated next door at Fort Bazaar but ordering drinks from us as they do not have a liquor license. As I am sure you are aware we are in the busiest time of the year here in the fort. The staff here do not normally serve people outside of the hotel and this must have been a favour to you. I am sure you can understand serving people in a different premises would create some issues.

As for the price being double. I have your bill in front of me and you ordered 2 x glasses of Chardonnay, 1 x Lion Lager & 1 x Gin & Tonic coming to a total of Rs3,915 or US$26 roughly.

I hope that when you leave reviews like this you do think about the people whose livelihood will be affected by your harsh words. 

I hope you have a great year ahead,

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Do not use this bar, we had 2 rounds of drinks which we had had most evenings in different places, this place did not give us a bill & charged twice as much as all the other places! The only time we have felt ripped off in Sri Lanka.
title: Ripped Off

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mgallach2017,

Thank you for bringing these problems forward. I do apologise that you had to wait for your drinks for so long and that the waiter splashed water on the floor next to you. We have no excuse for it and I do appologise. I have disciplined the relevant staff member as this is not acceptable at all.

With regard to the cats we are currently trying to relocate them but because there are so many living in the fort it is a very long process. We, as you know, are completely open to the road and do not have anyway to block the cats from the premises. I am truly sorry that your wife’s allergies to the cat forced you to leave the premises early.

I do hope that you come back soon and we can make it up to you,

Dustin
placeInfo/address: 28 Church Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Can't comment on rooms only visited restaurant
text: Booked the restaurant at this hotel to celebrate a 60th birthday. The ambience was good but that's where it ended. We ordered pre dinner cocktails which took 40 mins to be served. Many other customers complaining about length of time to be served also.  Shown to table ordered a bottle of Chablis which was delivered in an ice bucket full of water which the waiter spilled all over the floor and made no attempt to clean up. After ordering meal a cat appeared under the table we made two requests to have the cat removed as my wife has a severe allergy to cats, by the time starter arrived there were 3 cats we called the head waiter who said that the cats were not the hotels problem and shrugged his shoulders. We asked to speak to the manager who was as helpful as his ill mannered staff. We decided to leave as conditions were unacceptable, but before we left we were presented with a bill of RS 16560 (£82), this being for the cocktails, which were good and for the wine and starters which we hadn't even tried. We have travelled the world and eaten in many restaurants but never come across anything like this. So disappointed!!!
title: Travelled the world worst experience ever!!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re genuinely sorry to hear that your afternoon tea experience did not meet your expectations. Your comments on the quality and variety have been noted, and we will certainly review them with our culinary team to ensure improvements are made. We appreciate your honest observations, and while we regret that we missed the mark on this occasion, we hope to have the opportunity to offer you a better experience in the future.

Ayubowan ! (May you live long) 

Dilip Kumar 
General Manager 
Jetwing St. Andrew's
placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I do not recommend going here for afternoon tea. My recent visit was the worst afternoon tea I have ever had. The savouries were unpleasant (some were stale), the macaroons were so overcooked and dry, there were no tea options (extraordinary in an area known for tea!).
We went to the Grand Hotel for a drink and saw their afternoon tea which looked far superior (of course I did not taste it but those eating it said it was lovely).
I recommend avoiding St Andrew’s and going to the Grand Hotel for a far more enjoyable experience.
title: Do not waste your money on a high tea here

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Chambres de style anglais mais très très ancien.Mauvaise literie et salle de bain à refaire. Radiateur électrique en mauvais état. Du charme au détriment du confort.
La maison de style anglais ainsi que le jardin sont à voir . La bouteille d'eau au repas est payante . Attention, les employés ont tendance à faire les commentaires à votre place
title: Passez prendre un verre, le cadre vaut le détour

roomTip: Find a different hotel.
text: This hotel is trading on a past reputation which if it was ever justified is long gone.  Superficially it looks old and charming, but stay here and you can experience very slow service in the restaurant, mediocre food, but worst of all the paper thin walls that mean you can hear all the crying babies, screaming kids and TVs and conversations from all your neighbours. If you did manage to get to sleep don’t worry you will be woken in the middle of the night by the amplified Fajr call to prayer from the nearby mosque. There is also black mold in the bathroom no doubt because there is no extractor or other form of ventilation to the bathroom. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.
title: Don’t stay here

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
BIG WARNING!!
The hotel staff steal your money from the room!!
We were a group of 12 people and we stayed only one night. They went through all of our rooms while we were having dinner, right after our check-in. They were waiting for us to leave the rooms, they just skipped the room where a girl from the group was in there. And they took just a few of the large bills (but more than 1500$ in total), so you wouldn't notice the money was gone. We noticed the next day, when we were in a different town. And we went to the police, but they said we can only press charges in the same town it happened and we have to go to court and we have to stay in Sri Lanka for at least a week after (and we didn't have so much time), but we could tell the hotel and the police were trying to make us not press the charges. They said they can't do anything about it. They just didn't care about it at all. Please be careful at any hotel in Sri Lanka, it's like they help them steal. Keep your money safe. This was premeditated, they even stole the data from a card and made a payment with Google Pay.
title: BIG WARNING!!

roomTip: Ask about the construction work before booking! Get a room on the sunny side of the building (front side).
text: Beautiful old house and nicely decorated rooms inside. Breakfast buffet was a highlight too. Staff and service also great, but I wish they had mentioned the construction work going on when I booked at the front desk!Throughout the day you hear drilling and scraping and workers were even on my balcony while I was laying in bed (works start at 8:30am). Honestly, for the price you pay, it’s an insult. They should not be charging full price as long as construction works are going on. Or at least offer guests complementary dinner! Failing to warn the guests at check-in and charge the full price (!) is the worst customer service, especially from such a renowned establishment as Jetwing. Very disappointed, since the house itself is lovely.
title: Overpriced for what you get esp while loud construction works ongoing

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay somewhere else, or if you must stay, avoid the wildly expensive buffet.
text:
I was really looking forward to staying in this hotel in ‘Little England’, but unfortunately it was not a good experience. 

The reviews that the rooms are tired are all true, our shower filled our bathroom up and the whole thing was quite grimy and dated. 

Corridors contained piles of dirty plates, which I can only assume attracts pests. 

Unless you get a lift somewhere, there are no options to eat nearby. The in-house buffet was the lowest quality of our entire stay - and came in at a massive $25 per person. This of course being the ‘foreign tourist price’. I was that taken aback I took a photo of the bill to check if it was a mistake. All reception could do is laugh (presumably whilst they count the dollar bills!).

If you’re staying in ‘Little England’, stay somewhere else.
title: Little England, Little Quality

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Family of 3 adults and 2 children staying 24th Dec 2022.
We normally really enjoy staying at Jetwing hotels inc Beach, Lagoon and even at St Andrews on our previous visit. 
As before St Andrews is a wonderful character building. The service in the bar area was first class on this visit. As was the Xmas meal.
Check-in was our first meh experience though. We are touring and some of us are on residency visas and not tourists. Unlike other hotel stays this trip where a copy of the visa is requested and it's done, this time an unprompted point was made by staff about us having the local rate discount which I had booked online and an almost disbelief by staff it was valid for westerners. It made us feel uncomfortable.
We were placed on the ground floor opposite the small courtyard. Within 5 meters of the dining area. Being Xmas I expected it to be festive as in louder around the hotel. During dinner there was live singing. We left the dining area at 2200  where there were only 2 to 3 tables left. At 2230 the music from the area was increased by 100% which was really loud in our rooms. I assumed it was a disco, karaoke and wished I had been placed in a room further away but being Xmas I was obviously sympathetic. At 0100 the noise was louder still and the quality of the singing had decreased. Wanting to sleep a member of our party went out to enquire how much longer it would last. It was then established that after 2230 no hotel guests were involved but instead it was the staff having a private party. I find this deeply inconsiderate and rude to fee paying guests and their families they had no regard to the noise levels. Instead of waking up Xmas day feeling festive and well rested we felt tired and annoyed.
title: Xmas letdown

placeInfo/address: No. 10, St. Andrew_s Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for one night on Christmas day. Unfortunately it was a disappointing experience as the rooms are not great. The style of the hotel is very British which is absolutely fine as that's the theme however it needs to be updated in the sense of new paint and things needing to be fixed. The room we were given was very disappointing, there were a number of marks on the walls and ceilings, the bathroom door was broken, the bathroom was dirty and had a used bar of soap which we thought was disgusting especially during times of covid, the water bottles provided were not sealed which to me meant that it has just been filled up and reused. We had lunch at the hotel and saw on 3 separate occasions 
of guest complaining to the staff. As my wife is gluten free (coeliac) and vegetarian we had to speak to the staff to see what they could do. The chef was able to make a gluten free soup however when it came out the waiter brought it accompanied with bread sticks which are not gluten free. I understand it could have been a mistake but I would expect better care. Working in a restaurant the staff should be more aware. After lunch we sat outside and ordered some drinks. My wife ordered a hot chocolate which was horrible, it tasted like it was burnt. We spoke to a staff member and they said that it didn't look right and offered to make us a new one but we declined. This drink was still included in our bill when we were checking out so had to waste 10minutes to have that removed. The dinner was ok but I would of expected better especially as it was Christmas day. The chef did walk my wife through the dishes to say what she could eat but after dinner she suffered with pain which was most likely to do with eating something which had gluten in it. We were also awaken at 3am with some people shouting outside our room which added to our bad experience.

I wouldn't recommend this hotel, the only reason I am giving it 2 stars rasher than 1 is because the chef did try to help my wife with her dietary requirements.
title: Dirty rooms, in need of refurbishment

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest Michael, Greetings from Sentido Heritance Negombo, Sri Lanka! We are elated to receive your great and constructive feedback. We have taken a note of your all concerns. We will definitely conduct a peer review and make necessary improvements. We encourage you to revisit us again in the future as we wish to provide a better hospitality service during your next visit. Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Ein kurzer Erfahrungsbericht von Reise Mai 2025.

Das Hotel sieht von aussen durchaus gut aus, wenn man die Kleinigkeiten nicht entdecken will.
Die Fotos sagen schon einiges aus, es wird sich bemüht, die Anlage sauber zu halten.
Ist bei der Menge an Krähen aber fast utopisch. Wie andere auch schon schrieben, kaum saubere intakte Liegen zu finden.
Immer aufpassen wo setzt man sich hin. Sonst ist Kleidung waschen angesagt....

Das Hotel wird wohl von den meisten Reisenden für 1-2 Nächste gebucht, wir waren wohl die Ausnahme mit 6Nächten.
Das bedeutet dann auch keine! Abwechslung beim FrühstücksBüffet!

Wir sind sehr früh gelandet - um 6:30Uhr schon im Hotel angekommen.
Klar da ist noch kein Zimmer fertig.... Es wurde gleich ein EarlyCheckIn angeboten, für schlappe 75USDollar?
Dafür darf man dann sofort auf ein Zimmer - Frühstück gibt es aber dennoch nicht? Das kennen wir auch schon anders.

In meinen Augen ist Management fehl besetzt, die Mitarbeiter sind im Service sehr bemüht, im Rahmen ihrer Möglichkeiten,
aber FrontOffice? pffff
Frage von mir wurde mal gestellt, wo ist die nächste Apotheke? Antwort - 50 Meter die Straße runter...
Ja da hängt ein Apotheken Schild, ein Supermarkt, SimLaden und Apotheke in einem Zimmerchen....
Es wurde aber keine Unterstützung angeboten? Sollen wir etwas besorgen?? Nichts! Und das von 3 Personen mit eher Langeweile hinter dem Counter.
Für 5 Sterne Hotel - da kennen wir anderes...

ownerResponse/text: Dear Valued Guest, Greetings from Sentido Heritance Negombo, Sri Lanka! We value your time and effort in sharing your experience and feedback with us. We have taken a note of your all inputs. We are extremely sorry, if anything did not meet your expectations. We will definitely conduct a peer review on your all inputs and make necessary improvements. We encourage you to make another visit as we wish to provide a better experience in the future. Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our second visit to Sri Lanka on a family holiday. After visiting the south west and south of the island, this time we decided to have a bit of convenience of the airport-proximity and stayed at Heritance Negombo for six nights in four rooms for the group. 

The hotel is perfectly located at the Negombo beach with nice surroundings and easy beach access. The lawns are very well kept. All rooms are sea facing and spacious enough. 

That’s where I run out of the positives for this place unfortunately. Comparatively, this was our worst Sri Lankan hospitality experience. Kindly let me begin:
- despite booking months in advance with requests to allocate rooms together (as travelling with 80+ old parents), albeit in the same wing, we were given rooms apart. The duty manager gave us sloppy excuses when challenged. The other request regarding birthday of a group member was completely ignored.
- one room wasn’t ready at checkin despite we arriving at 5pm. The cleaning was down in a haste with room full of mosquitoes when handed over to us. 
- the restaurant was shambles to begin with. On day one, over dinner, we were completely ignored over the other Caucasian guests with order not arriving for well over an hour. While we thought that this was an exception, unfortunately the trend was to be seen everywhere. 
- Most guests use this as one or two night stay at the start or the end of their tour. Having booked it for a long stay, we were astonished to see that breakfast spread was exactly the same every day which was a haphazard array of assortments with poor quality. Offerings at other similarly priced hotels in SL is far superior. 
- The staff lacked attention to detail and hardly acted to customers’ requirements. On regular occasions, meal (or general) requests were lost, miscommunicated or mismanaged. It reflected lack of proper training even at supervisory level. 
- My parents were left locked out of their room at 11pm for more than 30minutes due to low battery reflecting poor housekeeping but it was not that what irked us but the behaviour of a staff member who questioned us if we were valid guests for the room despite three time card renewal by the reception. 
- The restaurant menu lacked variety especially if you have dietary restrictions. My parents who were vegetarians just had couple of items on the whole a-la-carte menu to order from (imagine this is Sri Lanka which has abundance of vegetables and fruits). Even the SriLankan menu was sparse. There were no coconuts (even at outdoor bar despite being on the menu) or bananas (at breakfast) to be found during our long stay with excuses galore (again don’t forget this is land of bananas and coconuts but this place either finds Sri Lankan authenticity too demeaning or a nuisance to be bothered with). The cafe and Italian across the road, which was part of the hotel, again had very limited menu which meant that they hardly had any punters despite being at prime location and wonderful setting. 

On the whole, it was an underwhelming experience to say the least. It seemed that the management is trying hard to cater to western clients forgetting the fact the clientele are there to have an essential Sri Lankan experience.  The food offering is poorly thought through. And it might sound controversial but perhaps, they don’t want coloured guests, so I would avoid this place if you are not white as the experience reminded us of a colonial mindset (I know I’m saying this in 2025 but that’s how we felt).
title: A big disappointment!

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Serving staff Shambolic !

Made the mistake of dining over the road at the hotels cafe/ restaurant. 

Ordered a couple of cocktails, couple of starters, couple of mains and  later -a bottle of wine.
Cocktails arrived after 30 minutes - another couple arrived and these cocktails went to them! Further 15 minutes they arrived,starting to get concerned now because no sight of any service relating to the food.
After some encouragement, cajoling the starters arrived and within a few minutes we were informed that the main course were ready!!!

Not having finished our long awaited starters, we reluctantly accepted ( Didn’t want the food sitting on the side of the bench in the kitchen)

Couldn’t believe that one of the mains was cold - what a fiasco.
Manager happened to pass by, same time, all smiles , were we all well etc He got quite a shock to find out we were not!
Useless!
It’s not lower level staff that need sorting out - they will follow their lead
 Breakfast at the hotel, very uninspiring but ( because no one was going to ask me) I got up and asked the supervisor ( Who had been catching up with the head chef at breakfast, and quite a lot must be going on because they had a lot to chat to each other about)  Sarcastically I asked him if he worked here? He confirmed that he did work there and I duly ordered the coffee.

I never saw that guy again and of course, never got a cup of coffee.

Sums this place up - checked out extra early.
title: Hapless Staff

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at the Heritance for our last night in Sri Lanka before flying home. Compared to the hotels we had been staying at the service was extremely poor and we were glad we didn’t stay here for longer. The rooms however are very modern and nice. We had great beach views and the hotel in general is very well kept. The hotel is on the beach so you have the option to relax at the pool and wonder onto the beach as well. The only disappointment was the service in general and food options for vegetarians. We waited close to an hour for one snack at the bar and it wasn’t full or at peak time. The bar menu had very limited options for vegetarians and they didn’t have some of these available too. The main restaurant buffet had very few vegetarian options too so we opted for the a la carte menu which was ok for one night. In general the buffet was a lot smaller to what we had seen at other hotels. The service was poor at reception, not very welcoming and they didn’t really seem bothered. Perhaps this was down to us staying one night but as paying customers we would have expected much better. I wouldn’t call this a five star hotel as the service and food for vegetarians wasn’t good enough. Overall we would not recommend this hotel even for one night and would look elsewhere.
title: Very poor service!
