placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
I arrived from Australia after five years and brought my family to your hotel. We booked five rooms, but unfortunately, three of them were not ready when we arrived. This was especially challenging as we had elderly family members with us, making the situation quite unpleasant. Additionally, we were informed that we had to check out exactly at 12:00 p.m. After discussing the matter with the management, they eventually allowed us to check out at 1:00 p.m.

The reason given for the early checkout and the unprepared rooms was that a company named MASS had planned their stay, which we found to be quite inconvenient. As paying customers, we expected a higher level of service and were not satisfied with these issues. We did not come here to hear excuses. Overall, it was a very disappointing trip, and I cannot recommend this place to anyone.

Please avoid overbooking. It seems that prioritizing larger companies and neglecting accommodation for small families is driven by a desire for more revenue. If this is the case, please communicate this policy to guests. Sri Lanka has numerous hotels where we can find a more accommodating and enjoyable experience.
title: prioritizing larger companies and neglecting accommodation for small families is driven by a desire for more revenue

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We chose the Heritance hotel as the venue to celebrate a special wedding anniversary. At check in, we were taken to the dining room to choose a table for our special dinner. The day started well, a cake was delivered to our room, which we thank management for. Unfortunately, the day went downhill from there. When we arrived for dinner we were gobsmacked to find the table of our choice occupied!! We were shown to a table in the corner with no apology or explanation. Not one staff member acknowledged our anniversary, we weren’t even offered a complimentary drink or dessert - it was a total letdown.  The food was nice enough, but  on the other 3 nights at Negombo we ate delicious dinners at nearby restaurants, the combined cost of which was less than one meal at the Heritance!!
The dining room staff lack basic training. At all our 4 breakfasts, we had issues, a couple of examples - no place setting on the table we were seated at (3 waiters watched on as I took cutlery from another table, not moving a muscle to help), we ordered two white coffees and received 2 glasses of water!! This would be funny if it weren’t true. There is a total lack of supervision of the wait staff. 
Overall, this was a very disappointing stay. I wrote an email to convey my thoughts via the hotel website and still have not had a response. I will definitely let my travel agent know of our experience and could not, in all honesty, recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Disappointed!!

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Most hotels in Sri Lanka are horrible and don't offer buffet meals. The food is also where management has decided to cut corners
text:
I was told there was no Sunday buffet for lunch and dinner on arrival at the hotel yesterday, the reason given was that the occupancy was less than 50%.

Whilst your terms mentions that the hotel has the option to decide if the meal plan will be a la carte or buffet, it was not communicated that no buffet would be provided for yesterday's stay.  When we called the hotel on 26th October at 3.53 pm (refer call log screenshot below) to clarify about the check in time, request for early check in and to clarify what time the buffet ends, no mention was made of the meal plan being a la carte and were in fact told that the check in after 2pm will not affect our ability to avail ourselves of the lunch buffet. This was also never communicated to us when I contacted the central reservations team to reconfirm my online booking (refer email trail below). 

To make matters worse, the standard of the food served for lunch and dinner on a la carte basis was absolutely unacceptable for a 5 star hotel dining experience. Some of my concerns included the portion sizes of the starters and mail, the quality of the soups being something I can cook up at home, and the general lack of creativity and appeal of what one would expect to be served at a 5 star hotel. In fact, the meals we had would not even pass a 3 star meal service inspection if I am being brutally honest, no offence to anyone. Even the butter was not real butter, it was margarine, how very sad.

Finally, I must bring to your attention that even the room was not to the standard of a 5 star hotel. There was no bath robe or room slippers, the hair dryer was missing (we called and asked for one and was provided with a old and worn out hair dryer, why was the room not inspected before release to a guest?). Even the mini bar was empty. The pool circulator was also switched off on both yesterday and today and as a result the water was very heavy with contaminants. 

Moer than 48 hours after I left the hotel and being promised a resolution, the hotel management has done nothing to make amends.
title: A hard earned holiday, completely ruined

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are looking to stay in negombo, I advise that you stay in Jetwing Blue. Heritance Negombo is more expensive and the service is worse.
text:
Do not stay at Heritance Negombo. I travelled from the UK to Negombo and stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. It was the worst experience that I’ve ever had staying at a hotel.

During my stay, I woke up to noises of someone knocking on a door. Thinking it was mine, I woke up at 3am and heard loud, banging noises coming from outside my room. When I looked through the peep hole, there was a man waking around outside my room. I also heard noises from the room next door of furniture being dragged around. I decided to call reception from the phone in the hotel room, the phone rang and no one picked up. I called reception at least 4-5 times and all I got was an engaged tone.  At this time, the individual was still outside my room. 

Due to fear of safety, I decided to call my mother in law who was staying in the room next door. She also called reception many times and no one picked up. At this point, I could hear the individual walking around outside the room and whistling. I decided to call my parents who were staying with relatives and they decided to drive down to the hotel. My parents also called the hotel 10 times and, still, no one answered. My parents arrived at the hotel and went to reception to find the receptionist sleeping in the room next door. We asked to speak to the hotel manager, Mr Prasanna Silva, and we were not able to get through to him. We asked to speak to the security manager and they took c.30-40 mins to arrive. Eventually, we requested to see the security footage and we saw house keeping cleaning rooms at 3am. The hotel gave us no indication that rooms will be cleaned at this time and we did not even receive an apology. The staff did not take responsibility nor do anything to rectify this situation.

I requested that we speak to Mr Prasanna Silva, the front office manager, in the morning before we checked out as we had a flight to catch at 8am. He was no where to be seen at the hotel, he did not call to apologise for what had happened. When I eventually spoke to him, He merely told me that “nothing happened, no one tried to come in to your room, and therefore you should pay full price”. He communicated with me in a very rude and disrespectful manner, as I told him that I refuse to pay full price for my stay as I did not receive the 5* service this hotel somewhat suggests. I told Mr Prasanna that I would not be paying for the 2 x rooms for that night as neither myself or my mother in law slept that night. This was dealt by the hotel by calling the police and the whole security team arriving and surrounding my car to stop us from leaving. 

I was told that the hotels General Manager advised the hotel to call the police. They treated us as if we were thieves. It was the most horrific and distressing experience that I’ve ever faced during my stay in a hotel. It created a lot of stress for me and my family. 

The management of this hotel need to take FULL responsibility for what happened during my stay. Fortunately, I was safe and nothing happened. If someone was in danger or in need of help, there would be no one to help or even take responsibility. It is a huge security issue and disturbance to ask staff to clean rooms at 3am in the morning. Not only did it cause distress for myself, I was disturbed because of the noise that was made. It is unsafe for women who are staying by themselves. 

If you are looking to stay in a hotel in negombo, I recommend Jetwing Blue. Great staff and service. Unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked at the time I was staying and therefore stayed in this so called “5 star hotel”.
title: Poor safety and security for guests - lack of responsibly and accountability

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay was way below expectations.
- Poor service 
-60% of the pool was closed for maintenance (we did our reservation through the hotel team and nobody informed us).
- Food options are too little and no buffet.
-Spa prices are extremely high (even higher than spa in GCC)

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely designed hotel besieged by poor management, price gouging and a pool that's in dire need of maintenance. Recommend staying at Jetwing, Hilton or others for better value for money.

We came to Heritance mainly because we love the pool. Unfortunately the water was not clean - 2m visibility, murky greenish hue. And the smaller connected pool was closed as a third of the tiles are missing. One poor guy working at the swim up bar to service the whole outside area, whope six people stand around washing windows.

The price of everything was 2-3x other hotels. The rooms are more expensive. Wine at 12000LKR being sold for 8000LKR at neighbouring Jetwing. Massage for USD60 per hour is USD15 at Hilton. Burgers are USD20, elsewhere USD10. A humble coconut that sells for 100rupees on the street is sold for 600rupees plus service charge and taxes.

There are hardly any guests staying here, so they are cutting corners. Half the dinner and breakfast buffet is closed off, so the selection is poor. Much worse than Cinnamon or even Hilton.

Management and reception was a nightmare. They messed up our booking, took no responsibility for it, and then asked us to pay extra for our kid to have a bed that we had already paid for.

The heart of the problem is the hotel is near empty. So to make money, they just gouge you and then ask for tips. They don't have the people, so they aren't fixing the pool or providing at the buffets. Go somewhere else.
title: Price gouging, poor service, limited buffet and pool not maintained.

placeInfo/address: 175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We have been here in the past and booked the hotel again especially because of the nice buffet dinner we had enjoyed.  But this time we were really disappointed very much: the buffet dinner was offered only at the weekend, the other days have been downgraded (!) to a served dinner. When asking for the dinner buffet during the week too, the (honest and expected) response was that it is only profitable during the weekend when external guests show up!  The breakfast buffet - by the way - has been reduced too when compared to our former stay (same argument as before).  

Furthermore, the overall service was inconsistent: some days a turn-down service was delivered with fresh towels at the evening, some other days nobody showed up. Also, getting a refill of coffee and tea at breakfast was quite difficult: at the end we most often needed to get up and approach one of the staff asking for a refill. 

On the positive side: the staff has been very friendly and ready to help. 

Summary: You pay the full price but get only reduced service.
title: The Website Promises Much More Than What is Offered

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved our recent trip to Sri Lanka.
The only disappointment in accommodation was The Hill Club, Nuwara Eliya. When we arrived we were read the rules by a young man who was very abrupt! Very old fashion stuffy dress code rules that are certainly not suitable for most Australians on holidays.
 I had diarrhea one night and there was no spare toilet paper in our room, just the one! My husband walked around looking for help for 30 minutes early morning but no luck. I phoned the after hours number (0) 4 times but the message said wrong number! 

The next night I asked for a blanket at about 4pm and nothing arrived so I called back about 6ish and was told, “None left”! I was offered a hot water bottle but declined. Couldn't wait to leave. The Hill Club is not a hotel but a club and should NOT be considered for any stay. The curtains and carpets are threadbare and the place smells mouldy. No fridge in any rooms. No air conditioners in any room.

 I rate it as 1 star and that is for the gardens. Gardens were beautiful but that was the only positive thing I can say. Very disappointing to say the least!
title: Don't judge a book by the cover......

roomTip: Stay somewhere else!
text:
Our first impression of this historical building as we passed the (clay) tennis courts and up the driveway was ‘wow’.  Set on a hill amongst beautiful sculptured gardens, it looked very old colonial British.  The reality was, as we soon discovered, it was more like Fawlty Towers!

Everything inside is tired and worn.  The carpets have holes, the chairs have dips in the cushions and walls are scuffed.  

Our ‘welcome’ briefing actually had the opposite effect.  The tea was nice, but being told what to wear and when was disconcerting.  Some people knew there was a dress code, however we hadn’t been informed.

Anyway, because we hadn’t packed ball gowns we ate in the casual dining room (that was small and packed), with exactly the same menu as the formal room directly next store (that was large and almost empty). Ridiculous.  The evening meal was pure Fawlty Towers mayhem - orders all over the place, corked wine, average or inedible food, mix ups, over an hour for food to arrive, etc.  Our group universally agreed it was terrible. 

The wifi is hopeless - and they have a corkage charge if you’d brought your own drinks!  However, there’s no fridges in the rooms anyway.  And weirdly, our bathroom door had a deadlock! 

The positives - the staff were lovely and tried hard. They gave all the women flowers to celebrate International Women’s Day.  They left cookies and put hot water bottles in your bed during the turn down service!

This place might have been grand once, but it desperately needs a make over.  Also, it needs to decide if it’s a club or a hotel that is actually welcoming for guests.  They can’t expect to maintain a posh persona, when it’s not of a standard that warrants it.
title: Not Up to the Standard They Expect of Guests

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We sincerely regret that your stay did not meet your expectations and appreciate your detailed feedback. Your concerns regarding the hotel's upkeep, service standards, and food quality are taken very seriously, and we are reviewing them with the relevant teams.

We are especially concerned about the issue regarding food allergies, as guest safety is our top priority. We deeply regret any oversight in communication and have taken immediate steps to ensure that such situations do not occur in the future.

Your feedback is invaluable in helping us improve, and we truly appreciate both your positive comments and constructive criticism. We hope for the opportunity to provide you with a much-improved experience in the future.

The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Look for an alternate hotel to stay in during your stay in Nuwara Eliya
text:
Gosh this place needs overhauling. This was my second stay in 15 years at the Hill Cub and where as I thought it might have improved as it stated 4 * forget it!

The exterior is beautiful  and I can understand the attraction of keeping the charm of colonial feel for the tourists but seriously you need to get rid of the senior staff running the place and get staff who know how to greet and deal with customers.  

The interior requires a massive makeover, the carpets throughout the hotel are torn and worn.  There is no heating or air conditioning anywhere (and boy it can get really chilly at night.)  The bathrooms are very basic with broken tiles and can again get really cold.  You can't let any fresh air in as there are rats running up and down the water channels directly under the windows and we were afraid they would come in.  The food is second rate, frozen and cheap and even if you had the best chef in the world, they would not be able to serve anything palatable from what are they provided with.  The rest of the staff are wonderful and very amenable.

As a warning to anyone with food allergies, do not just rely on informing the senior staff of the nature of your issues, tell the more junior staff as they take note and relay it to the other staff members.  One of our party has a severe peanut allergy, which we had informed the hotel of not just prior to our visit  reminded them twice during our arrival.  Needless to say this was information was not passed to the relevant catering and serving staff and on the last night of our stay a desert with peanuts was placed.  We caught the fact that peanuts were in the dish before a mouthful was taken but when we addressed our waiters over the fact, they told us that neither they or the caterers had been informed of the issue.  Upon calling and speaking to the manager regarding the near miss he was apologetic but basically useless in addressing the matter.  

So to you tourists that are travelling to this beautiful country, I'd warn you against staying at this hotel if you are looking for a nice, comfortable stay whilst visiting Nuwara Eliya.
title: A sad hotel that needs a major overhaul of its interior and of its senior staff

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We sincerely regret that your experience did not meet your expectations and that you felt uncomfortable with the formal dress code for dinner. We understand how this may have been an inconvenience, especially without prior notice, and we apologize for any distress this may have caused.
Regarding the attire provided, we regret that it did not meet your standards, and we will review our clothing options to ensure that future guests feel comfortable and respected. We also appreciate your feedback about the dining experience and will take it into consideration as we continuously work to improve the quality of our services.
We deeply value all of our guests, and it is never our intention to make anyone feel excluded. We will review our policies to ensure they are applied fairly and consistently.
Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a more positive experience in the future.

Best regards,
The Hill Club Team
placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Booked unexpectedly as part of a tour, unaware and not prepared for the formal dress code requirements for dinner (booked Half board). The hotel was unable to book us into the informal restaurant so they offered to dress the male members of the party. The clothing on offer was at best from the charity shop or donated by OAPS. This was an utterly humiliating experience and the food in the restaurant was not of good quality. Also to see other nationalities being allowed to enter the formal restaurant in tracksuit bottoms and trainers is very discriminatory. The hotel felt like an old people’s home so not the vibe we were looking for!
title: Old people home vibe!

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The service was pretty average as you’d have to order an hour before you actually receive your food and/or beverage. I wouldn’t recommend the coffee or any hot bevy to do with milk as the milk tasted bland and the black coffee was super watery. The food was quite average as well, could’ve had runnier poached eggs. 
The best bit in terms of drinks were the cocktails, very well done and delicious.
The sights were quite breathtaking to see so many flowers and green grass, strange to see it in Sri Lanka but no complaints on that part. 
The beds were quite comfortable and very clean. There only thing about the bed was that with every movement I made, a loud creak noise occurred. The staff do place a hot water bottle underneath the sheets for the night which is very much needed. Could’ve used more blankets in the room as it does get pretty cold at night, even with a hot water bottle in your bed.
title: Hill Club Hotel

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Buono per cena ma non per dormire.
text:
Personale molto cortese. Purtroppo però le la struttura interna risulta molto trasandata e vecchia. Le stanze sono leggermente sporche e i bagni rotti. 
Il giardino esterno è molto curato e piacevole. 
Abbiamo cenato al ristorante con abiti formali forniti dalla struttura e abbiamo mangiato bene. All’interno della struttura fa abbastanza freddo. Tutto sommato niente di eccezionale.
title: Niente di eccezionale

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Choose different accommodation.
text:
My wife and I stayed 3 nights, from 2 May. At 4.55am on 6 May we were rudely awakened by the sound of 3 or 4 tour buses arriving. For about 20 minutes we had to tolerate the noise of the engines running about 30 feet from our windows, and the Chinese tour group talking whilst getting organised on the buses. I complained to the Secretary/Manager the next day, but he was totally unapologetic, and offered no compensation of any kind.
The service is very slow.  We ordered dinner, and it took 30 minutes for the soup to arrive. Moreover many of the wait staff speak very poor English, and appear to be poorly organised by their managers.
It does deliver on the old world charm. However,  at US$145 per night, one can do far, far better. All in all very overrated.
title: Noise and poor customer service

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
This was not for us.  We enjoy a bit of colonial heritage but this misses the mark.

We were almost pounced on when we entered and asked if we would  like to be shown around.  There was a charge for this as it is a members only club.  That said, they took our money for the tour and also for a couple of drinks that took a long while to arrive so not sure where the "members only" comes in?

The gent who showed us around hung around for longer than was necessary but soon cleared off after we gave him a  tip - not what one would expect from an establishment   trying to stand out as elite.  Also, a little deodorant would not have gone a miss.  

We were pleased to just have a drink as felt beng forced to wear other peoples clothes to use the restaurant in th evening was a touch ridiculous.  We have stayed in far more salubrious places that don't insist on this.
title: Underwhelming

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The high tea was far from fresh; everything was dried out when served out and we didnt get everything mentioned on de menu. The service was really bad (especially for the price) and when we gave our feedback they didn’t respond and despite we asked for the manager he never showed. When you are looking for a high tea in Nuwara Eliya you should definitely go to Tea Lounge by the Grand hotel.
title: Bad high tea

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We were doing a road trip through Sri Lanka and someone recommended popping into this hotel for a drink.

We arrived at reception and were asked to complete a form, detailing our passport information and contact telephone number. We declined to give this information as we didn’t feel it was necessary to have a quick drink. While I was filling in part of the form, the guide took my (exceptionally expensive) camera and without asking permission, took photos. 

We really just wanted a drink but were pushed into a tour of the ground floor of the hotel at a cost of 300 rupees per person.  The hotel is like stepping back in time and we certainly wouldn’t choose to stay there.  The tour lasted about 10 minutes and that was more than enough for us, it was so boring. The guide continually pointed out pictures of our queen….as if we didn’t know who she was!  We were then guided into the bar. My husband went to the gents and the guide stood at my side the whole time.  Even when my husband came back he continued to stand which was more than awkward.  We then realised he wanted a tip so husband gave him some money. Would you believe he still stood and my husband said “exactly how much more do you want”. We paid him again and he left us. The tip cost 5 times the price of the tour!

Half way through the tour the guide went down the dangerous path of guessing our ages, not something I would expect from someone I met 5 minutes ago.  To my astonishment, he said “ I’m sure you would have looked much prettier when you were younger”. I was horrified at his rudeness.  To make matters worse, the guide could do with addressing his hygiene as the smell of BO was quite overpowering.  

I had a gin and tonic that I could not finish as the tonic was rancid (penguin I think).  We could not wait to get out the hotel. 

This experience was the only bad one we had during our 4 week stay.   

This hotel makes an attempt at being special but for us, the experience was poor.
title: Rude tour guide, over priced and bad G&Ts

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Need a jacket and tie for dinner with shirt, shoes, and long trousers.

Dinner is fixed menu, even for room service. Dinner is $30 per person
text:
If you like playing dress up (jacket and tie required for dinner!), like sleeping in a very noisy (creaky) bed, and like to have dinner where the only option is a set menu (icluding room service!), then this is your place.

Good location within walking distance of town. Rooms clean.

Special mention to staff Siva and Arul who took good care of us.
title: Poor

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Of all the places I stayed in my three weeks in Sri Lanka, this was by far the worst. It was drab, and not really a hotel. My room was small. The staff all looked terrified and I have never had such a discourteous welcome. I expected a gracious welcome from this former gentleman's club but nobody knew how to behave properly. The Grand Hotel round the corner is clearly the one to stay in.
 One out of ten, the one because a very nice gentleman came and brought a hot water bottle to warm the chilly bed.
title: Awful

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Breng een das en jasje mee
text:
Helemaal geen goeie locatie, niks in de buurt en enorm koud. Tijdens het diner was het ijskoud en dus heel onaangenaam om te dineren. De gangen volgden elkaar enorm snel op en de obers stonden je de hele tijd aan te staren.
Je kreeg een warmwaterkruik die de kamer zou moeten opwarmen, maar de bedden bleven kil en vochtig. Tijdens het ontbijt moest je kiezen voor eieren OF wafels…geen uitgebreid ontbijt dus. Je moest een das en kostuumvest dragen tijdens het diner terwijl wij de enigen in het hotel waren…zeer ongeloofwaardig en lachwekkend dus. We raden dit ten zeerste af en vinden dit dan ook het slechtste hotel waar we ooit al verbleven. Absoluut geen aanrader.
title: Koud, onaangenaam, ongemakkelijk

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently visited the Hills Club with great expectations, drawn in by the promise of an elegant ambiance. While the cocktails were good and the requirement of a vest and tie added to the upscale atmosphere (though a bit old-world), I must admit that my overall experience fell short of what was advertised.

1. Regrettably, the behavior of the bartender - though probably not wilfully ill-mannered - did not meet the high standard claimed by the establishment. Their attitude was a noticeable departure from the polished and professional demeanor one would expect in such a refined setting (hugging and kissing clients on the cheek is NOT okay, and bluntly asking if the clients are a couple or friends is a bit odd in such environment). It was disappointing to have interactions that did not align with the upscale nature of the place.

2. Worth noting that the cocktails were pricey (LKR ~4,000-5000, ~USD 12-15 at the time of this comment)

I hope that the management takes this feedback constructively and works towards ensuring a consistent and elevated experience for all patrons.
title: High Hopes Dashed by Mixed Experience

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Least experience on Sri Lanka! Went there at 7.15pm to watch the building / have a drink. Security guard told us to go away; a civil person solved the situation. The front office lady sat us into a casual bar (no atmosphere); told us that this is a British style club (with separate ladies and men facilities…) and I can borrow a tie and a jacket for free; she has to check for the ladies dresses with her manager. In the meantime, the distance-free barman hugged us (the one and only time within 3 weeks that somebody touched us!) and got onto our nerves. I had to remind the lady re the check. Although we repeatedly told them we don’t want to have dinner but only a drink at the nice bar, they (finally the general manager) tried to forced us to have dinner there. After 25 unforgettable minutes, we left and went back to our hotel (Grand Hotel). Ah, sorry, forgot to mention that the barman threw one glass of wine on the floor, my wife saved the 2nd one from falling down. No sign of excuse. When he tried to hug our daughter for goodbye, she said no and went out. 

I have been to several clubs in London - the Hill Club has NOTHING in common!!!
title: Worst experience on Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Check everything before you book.
text:
NOT FOR US!
We were booked in here during our 3 weeks holiday in Sri Lanka.
Filled in all necessary paperwork, then came a few rules.....Formal dress code for the dining room, ..we had smart casual wear so we were told we would have to use the " Casual" dining room.
On the way to our room were signs on all walls saying.  SILENT,  we meet our tour guide later on in the library to arrange our trip out, he used his phone and was told rather bluntly NO phones to be used in public areas.
Had we known all this before we booked we would never have gone there, we didn't stay, instead our wonderful tour company arranged another,more relaxing hotel and we moved straight out of the Hill Club.
title: NOT FOR US!

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Very long delays in getting service. Plan well in advance.
text:
A very old structure in urgent need of a full renovation. Very old and dusty.
Cold rooms with pleasant surprise of a hot water bottle 
Restaurant was no way to the level we expected. Staff tried to be as helpful as possible but some require additional training!
Very disappointed indeed.
title: In urgent need of a refurbishment.

placeInfo/address: No 29 Grand Hotel Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We were booked to stay here for two nights and did not enjoy the experience at all.  The club smells musty and is in dire need of an upgrade and a good clean.   We had a very unappetising dinner served by staff wearing dated uniforms and white gloves.  The mushroom vol au vent looked and tasted awful and was followed by roast pork which was equally unappetising and my husband woke up being ill during the night, so we left promptly the next morning and moved to a nearby hotel.  I would not recommend anyone staying there.
title: Ghastly place
